review_body: Olivia did an amazing job making sure my stay was pleasant. I highly recommend this location solely based on my opinion of Olivia and her proffesionalism. The location was close enough to the beach that the walk was pleasant

This was a perfect hotel for us: quiet, located a nice walk from the beach, close to restaurants and shops, delicious breakfast included, good size room with balcony to enjoy the outside, extremely helpful staff. The hotel has a wonderful, relaxing feel. It's on the smaller size which was great as it made us feel very much at home. After our trip we realized that we had forgotten something at the hotel. Thanks to the guest supervisor, Olivia Fields, we were able to have the item shipped to us. She was very professional, patient and understanding of the situation. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

My and my husband had an amazing staycation! The staff and ambiance were absolutely fantastic. The breakfast was a nice touch in the morning. Unfortunately because of the pandemic we were not allowed to use the pool or sauna but that's all the more reason to come back!

The Aqua Oasis is an exceptional place to stay.... including the people ... those that work there are so friendly, kind, and always smiling.... This makes my 3rd time staying there and I'll be there again when I go back.... Really great location too.

I unfortunately do not remember the name of the employees, but whoever was working as a bellhop on April 9th between the times of 4pm-6pm did an amazing job at helping me move my luggage up to my room and was very helpful with telling me about calling the front desk at anytime I needed help. Also the woman working the front desk the morning and afternoon of April 10th, 2020 was amazing and so kind. We had a very heart to heart conversation about what is happening right now with the Covid-19 and she made me feel at home, as if I was speaking with family. I unfortunately had to move back to California after living in Hawaii only a short time and this hotel helped me during this move back home. I appreciate all of the staff and thank you for being open during these times.

We ended up going to Hawaii during the beginning of the coronavirus outbreak. Things were starting to shut down around us and the weather wasn't great for a lot of the days. Our stay at this hotel was a bright spot of our trip as the staff was very friendly, the rooms were comfortable and well taken care of, and the continental breakfast was a really nice addition. Our experience with the staff, especially Olivia, was top notch. Her aloha spirit and willingness to help us and be flexible was so appreciated.'Thank you for a great trip!

We stayed 3 nights at the Aqua Oasis hotel in Waikiki.The location was great and the price was way less than nearby hotels. There is an amenity fee, which is described quite well at the start of this listing. All hotels in Waikiki (in Hawaii?) charge an amenity fee, so this is not a gotcha.We were in room 911 (easy to remember). It had a king bed, TV, A/C, table and 2 chairs, desk and chair, electronic safe, coffee maker, and a small fridge with a freezer compartment. There was a balcony with a table and 2 chairs.The bathroom had a big tub and shower.We arrived by car, early, and asked if they could hold our bags until check-in, so we could go sightseeing without worrying about luggage in the car. Sure, no problem. The man at the curb also suggested alternate parking, when I didn't want to valet park the car. He showed me the metered parking lot behind the hotel, but cautioned that it was not fenced in, and could be full.We used this lot, which cost (max) $25 for 24 hours, or $15 from 5 PM to 6 AM. Since we were gone during the day, we used the latter fee. Since street (metered) parking was free for 2 hours with a handicap permit (which we had), the effort to move the car at 6 AM was worth it.The breakfast would run out of things and could be very crowded, especially during rush hour, so plan ahead. We did enjoy the daily newspaper, and our friends (who are smokers, and arrived the day after us) really enjoyed the fish pond smoking area. I even tried the small hotel pool one day.There is a restaurant (can't remember the name) which is directly accessible from the lobby area.The staff was always friendly, and we enjoyed our stay. We would stay here again.

Maria is the lady at reception, who made us feel very welcome for our 2 night stay, before we cruised the Ovation back to Sydney via Tahiti and New Zealand.The hotel is situated in a convenient position close to shops, restaurants and beach. The apartments are kept clean and there is a pool and wi-fi is complementary. Breakfast was included for us, and we felt at home staying here.

Thank you Olivia for your Aloha. Just ask to extend stay 1 more night as room was very nice & since they were consolidating room inventory she ask if I don't mind moving for an upgrade. Took 10 minutes & upgrade was wonderful. Mahalo Olivia will stay again

Great service at a wonderful property - the staff are amazing and very helpful. Great location close to everything you need with restaurants, shops and beach at your doorstep. Would recommend this property to all my friends & family.

An additional $28 is added when checking in, then when laying in bed the AC constantly leaks water on your head. I decided since I was only there one night, since they already told me I could not switch rooms because I was in a handicap room so I stayed. I then hung off the bed to avoid the water dripping on my face.

Whole Aqua Oasis team a friendly (esp Rachel at reception), whole resort is sparkling clean and step outside amongst all the shops. The building is a little dated and needs a "hug" but with a free continental breakfast for free it is great value.

Thanks Olivia at the desk for awesome service and aloha. Had a staycation at this adorable hotel. Very clean and modern. Small pool and sauna available at a cute lounging deck with hanging chairs in a tropical and peaceful atmosphere. I enjoyed the Hawaiian music playing at the pool. The complimentary breakfast is weak and there’s no jacuzzi, otherwise I’d give this jewel 5 stars. Can’t believe the low price. I’ll be back!

The hotel is in a great location. The value is excellent. The service was great and the suggestions that we received from the hotel clerk were very helpful. I was able to walk to the beach, shops and dining within just a few blocks.

We stayed here for our last 6 days in Wikkii and we found what I can only say was a lovely, clean and fresh hotel . The staff were great and genuinely kind as well as helpful all though our stay. Loved the breakfast which was just right for our needs. Our room was spacious and very clean, loved the addition of a fridge as well as the tea and coffee making facilities. Nothing was too much trouble with all our requests. I want to especially thank Olivia and Rachel for their kindness and help every time we needed them. Love this hotel, I absolutely recommend a stay here! Perfect position, nice quiet location but very close to all the amenities that you'll ever need. If come back we will definitely stay here.

All of the staff were excellent in helping out with suggestions and directions and anything else you may inquire about. Very friendly and helpful. There continental breakfast is not much but it will get you by and there are so many places in walking distance that you will enjoy. I did not rent a car and used the bus system which is so good.

A mid priced hotel but the location was pretty noisy. Had an upper room facing Lewer Street in the Hibiscus Tower. Very clean, very spacious and the beds were fairly comfortable. No complaints or issues with the room. Breakfast was basic continental, bagels, toast, pineapple, oranges, powdered donuts, blueberry muffins every day. A small dipping pool that’s not heated but clean. The location is terrific for getting around by foot with a 10 minute walk to the beach. BUT THE NOISE! Every night until 2:00 or 3:00 in the morning from a close by bar. Then starting before 5:00AM every morning either truck deliveries, garbage pickup or construction across the street. Previous reviews mentioned noise but sorry management, we’ll not be back.

The location of the hotel was perfect for being right downtown and just two blocks away from the beach and lots of shopping & restaurants. The valet parking was very convenient and the attendant was very prompt in retrieving our vehicle when needed. The hotel and our room were clean but Some of the walls, flooring, etc are definitely tired looking. Could use some upgrades. The staff was very friendly and helpful. in fact one of the evening desk staff helped us find a really good Local restaurant/bar to eat our first night and we loved it so much - we went back for breakfast! Our room was situated over the street and some of the clubs played loud music until 5am! This was annoying because we could hear them even with our patio door closed and air conditioner on! I understand this is not the hotels fault but very surprised there are no noise ordinances in Waikiki after 2am! My biggest complaint Was the hotel continental breakfast. There was so little to choose from- can not be called a continental breakfast at all! They offered only a few bread/ pastry items, cold cereal and pineapple or cantaloupe fruit. There was NO protein items- no hard boiled eggs- no yogurt- no oatmeal— it was pretty weak! Can’t believe they said this was one of the amenities we have to pay extra for! Very disappointing!

Hotel is conveniently located near Waikiki Beach. Not the Ritz but budget friendly hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and roomy. We would stay here again.

The hotel was great for what my wife and I needed. It’s on a busy street, but sits in the back. It’s hard to explain, but in a good way. We arrived on 2/08/2020 to a warm welcome from the receptionist. The check in area is open air, really nice with a pool and cool pond area. Everything was super clean. We were in a king size suite room 701. The room was huge. It came with a full kitchen and silverware. We never used it, but the option was nice. The AC worked, tv worked, bed was comfortable, but the pillows were really hard. The only downside to the room was the outdoor noise at night. I was able to sleep through it for the most part, but I did wake up each night to some loud screaming. Our last night (2/12) someone was screaming at the top of their lungs around 1:30am for about 20min. I know these issues are not on the hotel, but if you’re a light sleeper, bring earplugs.

The hotel is very tired and needs to be refurbished, however you are in Hawaii, so if on a budget the positives are, location, good shower, clean, good bed, good air con and a free continental breakfast (bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, coffee and juices) there is fresh water available all day, the pool area is tiny and is shaded by the buildings later in the day but obviously the beach is the attraction in Hawaii.

We stayed here overnight only....from the airport on the start of our vacation. It was great. Check in and check out was very easy with friendly staff. Room was very nice and clean. Did not use the shower because we were only there for probably 12 hours. Breakfast was great as well. So glad it was included. Previous reviews stated that it was limited options. But I found it plentiful ( from coffee, assorted juices, cereals, bagels, toast, fruit, pastries). Definitely recommend this hotel. Loved the Hawaiian Tropic toiletries as well!

This is probably the most reasonable hotel accommodations that offers fantastic location, convenience, comfort and an amazing customer staff. The CON: PARKING Price is insane but is almost normal in the surrounding community walking distance to Waikiki beach and all the amenities. You might want to figure out another place to overnight park and not to pay for hotel's parking. Also, I am against the resort fees that hotels charge especially when I will not use any of the amenities. It is a sneaky way to hide the room cost and make the room cost look like great value. It is still reasonable value in comparison.

Due to an early morning flight arrival we got to the hotel about 8.30am and due to a long tiring flight we just needed a room to shower and rest. The receptionist wasnt very helpful she just says checkin time at 3 and I cant promise anything early although a NOTE was stated on our accomodation booking due to an early arrival the hotel will try for an early checkin. We waited around the lobby area very exhausted. We went for a walk around the city and kept coming back and forth to the reception if by any luck we can get checked in like 11 or midday. The receptionist (I forgot her name) she did not acknowledge us at all during the numerous times we popped about around the reception area. She didnt have the decency to at least offer us a snack or water from the lobby as we were very tired after a long flight. Cases like these the front office or especially the receptionist shouldve prioritised our room. Hotel has to make guests happy and go out of their way to attend guests needs in every possible way. She could see we were exhausted and kept going out and coming back again and sitting around the lobby waiting. Never did she come to update us on our room and ask how we are etc. Im thinking of our elderly folks what if this was the case with them. Will she neglect them the same as she did to us. Finally we got checked in after 3 when we came back from lunch. Room was ok but an old musty smell lingered throughout our stay. Housekeeping staff were awesome and cleaning standards superb. The other downfall to our stay was the breakfast. No real hot food for breakfast. Like eggs and spaghetti or eggs and bacon. The dusted donuts they had couldve been replaced with cream donuts or savouries on other days. Also the breakfast was always full and not enough space to accommodate the guests. Guests had to sit round the pool area or near the reception area due to lack of tables and chairs. This is the first hotel I have stayed at that breakfast is only 2 hours. Very shocking!!! At least 6 to 10am or 7 to 10am. Guests want to sleep in but have to attend breakfast as their aware its only for 2 hours and want to make their moneys worth. The breakfast staff need re training again in all areas. There must be a staff waiting on the guests and clearing dirty plates. Most of the time dirty plates are not cleared for 10minutes or more on a table. Very poor service. A tremendous mahalo to the housekeeping staff and also to the pm shift receptionist the small short european female and the asian guy who were always helpful and politeful.

Excellent location in the heart of Waikiki.We had a junior suite with two double beds and a pull-out, perfect for the five of us.Great complimentary WiFi and you even get a free breakfast at no cost (toast, cereal etc but good enough)Olivia at the front desk is a Goddess and Carolyn is the most amazing concierge you will ever findThanks for a great holiday guys, we will definitely be back!!!

1013号室に滞在しました。Lewers streetは繁華街でどこへ行くのも便利、カラカウア通りとクヒオ通りの間という抜群のロケーション。それでこのお値段なのですから、文句を言うのは野暮というものです。スタッフはフレンドリーで、The Busのためやチップのために両替を頼んでも快く引き受けてくれました。その上で、いくつかケアしておくべき点を挙げます。朝食は無料ですが、シンプルなパンとペストリー、フルーツとジュース、コーヒー紅茶のみです。ハムやチーズはありません。また、日本名の男性スタッフさんがいらっしゃいますが、二世の方なので日本語はお勉強中とのことです。斜め向かいのパブは3:30amまでライブをしていますので普通に騒がしいです。プールは小ぶり。バスタブはあり。アメニティにボディクリームがついているのはGood。唯一困ったのは、どうやらテレビ台に虫の巣がありまして、コーヒーメーカー周りと台で毎回小さなシロアリのようなものを見かけたことでしょうか。累計50匹は潰しましたが、きりがありませんでした。駆除してほしいなとは思いますが、まあ、このお値段ですから、異常に高いオーシャンビューのホテルに泊まるより賢明だと思っています。Amenity Feeは1日25ドルかかりますから、予算に織り込み済みで滞在してください。Hi, please could you expel the aunts in Room 1013. I have killed more than 50 but there are still many.

I must let any visitors to Waikiki know to book into a hotel called Aqua Oasis. We had an unfortunate incident occur at our previous hotel Aqua Ohia. We stayed one week and were going to extend our stay for a further 4 days but as they had no hot water for our whole stay we decided to cancel. Instead we were given the name of Aqua Oasis and I spoke to Olivia on reception and my goodness what a difference in attitude and totally helpful. The rooms were clean, we had lovely bathroom facilities and with hot water and included in our price a Continental Breakfast. I cannot stress the wonderful attitude of all the staff at this hotel and in particular Olivia. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to any other visitor intending to find a medium priced hotel to stay in and close to all shops, restaurants etc. Also a bonus is that we entered the Bishop Museum by showing our hotel swipe card.

This hotel was amazing value and very close to Waikiki beach n shops with public transport near too !! Clean and breakfast was good but not much choice as we knew !! Staff were very helpful and friendly and room clean !!

The resort staff (other than one person) were not only disinterested but almost invisible The pool area is incredibly small, I felt it was bigger from the website and you access through the lobbyThey don’t have umbrellas for the rain, which is fine but it took so long too find anyone to say they don’t Our room was dated and overlooking the mechanical machinery of the galleria so too loud to open the doors or sit on the lanaiHotels do get dated in Honolulu but this one us past just a bit tiredBe sure you ask for a room that isn’t close to the galleriaThe positive is that you are super close to the action and the rain does not take long to end usually I think they are understaffed and if they were better resourced you could probably get quicker attention and maybe a more interested engaged staffAll in all l know I would never recommend at the least you don’t want to dace Lewers street

Nice to stay in a smaller hotel off the Main Street and yet close to the beach, restaurants, the bus and shopping. My room was clean and the bed comfortable. The continental breakfast was good. There are a number of seating areas, including a quiet spot by a pond. Suggest asking for a higher floor just to block out street noise if you like to retire early. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Aqua Oasis is in a great location with very friendly staff. Olivia, especially was super helpful and provided great recommendations for our drive around Oahu. The location is great, but can be noisy. It would have been nice to have breakfast changed up from day-to-day, but it was adequate.

Olivia and pasha at the front desk are awesome!! Answered all my questions and remembered me from the day before. It made me feel wonderful. The hotel is awesome! Great room for a great price! We need more of these two women working with the public! Thank you!

We Highly Recommend this Hotel. Great Value!!!! Best Location!! Everything was in walking distance, the Restaurants, Souvenir Shops, the Mall, many other stores, and of course Waikiki Beach. Our room was very spacious, big bathroom with a Shower/Big Size Tub and a Bidet, plus a kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and a stove. Staff was very pleasant and friendly, made you feel right at home. Hotel has their daily Breakfast in the open lobby seating area, which is perfect before heading out on your daily activities. You can even use the Hotels Towels for your trip to the Beach! We highly recommended staying here and we will definitely return here on our next Visit. Mahalo Aqua Oasis Staff for a Wonderful Stay, this was my Daughters and Hubby’s 1st time to Hawaii.

We spent two nights here before crusing Hawaii. The hotel is clean and rooms were spacious however the two bars opposite were vety loud and music and people on the street below unril 4.30am with the police called to fights both nights. The hotel explained that they have had issues with the bars. This is not just holiday season.Breakfast was ok but not enough space for all the guests to eat, so had to wait some mornings or join other tables, sit on sun loungers.Other than that good loaction to the beach and shops.

We stayed here for a few days in October, it was amazing we were given a free upgrade to a suite on the top floor. The staff was so attentive, shout out to Olivia she always greeted us with a smile and remembered what we said our plans would be and always asked how it went. I cant wait until our next trip to Hawaii and will definitely be staying here! A couple things to point out, there was some noise but that is expected for a city and didn't bother us at all and the pool was small but perfect for a dip after a hot day walking around.

Bright, airy lobby of hotel is inviting with pond in the back. They gave us an up grade to a large suite with a lani and comfy kingsize bed. The hotel is very clean and fresh.The location is excellent, close to the beach but far enough away from "street life" that is prevelant further down Kapolani. All staff were friendly and helpfu, I have nothing bad to say about my experience, I will definitley rebook next time I visit Waikiki.

I have 5 day reservation with hotel.com web site. I'm very disappoint the price break down on the final hotel statement. I place order with hotel.com , they have the best deal than these other vendor.First final cost $867.64 (included room+tax +hotel resort+breakfast: mean everything). And 1 day before I have the right to cancel my booking hotel.com send email try to fishing me the price: Total: $742.64, I pay less than so why not.Right at the time check in at the hotel, they charge me right away: Deposit Transfer : $ $146.58 on top all charge I have to pay.(what is that charge I never hear before)Final statement: $866.36.My experience when I booking with Vendor. I pay to the vendor not to the hotel. I only pay to hotel any extra I use from hotel during the time I stay (as: food, drink .....or lost the tower ...)hotel.com isn't honest business they hid a lot of fee charge try to fishing youI call hotel customer service they won't solve the problem and said wait to talk with the hotelKeep away from hotel.com

Amazing hotel tucked away right in the midst of Waikiki. Close to beach, restaurants, convenience stores. The staff are awesome. Friendly, polite and always going the extra mile. Nice continental breakfast included. Rooms super clean.

I stayed here during my first visit to Waikiki in Honolulu. The room was large and had a very comfortable King size bed. The pillows were comfortable too. The bath room was fine, with a large soaker tub (be careful getting in and out of it.)I was on the 3rd floor, but the street noise below was a bit much (though it is Waikiki.) They offered a nice continental breakfast each morning. All things are within easy walking distance of the hotel. And the checkin and checkout was smooth. Olivia was very helpful in checking out. (TV did not work though.)

Olivia was ready at the front desk to greet us with a big smile. She was so kind and helpful as we had just been traveling for over 16 hours. We got to check in early when they had finished our room and she helped us with whatever we needed. Her service went above and beyond helping us have an amazing time in beautiful Hawaii!

Stayed here for one night with my husband. We were traveling for a doctor's appointment so we checked in after 9pm and out by 6:30am. Online it stated there was self parking for a fee. They actually only offer valet parking for $40! This plus a $28 resort fee that we were charged even though we couldn't use any of the amenities included in the fee seemed a little high to me. The room was large and clean, and the price of the room itself was good. I would not stay here again but it worked for the night.

Olivia at the front desk was so helpful and kind in changing are rooms around to make our stay so pleasant. Thanks Thanks Olivia you were so super and nice to us every time we saw you. It was always nice seeing your smiling face!

A very nice hotel located near the shopping street and beach. We were helped by Olivia who was so kind and helpful. We had a fantastic stay and will definitely book a room in this hotel again in the future.

My friend and I came to Hawaii for her 60th birthday. We had an absolutely amazing trip thanks to the staff at Aqua Oasis! Mike, the valet, was such an excellent worker and extremely helpful! He always offered us assistance, suggested good places for us to visit and just overall was such a blessing! I highly recommend this hotel. The staff are friendly and always willing to help.

Spent a week at this hotel. It is an older establishment but well maintained. Housekeeping staff are excellent and very friendly unfortunately we did not find this with one on the receptionists who appeared to have an issue with everything being a problem.Continental breakfast is fantastic and a great way to start the day.Hotel is situated in an excellence location being close to shopping and a short walk to beach.

This is an older property but well maintained and is in a great location.The staff is wonderful, especially Olivia at the front desk. I had messed up my reservation and she was able to reaccommodate us and when we needed to be moved due to noise she offered to move us (I didn't have to ask) and then went the extra step and upgraded us all done with a smile and positive attitude. Everyone we had interactions with was friendly, helpful and good at their job. I was in the travel industry for 30 years and have stayed a lot of hotels and this is the first one I gave a rating to. We would stay here again!

Lovely, older hotel right in the middle of Waikiki. The people were friendly. Service was great Breakfast was continental with fresh fruit, bagels, toast and cereal. When we checked out, they gave us each a Hawaiian cookie. We booked the junior suite which was a huge room with a bid balcony, fridge, sink and microwave.

We had a nice stay at Aqua Oasis for 1 week. Clean, helpful staff and great location near the shopping strip, close walk to the beach. The same breakfast every morning was a bit monotonous but all in all good for the price. The photos are the view from our 10th floor balcony.

I was very impressed with their great customer services, the team was cordial and very helpful. Olivia radiant smile and good attitude made the experience !I will reserve this hotel on my next trip for sure.A Big Mahalo,Rich

Check in was quick and we were offered bag storage as we were very early. We were given free breakfast, which was a surprise and most welcome. Nice clean, good sized room with a comfortable bed and a bath, which was nice. Great location near lovely restaurants and 10 minutes walk to the beach. Right in amongst some great shopping. Just a very simple continental breakfast offered and a small pool, which was enough to cool off in. Friendly, helpful staff, desk manned 24 hours. Great fast checkout. Definitely coming back! Thanks.

We were three couples. Rooms were all great. Very clean and well furnished. The staff were excellent in every way. Check in and check out was fast and without any difficulty. We had a car but many stores and the beach were within walking distance.

We stayed for 8 nights in this central location. A walk to most things, dining and attractions. Close to beaches and pickup for travel groups. The room was spacious enough for two. The bathroom ok but the bath a little high to get into for older people. We had breakfast included but choice was limited and so was seating. Needs to be 7 to 10am. Two hours not enough time. Pool nice but small. Has laundry for guests which is coin operated and welcome. Lovely girls on the desk, very helpful and friendly. Overall a nice stay and would again. Well priced as well. Parking is valet only at 39 dollars a night. Local parking available behind a bit cheaper only limited.

My daughters and I had a wonderful girls trip to the Aqua Oasis! Evelyn and her team created a memorable stay for us and treated us with warm aloha. I forget the wonderful lady's name that checked us in but she lovely to us upon arrival. The housekeeping staff did an awesome job providing a very clean room and keeping us stocked during our stay. I liked that there were enough towels, blankets and pillows as that is usually something I need to ask for more of when I stay somewhere. The amenity fee has a great value with the continental breakfast and it is a fun way to meet folks from all over. Overall, the Oasis felt very warm and friendly and it ended with smiling Marie at the front desk giving us a fond aloha upon check out. Thank you everyone at Oasis, we will tell all our friends how wonderful you are!!

Great hotel. Close to everything yet far enough away from the rush of Waikiki. The facilities were more than adequate and the common area with the koi pond is a nice touch. Olivia and the entire staff were wonderful. Enjoy your stay here :)

Our stay was amazing. The room was very clean, housekeeping took care of us every day. The check in process was smooth and fast and the staff was so accommodating, especially Mike! You guys are awesome!

We were very happy with our two night stay here before cruising back to Australia.The location is excellent, with everything you need close by.We were happy to find we had been upgraded to a larger room which was spacious and very comfortable.The breakfast provided was good. Loved the fresh pineapple, oranges and bagels.The pool was small but great for a quick dip to cool off.Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

We stayed here for 1 week in October. We picked this hotel due to it's location, price, and the fact that it has continental breakfast which is something that makes traveling easier and something you don't have to worry about. When we got there, the valet got our luggage from our shuttle and took it immediately upstairs while we were checking in. I'm going to breakdown parts of the hotel for those who are looking through reviews.Our hotel room was in the tower closest to the entrance, so we were not above the karaoke and steak house on the other tower. I sleep with ear plugs in because I'm not used to sleeping with my parents in the same room (and they wake up early.) I didn't think noise was an issue, but at times, you could hear the upstairs guest walking with heavy feet. The room was clean, and pretty big! Compared to other photos of other hotels, this one was big and one of the reasons we chose this hotel. However, I noticed that some of the amenities that were listed weren't included such as an iPhone dock/clock and a landline phone. We found the cord for it... but no phone? Kind of odd, but we ignored it for the entire trip (we pass by the lobby every day anyways). The A/C is directly above the bed, which is nice... but you can see all the dirt and dust that has accumulated underneath. I liked the shelf area right between the beds--it has two levels which means there is plenty space for all your electronics and your family's electronics. There is also another outlet on the wall, which was pretty good too. The balcony was nice--we were facing the Ritz Carlton. One con was that there weren't any drawers big enough to fit clothing. My dad and I were hoping to save space in the room (as if we needed to) by putting our clothes in the drawers, but there was none. The elevators were hit or miss. There is only one elevator per tower (there are two towers.) If it was breakfast time, getting downstairs from the third floor seemed to be a pain because the elevators would take so long to get to our floor, and sometimes the elevator was full, meaning we would have to wait again. There weren't any clear signs of where the stairs were, and it seemed like one of the doors leading to the stairs was locked. That seems like a safety issue as what if there's a fire? Luckily, there wasn't, but it would be something to look into. The bathroom. It's pretty big. Kind of dated. Again, another amenity that wasn't in our bathroom that was featured in the photos was a Japanese style bidet. The bathtub is huge! But I would be weary for any one who has problems getting in and out of tubs. You have to go over a pretty big, maybe 4 inches, side in order to get into the tub and take a shower. There is a handle bar across to help, but getting out of the tub can be difficult. Breakfast. I knew when booking this hotel that the continental breakfast was not the best, but at least it was offered. I also knew that people were complaining about the amenity fee of $25 a night that covers said breakfast, wifi, newspapers, ect. It's true. The breakfast is simply coffee, donuts, bagels, juices, fresh fruit and cereal. For us, we were really wanting some substantial protein, and so we went out to buy spam for a few days and other food. One day we brought IHOP (which is just around the corner, a McDonalds is like a block away from that.) We weren't the only ones who did this as I saw a couple people bring their own food on top of the continental breakfast food. So, with that said, please Aqua Oasis, include some protein like boiled eggs or yogurt. Paying $25/night for amenities should also mean that we get a better breakfast than what was offered. Also, breakfast is only from 7-9. It's super packed around 7 am (we went in October, the low season, so imagine what it would be like in the higher season) and then dies down around 7:45. We had one day where we went to Diamond Head, and as much as I said "the breakfast could be better", we couldn't have breakfast because we left so early. Service was pretty good. I didn't interact any more than usual with the staff, but they were all pretty nice and friendly. The only one thing that bothered me was concierge service. They are available, but only from 8-4pm. I thought it was pretty inconvenient as we were usually gone by 8 and wouldn't return until 3-4, tired from the day's activities. There were times where I wanted to ask the concierge desk where they would recommend for dinner, but most of the time they were gone. I know where I live, the concierge service was still around at 6pm. I would have used them more if they were available. Pool was okay, but you're like a 15 minute walk from the beach, so why would you not go to the beach? The patio area and lobby area is nice too. You can sit in the egg chairs and swing around. Location. The location is pretty good. It's a little far off from some of the things further down Waikiki past Duke Kahanamoku statue, but for what is around it kind of makes up for it. You're just a walk away from the International Market Place, Royal Hawaiian Center, Waikiki Plaza and the beach. If anyone is taking the Waikiki Trolley, the depot is a block away. There is a farmers market on Monday, Tues and Thursday that is just down the street. And Lewers is a one way street, meaning there won't be a much traffic... except for the trolley depot. The entrance to the trolley depot is at the front of the hotel, so when the trolley pulls in, they ring their bell, so you will hear that often during the day. Overall, the hotel is nice and clean. There some areas of improvement such as their breakfast, concierge service, and their photos. Some of their photos are outdated in what they offer (ie, iPhone docking station, Japanese toilet bidet) but otherwise, it is pretty accurate.

We stayed here at the last minute and got a good deal directly from their web site. Very friendly staff, free upgrade with free continental breakfast. They have a wonderful smoking area that was much appreciated.

I found the staff very accommodating and friendly and had a very enjoyable stay. Olivia and door man were very helpful upon arrival and departure. Very clean roons and friendly greetings from all the staff. Liked hanging out at Moose McGillycuddy's just up the street and other local restaurant's near by.

This hotel says updated, which may be true, but that just means updated to the early 1990s. The inside of our PAID upgraded room here was old and dingy. The hotel staff also neglected to let us know during checkin that their water heater was broken and under repair for the tower we were in. Keep in mind there were rooms available that didn’t have this problem and we weren’t told. After a twelve hour flight, all we wanted was a shower and some sleep. Needless to say, the first did not happen. Neither did the second, as this hotels exterior walls are paper thin and the property is right by a night club or bar. We were on a upper floor and were woken every night by yelling drunk party goers at 2 in the morning. For the price paid, I would have expected at least a decent nights sleep, but that was also out of reach. Besides that the breakfast is truly the old style continental breakfast (donuts cereal and bread) and the pool is both silly and a joke. The parking staff was nice, but considering it’s 32 per night I would have been livid if they weren’t. If you are not a holiday making teen looking to get drunk and crash at 5 am, avoid like the plague. If you do have a problem, prepare with your own phone to call several times, as the room has no phone.

We spent our honeymoon at the aqua oasis in Waikiki. All the staff did everything they could to make our stay memorable, at check in the lady that checked us in was so nice and gave us a basket filled with some Hawaiian goodies, which was a nice surprise. Our room was amazing we were given a free upgrade to a suite. We had a full kitchen and the bed was so comfortable with a huge balcony. All the staff was very helpful and kind especially olivia who always seemed to be there with a friendly smile to say good night and help with any request we had. All in all our stay here was a great way to start our marriage!

We arrived at hotel early so we checked in and our bags were put in safe place as room was not ready. Had breakfast there then went down to town which was not very far from hotel,had alook around then went back to hotel just to rest up. Room was available earlier, room was very clean and bed comfortable all what you wanted.

We stayed 5 nights. Olivia was the person who checked us in. She was friendly , efficient and very helpful during our stay. Always there with a friendly smile. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh each day. We found all the staff to be happy and friendly. Good free wifi always a bonus. Easy walking to beach and shopping areas. Would stay again.

This hotel is very strategically located near downtown and very close to Waikiki beach. The people were very helpful especially Olivia that made sure we were taken care of. The room has a little kitchenette so you can microwave and has a refrigerator. Glad we stayed here.

Hotel is in the heart of Waikiki and all good things are walkable. Room was big and very comfortable and really clean. Front desk staff friendly. Comes with continental breakfast. I would stay here again.

We stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise. Arriving early from an overnight long-haul flight, we were very tired but too early for checking in, however Maria gave us tokens for the pink trolley bus which took us to the Ala Moana Centre, and when we returned early afternoon, she told us that she had upgraded us to a corner suite. We had a very comfortable stay, the hotel is handy for Honolulu’s great shopping and local restaurants. Thank you, Maria for making our stay so relaxing at the Aqua Oasis.

We only had one night here, a friday night, and wish we had stayed longer. We arrived early after an overnight flight, and they were so accommodating. Allowed us an early check in (9am), upgraded us to a penthouse suite, and breakfast was included. The penthouse suite was huge. Worked perfectly for a family of 4 with a fully equipped kitchen. The pool is small, but warm and easy to access. The breakfast included was great, cereal, bagels, coffee, all the basics. Perfect for feeding hungry kids first thing in the morning. Location is great, short walk to the beach, about 15 minutes to the zoo. The local bus stops really close to the hotel.

We super loved our time at this Waikiki Hotel! Every amenity that we wanted, was met - Complimentary Breakfast, Location, Pool, next door Steakhouse & delightful Pub just a few doors down ... and the STAFF Rachel specifically at the Front Desk was top notch! A delight to talk with, and so helpful and courteous! Highly recommended place - would love to travel there again! ‍♀️

I stayed at this cozy hotel in the heart of Waikiki from 6 August to 13 August 2019 with my wife and two daughters. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Olivia who ensured our holiday began in good spirit. Being in great location everything is at footsteps. The free shuttle to and from Ala Mouna through out the day is an extra bonus. They have a nice little pool, concierge, breakfast area by the pool where the continental breakfast is served everyday. All the staff members including house keeping, reception specially Olivia and Rachel were really amazing. Wouldn't mind staying here again if I happen to visit Hawaii again in the future.

I stayed at the Aqua Oasis for 42 days while I looked for a house. Not only are the military friendly...they are friendly in general. For anyone moving to the island on TLA take advantage of this gem. The location is great, continental breakfast is free every am and parking is free. If you get a room with burners you still receive full per diem. I want to give a S/O to Maria, Olivia, Mike, Mark, Stephen, Josh, Yuta, Rachael and anyone else that I missed. You guys helped make my stay in Waikiki a memorable one. Room 801

While there seem to be some other negative reviews on this place, I have to say having stayed there for a week, this place was excellent for a stay in Waikiki. Not only is it loacted in the perfect place for city transport, shopping, restaurants plus walking distance to the beach, the service here was outstanding! Maria (?), Rachel and front door man Mike were genuinely lovely, and helped us with any issues we had. They had free breakfast, a concierge service with Diana (who was fantastic) and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The only one suggestion I would have is to provide a kettle instead of a drip coffee machine and tea for those Australians who like tea as an alternative to drip coffee. I would recommend and would stay here again on a trip to Waikiki. Thanks!

Location is decent, 10 mins walk from Waikiki beach and in the midst of malls and food courts. Building is dated, but bathrooms etc. are renovated just enough to make it manageable.Cannot judge about the normal rooms. Can judge about the facilities downstairs, really dismal for this price. A stamp size pool surrounded by concrete walls hence hardly sunlight. And a 'continental' breakfast where even a motel would feel ashamed of: cereals, milk, bread/bagel, some fruits and juices. Nothing for the bread except butter and jelly (no meats/cheese etc), no yoghurt. Only served 7-9 AM, and apparently one of the reasons why they dare to charge a Resort Fee of USD 25/room/night on top of the room prices!However for us the price/value of the junior suite was good enough to book, and an on the spot free upgrade to a full suite of 700 square feet made it a lot better. All praise for the room and huge balcony, floor 11 is called the Penthouse floor for a reason. But might not have done even this had we known better about the pool and breakfast...

My family and I stayed here for 10 days while moving. This was one of the only hotels in Waikiki that would allow our family of 5 to stay in one room. It was comfortable and clean. Having access to a full sized refrigerator was extremely helpful. It was centrally located and easily accessible. All staff we came in contact with were courteous, professional, and helpful. Olivia at the front desk was especially amazing. From talking with her over the phone while making the reservation to the day we checked out she made me feel at ease and answered every question I had. I would definitely stay here again, especially for an extended stay.

The hotel is centrally located, clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Olivia at the front desk was wonderful and always very helpful. We had three rooms for our family and she switched everyone around to make everyone happy. My only complaint is the breakfast. They provide bagels and sliced bread but only butter and jelly to spread and some basic fruit. Management, spend a couple more dollars and get peanut butter and cream cheese and it would make the breakfast so much better.

I stayed here for two nights visiting the area...I was amazed at the koy pond, the free breakfast...the nice pool, the lounge area by the pool and my room...it is across the street from a very nice shopping area...It is near Fort de Russy and its beach open to the public with diamond head on the west...This hotel is like a family business that is under the umbrella of Marriot...I will only stay here in the future..

This was our second stay at Aqua Oasis in a year.We like the location of the hotel and the rooms are a good size for a family - more generous than a lot of other hotels. Slightly old, but clean and the beds are comfortable. Bathrooms are spacious also.Breakfast is also included which is a win for us. It’s only simple- bagels, cereal, coffee and fruit, but all we need to start the day. The pool is small, and shaded most of the day, but it’s okay for a quick cool off if you need some respite from the afternoon heat. One negative thing we notice time and time again is that the staff are all quite miserable. No one goes out of their way. No spritely “Good Morning” as we walk past the front desk each day. Perhaps they need a dose of happy pills..With this said- we would still stay here again due to the great location and value for money.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Oasis. It is not a luxury resort but we did not expect it to be. Our rooms (3) were all spacious, well air-conditioned, and cleaned nicely every day. My shower smelled of mildew when I started the water each morning, but I think this might be a common issue in humid Hawaii? It was also VERY loud at night but this was mainly noise from adjacent establishments so not the hotel's fault. Regardless, take my advice to bring good ear plugs! The breakfast was sparse with only fruit, cereal, and toast/bagels but to be honest this was just fine because you probably don't need much more to tide you over when you have a busy day ahead of you. The pool was small, and a little uncomfortable when others were in there too, but still very refreshing after a long day in the sunshine. The reception desk and concierge were outstanding and gave us a lot of valuable tips and advice! So as long as you don't expect luxury, the Aqua is a very reasonable option in Waikiki. Mahalo!

We spent a wonderful 6 nights in the hotel. We had a large room which was equipped with everything and had a wonderful view to the ocean on the 11th floor. Very kind and helpful staff, they helped us all. We would come back any time. We can only recommend it! Thank you:) a Hungarian couple.

The exceptional thing about this hotel was Olivia, the receptionist; friendly, helpful and effiecient. The next best thing was bed comfort and the only other positive was the location close to shopping, abundant cafes and retaurants and the glitz of Waikiki.However, it is in a seedy part of town with karaoke clubs, sleazy bars and shops as its neighbours.With no noise insulation, our room suffered from the karaoke below, the yelling of bar staff and their noisy cars as they departed and the 4am garbage collection in the side alleyway.The pool was an univiting oversized bath tub, the breakfast, suck as it was, was in an overcrowded converted lobby, and the bathroom showed its old age.Never again.

We had a very pleasant week long stay here at Aqua Oasis. We arrived earlier than our check in time and Maria at front desk offered to hold our luggage for us and beach towels for us to hit the beach first thing as our room was getting prepared. The junior suite was smaller than expected, but comfortable. The bathroom is outdated, but very clean! A plus for us was the detachable shower head which made it helpful to shower our toddler. The bathroom/ shower area is very roomy. Housekeeping was excellent! Analyn was our housekeeper. We left notes to request change in bedsheets, shower gel, etc and housekeeping was very accommodating. On one occasion I accidentally left my daughter’s small, thin white blanket in the bedsheets so when housekeeping changed the bedsheets, they accidentally took our daughter’s blanket too. When we returned to our room and saw the bedsheets changed and I realized I had left the blanket with the sheets, I called front desk and spoke with Niko to explain the situation. I described the blanket to her and she said they’d be on the lookout for it. No more than 10 minutes passed and we received a knock on our door with housekeeping returning our daughter’s blanket! I was so pleasantly surprised as I thought we would have lost the blanket. Breakfast was adequate to start our day- selection of bagels, toast, muffin, donuts, fruits, cereal, coffee, tea, juice. We had an excellent stay as the entire staff were so friendly and welcoming. We will be back!

We really enjoyed our stay at Aqua Oasis. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was large and functional. The beds are super comfortable! I loved that there is a continental breakfast included. Wifi worked well, had no issues whatsoever. Also very thankful for the free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shops. Thanks for a great 4 night stay

Room was huge, as was the bathroom. Kitchen in the room was a nice surprise, along with the tea/coffee facilities - excellent thought for the British visitors! Room was clean, tidy and the balcony was the entire length of the room itself. Location was smack bang in the middle of town, with only 10-15 minute walk to Wakiki beach.

Although this was a 3 star it had everything we needed. There was a great complementary breakfast, the rooms were clean and the staff excellent.The only downside was the nearby karaoke bar which did cause some noise so if that bothers you I would suggest a higher floor at the back of the hotel.Great range of shops around the hotel and only a short walk to the beach

I stayed in this hotel with my husband and 6 year old. It's a great hotel if you are wanting something really close to shopping and restaurants. The beach was about a 15 minute walk away. The hotel is beautifully decorated with several different plants and it has a really relaxing smoking area with koi fish and turtles. I don't smoke but my daughter enjoyed watching the turles and fish swim. If you are wanting a luxury hotel, this hotel is not for you! The rooms are decent but the restrooms really need to be updated. My family was out most of the day exploring the island so we only slept in the room. If you are really interested in exploring the whole island and getting out of Waikiki beach then I would recommend staying at a hotel in the center of the island. The island isn't huge but traffic made short drives long. The hotel offers valet parking for $40 a day or you can park in a public parking lot right behind the hotel for a small fee(minimal parking spaces). I decided to use the valet service because of the possible high risk car break theft. Located right on front of the hotel was a bike rental station and a ABC store a few steps away. The continental break was better than I expected. There was 2-3 options of fresh cut fruit, toast, bagels, 4 types of cereal, coffee, an assortment of break pastries, and different juices. There was no eggs, sausage, or biscuits but that breakfast was enough to hold you over until lunch. They also have washers($1.75) and dryers($1.50). If you happen to forget you detergent, they do sell some at the front desk. The hotel staff was mostly friendly but Miko was always super helpful and nice. No matter the time of day she always had a smile and a cookie for my daughter. Overall, if I was only staying in Waikiki beach I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The staff at the hotel starting with the person handling the valet parking and the receptionist, set the scene for out stay. All of the staff were very helpful. The room was very comfortable and very quiet and clean. Breakfast was very good. The hotel is in need of some refurbishment but it is still in fairly good condition. Most of the hotels in this area charge for valet parking. At the Oasis it is $40 per day.

I stayed here twice on the same trip: one in a jr suite (a surprise upgrade) and second in a regular king bed room. The rooms were both pretty clean and generally basic. The jr suite actually had more issues than the regular room such as: the thicker curtains do not close all the way to the edge, and one of the edges is closest to the head of the bed. I am not sure why this is, but it's irksome if you want privacy or want to sleep in longer when jet-lagged. However, the regular room had normal functioning curtains. Additionally in the suite, there was fluctuation in the water pressure of the shower. It was short lived but surprising (and again, the regular room was fine). Also while not a big deal to me, there was confusing channel navigation and unreliability when using the TV (I did not try the TV in the regular room). The AC in both rooms was right above the head of the bed, and even at the lowest setting and at the highest angle, it still felt too strong at times (and this is coming from a person who loves AC.) Bed linens were a slightly scratchy and a little too thin for when the AC is too strong. AC control was a little confusing for what some of the settings meant and some instruction for what those meant (like does the water drop symbol mean? Does it mean it's humidifier? or a dehumidifier? Is it different from the "cool" setting?) would have been nice. Finally there was a lot of street noise in the Jr. suite. I'm not sure why but if there's a rowdy crowd outside or from the karaoke bar, you will hear it, even from the 7th floor.Check-in was OK but having emailed Aqua corporate about the parking rates, I was quoted $35/day but the check-in form said $39/day. It was fine since on the first stay, I wasn't using a rental car, and reception said that they would make a note of it for my second stay. However, they did not and I was disappointed to bring it up again upon checking-in for the second stay. After much conversation and showing proof of the email, they did honor the quoted price and that was much appreciated even if only to save a few bucks.It should also be noted that due to Hawaii policy, you can be taxed on parking so those few dollars saved will pretty much cover the tax. Additionally when checking in, you will have to pay a $25 amenities fee (plus tax) per day for amenities (with the exception of Wifi) that you probably won't use (like getting the newspaper?). I wish this was just included in the reservation price so it doesn't feel like you're getting nickel and dimed. Despite all the quirks and irks, the location was pretty good and it felt safe regardless of locals telling me that Waikiki is kind of sketchy at night. The breakfast didn't appeal to me but it is in close walking distance to a popular udon place whose shortest line is in the morning. By far my favorite things about staying in this hotel were the generous welcome basket of goodies (chocolates, cookies, water, chips!), the washlet toilet and the rice cooker (nice touch even though i didn't cook anything) in the jr. suite, the closable curtains in the regular room, and the coin laundry (super handy when you get unexpectedly muddy while hiking). I'm not sure I'd stay here again but if I did, I'd consider the requesting a quiet regular room over the junior suite.

This hotel was half a block to the main shopping strip. The room was spacious and had all conveniences except a kettle. My sister and I had king single beds and they were very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and couldn’t be more helpful.

not nearly as great as other Aqua properties we've stayed with previously. The room appeared to have some cosmetic updates but the carpet was filthy. The bathroom with the strange step in garden tub/shower was in desperate need of some updating. There was a good sized gap around the hotel room door which made for increased noise and light (especially because we were right by the elevator). The front desk staff seemed annoyed by any questions or inquires and when we approached the front desk person we never once heard "how can I help you?" or "what can I help you with?". Getting anything more than a "hi" was like pulling teeth. The "pool" is roughly the size of a hot tub and I don't think I saw anyone in it the entire time we were there. The hanging egg chairs were nice as were the gardens all around the lobby. We had two of the most amazingly helpful valets and enjoyed the coffee and fruit in the morning. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay there again.

We really enjoyed our stay here although we only had one night on arrival. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed with the Aloha spirit. We had an early international flight arrival and got to the hotel before 7am. The staff were so lovely, a room was available and we were able to check in immediately which was a real bonus for us as we were very tired. We were also offered breakfast, again another bonus which we were not expecting. The room was quite large compared to other hotels in Waikiki and had a fridge, a coffee maker and microwave. It was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. There was a good size balcony and a large bathroom. It was a very quiet room and we had a great sleep. The breakfast was very nice and included juices, cereals, fresh fruit, toast, bagels and donuts, all in ample supply with freshly brewed Kona coffee. The iced water always available in the lobby was also a nice touch as very refreshing when coming back in on a hot day. We have stayed in Waikiki many times and found this hotel great value compared with any other hotel we have stayed in here. We would definitely highly recommend this hotel and are happy that we are returning to stay here again on our last night of our vacation before flying home.

We just spent 18 days at Aqua Oasis in Waikiki. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (ADA as hubby uses a wheelchair). The apartment was spacious if dated & well provisioned. Brekky was good; cereal, fruit, toast/bagels etc. All the staff were helpful & friendly so the drawback? It’s noisy...it’s very noisy. After the first night I got earplugs (I didn’t think I was a light sleeper). The noise from the karaoke bar 2 doors down, rowdy people in the alley & then garbage trucks at 6am added up to interrupted sleep most nights. It’s a shame because without the noise we would have happily recommend staying here but if you are ok about the noise & you sleep really heavy then I guess you will be fine.

Fantastic thanks to Maria & all the staff, really friendly & hospitable. Very clean spacious, lovely gardens most obliging. We would recommend it to everyone visiting Waikiki Honolulthe location us within five minutes of walking

The pool is small and very cold, the room is dated and they say remodeled ha ha ha the mattress is the worst I ever slept on, the only thing I would say it's clean. The staff is very nice but I will say again the mattress is horrible. Nice breakfast fresh fruit.

This hotel has a great location, close the the beach, restaurants and stores; I'll suggest to walk further to the wall beach Waikiki, since it is a better beach without rocks on the sand/beach. Check in was okay, we had no problem, room was big with a mini kitchen/fridge that was very helpful. there is a continental breakfast just with the basics, bagels, coffee, cereal etc. There is a Starbucks or breakfast store near by if you prefer.We took a Uber to and from the airport, it only costs about $27 us.Overall it was a great experience.

We did enjoy our stay at the aqua hotel. It is a good location from Waikiki and the service is really good. Mark was extremely helpful when helping us with our car etc. The WiFi was very good and quick and the water in the reception was refreshing when you needed it. However, the place does need updating. The breakfast although good, after 4 days or so it’s a bit boring and repetitive due to a lack of selection. It’s very basic. We did ask to move rooms as the basic rooms are basic and small but our bigger room was very nice and good size but the whole place needs updating. It’s a shame because it does have potential. Also we didn’t actually spend much time in the hotel room anyway so if you are going to out and about all day and want somewhere to rest on a budget this is a good place to do that!

We had a nice looking room with very good views. We were there for 1 night so we did not raise a fuss over the mold and mildew smell from the Central AC unit. We had a very long day traveling and just wanted to pass out and sleep and that is what we did. If we had complained about the smell, I am sure the hotel would have taken care of us. We did not visit during peak tourist time.

My first visit to Hawaii with a close friend and very pleased with our choice for accommodations. The room was big and comfortable with all amenities, and we enjoyed the balcony. Location is great for walking to beach, restaurants, stores, and all shopping. Concierge onsite, and shuttle service to all the places we wanted to go was very convenient.I liked the open air feeling of the main desk, concierge, and breakfast areas. They keep it very clean and aesthetically appealing with lush plants, pond, and seating areas. The only suggestion would be to mix up choices for the continental breakfast. In spite of that, I would definitely stay here again!

My husband I had a great stay. The staff were attentive and helpful. The room was clean and had everything you’d need, if a little dated. Continental breakfast was good. Great location and quiet considering it’s right in the heart of things.

Loved staying at Aqua Oasis! The view, location, and service were great! The beach chairs were a nice added bonus. Close walking distance to the beach, shops, and great restaurants. Basic continental breakfast was delicious and a great help.

I have to say Location Location Location!! It was a close walk to everything, so the kids didn’t complain. (Bonus) . Rooms were very clean and spacious, breakfast was available every morning, it has all the breakfast essentials! The staff were lovely and helpful.. great Laundry especially when your with families. Definitely would stay here again

Decor is dated but extremely clean. Staff are friendly, informative and accommodating. Stayed in Junior Suite, has ample room for two. A couple of blocks back from beach so not much in the way of views but only a short walk from beach and shops. Continental breakfast included, basic but more than enough and staff constantly monitor to top up supply. Small pool but deep enough for a cooling off paddle and deck chairs for a comfortable laze in the sun. Beautiful koi fish and turtle ponds in garden area for guest use. Suite has small sink and fridge, microwave and coffee percolator which can be used with just water if cup of tea is required. Housekeeping done on daily basis. Washing machines and dryers on site. Good value for money and would stay here again.

Hotel seems highly overpriced. Breakfast is extremely minimal- some fruit, bagels, and bread. Hallway smelled and looked like an old strip club. Room itself was decent. However, can’t get over the fact that I was charged for a resort fee by the site I booked, and charged for a resort fee by them. When I showed the breakdown of what I paid online that showed the resort fee was paid for upon checkout, I was told they had to charge me and I needed to work it out with the site I booked through. Even though I had the same discussion with the person when I checked in, and she said we were good to go.

Once again we returned for a three week vacation and, once again this hotel did NOT disappoint. Our room was always very clean, everything worked as it should we were very comfortable. The area is quiet at night, and the location is great for several nearby (5minute walk) restaurants.  Our preferred Beach is in front of the Royal Hawaiin Hotel, this is a 10 minute walk.The laundry facilities on sight are so convenient. There is a real nice area, a tropical garden type with a stream with tropical fish for relaxing and reading. It is also a smoking area, but not used much for that purpose. In closing, all of the staff go out of their way to help and are very friendly.. Ralph and Richael Tweten

We stayed at the hotel ~2 weeks ago for only 1 night prior to leaving Hawaii and wished we had stayed longer. The location is only a block from the main drag and there's a bunch of cool bars and restaurants near by. The hospitality at the hotel is top notch. Any time we had a question they helped us get it answered. Special thanks to Marissa :) For comparison we stayed an airbnb down the block the week prior and this place was way more authentically Hawaiian, the common area and decor were beautiful. Highly recommend! I expect I'll be staying here again in the near future.

This is our third stay at the Aqua Oasis! If you truly want an 'ohana' experience, this is the place to come to! The hotel is comfortable and centrally located within walking distance to just about everything you may want to experience in Waikiki! The hotel is a non-smoking hotel though they have a beautiful zen garden for us smokers! The staff are all attentive, accomodating, and friendly. You need something special, talk with the GM - Evelyn Shiroma! She makes herself available throughout the day. Front desk staff are always there to help with your local sightseeing needs along with the concierge desk for making the reservations. Special thanks to Olivia and Maria! A special Mahalo to Angelita and Rosie for keeping our room clean and well stocked with fresh towels and toiletries! Mahalo to Mike for all your baggage needs! You'll find that many of the guests are repeat visitors who you'll get to know and look forward to seeing from year to year! When in Waikiki, make it your home away from home, you won't regret it!

Hotel is comparable to others in price range. Central location in Waikiki. Wait staff were attentive and went above and beyond to help me resolve issues with business billing. Breakfast was simple but nice. Retrieving car was quick compared to other hotels. Maid service was consistent.

If you are looking for an upscale hotel, then move along, this is not for you. If you are looking for a clean room with friendly staff then this is perfect. Our Junior Suite was large and had all the amenities. It is an older building and does show some wear, but our room was clean with everything we needed. The beach, shopping & restaurants were just a short walk away. The staff was very friendly with directions, suggestions, etc. They helped us with a shuttle to Pearl Harbor & another to the airport. A great hotel, off the beaten path.

We stayed here for three days after arriving from Kauai. It was close enough within walking distance to restaurants, Waikiki beach, and sights. We like that it was a boutique hotel and it served basic continental breakfast (pastries, fruit, cereal, and coffee/juice). We asked for a quiet and higher floor that's facing away from the street. The hotel staff listened to our needs and was willing to switch the room if we weren't happy. We stayed in the original assigned room since we simply stayed in the hotel to sleep and have a simple breakfast. We didn't lounge around so the place was just right for our purpose. We want to note that the activity concierge (not hotel staff) was not friendly. When she knew we weren't interested in buying tour packages, she exuded cold and impersonal attitude. Oh well. We didn't let that dampen our Hawaiian vacation. Overall, in Oahu, we advise guests to explore nature, talk with locals, and walk/drive around the neighborhoods (not just the Waikiki shopping) to really feel the aloha spirit.

I recently stayed at the Aqua Oasis for 16 nights, travelling with my partner, 10 month old bub and mother in a one bedroom Junior Suite which was fantastic! Given this was our first time travelling with our young son, we were very unsure of how things would go and whether there would be enough room for all four of us, but the suite was very spacious - it included a full kitchen which was great. We stayed on the 8th floor and had a view of the ocean and the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton which was lovely!All of the staff that we interacted with were kind and helpful, all of our requests were accommodated, we even rented a crib from a local company and the delivery/assembly/pickup of this was no issue, which made life so much easier!The location of this hotel couldn't be better, everything you could need is only minutes away; shops, beach, restaurants, ABC Stores, trolleys, etc. The only concern I experienced during my stay here was the noise levels from the local bars and also the morning rubbish collection on the street - and even then, if I weren't travelling with a baby and worried about him waking, it wouldn't bother me much at all.All in all, we had a wonderful holiday and will definitely return to the Aqua Oasis in the future!

My family and I, spent 11 nights, at Aqua Oasis.Despite being given the wrong room type, staff tried to accommodate us as best they could. The room ended up being a bit cramped, but then, we weren't here to spend all day in the room. The rooms were well cleaned everyday and the cleaning staff were always happy and smiling.Suited our needs and was a great price for our stay.1 block from the main district and only a short walk to the beach.I have never liked resort fees, as US is the only country that charges it on top of the hotel cost. However, since it included breakfast, it ended up being cheaper than breakfast elsewhere, for 3 of us. Breakfast was basic but was still good.Staff initially appeared a bit standoffish but likely a bad day. As our stay continued staff opened up and became more friendly and chatty. Overall was agreat stay,for the price we paid.Big shout out to Oliva, always cheery and chatty and we feel we know so much about her from our chats. Even at our 4am checkout, she was still cheery.

We really liked our stay here. Central location, just a few mins walk from everything pretty mich. Friendly staff, very large rooms, beautiful views. Check-in took a while as there were a couple of companies checking-in and only one receptionist. Liked the open-air lobby and the small garden places and corners all around. Small pool are but cosy. We carried the luggage up ourselves which was fine but offering the luggage service would've been nice. Room was very big, spacious, a little outdated but had the beach vibe which was nice. King-size bed was very comfortable. Spacious bathroom+bathtub. There was even a kitchenette. Large terrace overlooking the pool and having some great partial sunset views. Great free WiFi.Breakfast was rather limited, would've liked some ham&cheese or something savory anyway, but it all worked. There was some smell in our room when we first entered, maybe from the carpeting on the whole floor. Breakfast was rather very basic for the room charge. Rooms somewhat outdated.Olivia at check-out was amazing, very friendly, informative and attentive. Helped us with the beach towels and luggage storage. Shout out to her! :)All in all, a lovely stay!

We booked last minute at Aqua Oasis after being evacuated from our campsite due to the storm. Room was okay, a bit old (especially for what you pay, but that's Honolulu I suppose). We ask the front desk where we could park and she told us there's free parking at Ala Wai Blvd. We specifically asked here if it would be save / if there were any restrictions and she told us that as long as there is no meter we should be fine. The next morning our car was towed. We went back and they offered us a taxi (which we eventually had to pay for ourselves, another 40 dollar) and gave the driver the adress. Since they gave him the wrong adress we had to walk back 3 miles, with all our stuff. The guys from the towing company told us that it indeed is the hotels obligation to tell there guests about this parking situation on monday morning so PLEASE BE WARNED!!! We ended up paying 200 dollars for this and felt really neglected by the hotel. I would recommend going to another one, one that does give a f*ck about there guests.

My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and I have to say it was perfect for us! The location can't be beat everything is within walking distance. I am not a fan of high rises so this hotel was great with only 8 floors. Yes it could be updated but was very clean. Our room was quite spacious. Staff were friendly. Breakfast is light but adequate with delicious coffee, bagels, cereal, pastries and fruit. Catching local bus to go out to Pearl Harbour or Diamond Head was a breeze. I appreciated the smoking area and not having to go on sidewalk amongst the koi ponds and turtles. Love love this hotel would return in heartbeat. If you want fancy this is not the place for you. If you want comfortable and clean and great location this is a best choice. Thank you Aqua Oasis!

My family stay at the Aqua Oasis was delightful. Friendly check-in thanks to Olivia and a continuously spotless room thanks to Rowelyn. Spacious room, neat kitchenette and nice lanai. The location is great, only being a couple steps from the main Waikiki strip so away from the noise but still close enough to be convenient. Mahalo for a great stay!

Was really looking forward to my stay at the Aqua Oasis. I arrived at the hotel at around 4:30pm to be told that my pre-paid 1 bedroom Suite wasn't available for my stay and that they had a smaller Junior Suite instead for me. This was over the Christmas holiday so I knew that my chances of a finding a similar suite in Waikiki was very low. Aqua Oasis has 2 buildings....one where the Suites are and the other where the standard hotel rooms are. The two buildings are not joined so to get to the other, you need to go to the main floor, walk over to the next building and take the elevator. I ended up having to get a standard room in the separate building from my Junior Suite to house my family. This situation is not conducive to a great family-bonding vacation if we are in separate rooms and separate buildings. I left my business card with the Front Desk and asked them to have the Manager contact me regarding this manner by email and he/she never did which was very disappointing. Shows that they just didn't care.The central location of this hotel is very good. Breakfast was meh. Some powdered mini donuts, bread for toast, sliced oranges, sliced pineapple filled a hole.Valet parking only at this hotel. Both the day and night attendants were very good. The Junior Suite room was on back side of the building which was quieter so I recommend this. The room itself was comfortable (although much smaller than what I had booked). The bathroom was dated and needs to be refurbished. It had a large bath with sliding doors so it could be used as a shower. The edge of the bathtub was high and wide so if you had accessibility issues, you would not be able to safely and easily enter the tub for a bath/shower. I would not stay here again because their overselling negatively impacted my Oahu family vacay and because the General Manager did not get back to me as requested. I highly encourage others to force the hotel to walk you to another resort to get the same or better accommodations should a similar situation occur to you.

The staff was incredible!! Olivia, Mike and Angie went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. I was there on an emergency trip where my daughter needed a place to recover after surgery. The room was perfect. Beds were comfortable, showers roomy and clean (with hand held shower heads). I enjoyed the peacefulness of the property. The breakfast was convenient and the laundry facility was a plus. I know I would not have gotten the attention at one of the bigger resorts. The location was perfection. Thank you Aqua Oasis for making a difficult situation better.

So much to love about this hotel - the lobby is beautiful, rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable, location is great, price was good, and it was adequately cleaned. HOWEVER: the nightclub kitty-corner to our room was open until 3:30 AM. (!!!) Very difficult to fall asleep, and then between 3 and 4 in the morning, we were woken up three nights in a row. This is not freeway noise you can pretend is the ocean; this is shouted cursing; poorly-played drumkits; and drunk people waiting for taxis underneath your window. THEN, starting at 5:30, there was lots of truck noise and some kind of dump/recycling/delivery center across the street, so all the beeping backup noise and huge steel lids being slammed made sleeping impossible. Would never stay here again -- it was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at. We asked for a quiet room at 4 pm when we first arrived, but they said they were sold out, but had upgraded us to a jr suite. Do not stay here -- even if you check in on time and request a quiet room, you might be forced to "sleep" in the noisy rooms. Pass. We were in room 501.

stayed here for three nights before heading off to the Big Island. Arrived after a long flight from Australia at 7 am and staff were so welcoming. Our room was ready and they also upgraded us to a bigger unit with a full kitchen - which came in handy for our 6 year old. Unit was huge, big bathroom with a really big bath and huge balcony. Very neat and tidy and perfect location for accessing all Waikiki has to offer.

We stayed in this hotel for a week and we were 10 minutes away from the beach and 2 minutes away from Kalakaua Ave.This is a decent and beautiful hotel in Waikiki, the staff is wonderful. My flight was very late and I arrived around 2:00 am and the young man at the counter treated very well, I was so tired that I could not get his name but He is a nice and diligent employee.

Friendly staff ! Rooms are cool ! American breakfast, it could be better!Close to the beach ! We stayed two nights and had a lot of fun ! My daughter loved the pool and fish/turtles area ! Good price for sure

The stay was amazing. The hotel did an amazing job of creating an open and welcoming environment. Although the breakfast was inclusive it still had a fresh variety of fruits, AMAZING!!! Valet was very accommodating and punctual. I would like to say a special thank you to Mike Preddy, he was always smiling, nice, and made sure to open the door for me each time. And thank you to all the other team members that helped make my stay enjoyable!!!!

This hotel was excellent. The lady at check-in, Jessica, was really helpful and friendly. The room was clean and well serviced, and it’s in a really good location for getting to beach / shops. Would definitely stay there again

Nice Hotel great position near shops and short walk to beach .Can be a bit noisy being close to night club.
