Check in was not good as we booked to single beds and they gave us a king bed with a pull out bed and as we are two female friends traveling together and booked our room from Australia month ago this was not good enough’ and it did take a long time to sort out .But overall a nice place to stay very clean and lovely staff.

This Aqua Oasis has friendly staff and a good, urban location. However, the hotel feels dated and doesn’t offer the amenities and experience of many of its local competitors.First impressions weren’t great: entrance regularly smells a little like sewage and has an underwhelming presentation. We weren’t looking for anything too upscale but, for the cost, we were expecting more.The location is good with shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood, and around a 10 minute walk to the beach.Our room was simple but tidy and had a great balcony.The pool is quite small and was out of service for our whole stay so we didn’t spend too much time at the hotel as a result. We were still charged the full resort fees despite this.Overall, for the right price, this hotel is decent enough - but it doesn’t feel like an oasis.

Aqua Oasis is centrally located in Waikiki/Honolulu, an easy walk to the most popular places, like the Duke Bronze statue or Ala Moana shoppiung Center. The hotel is quiet and comfortable. The staff is helpful and graced me a late check-out.

The Aqua Oasis Hotel in Waikiki makes you feel like you're in Hawaii. It has an open-air lobby, a koi pond...and a place for you to rinse the sand from your feet before you go up to your room.The included breakfast is simple with coffee, juices, pastries, toast, bagels, and cereal. But it fuels you up nicely for your day's adventures.The staff at the hotel is very friendly, especially Olivia at the front desk, who always seemed to be there when I needed something...from checking in to grabbing a towel for the beach.The hotel is located just off Kalakaua Ave, the main street through Waikiki. So it's a short walk to dozens of shops and restaurants, including the Food Pantry, a nearby grocery store. It's also just a short walk from Waikiki Beach and beautiful sunsets.A little known fact is that Honolulu has one of the best public transportation systems in the world. Taking the bus from the airport to this hotel and from the hotel to the windward side of the island as well as the north shore was very easy. Bus stops are less than a block away fromt the hotel.I highly recommend the Aqua Oasis for your next trip to Honolulu.

We recently had the opportunity to stay at Aqua Oasis. First I'll start off by saying that Jessica and Mike were exceptional. Mike helped us with all of our bags and provided good recommendations for places to go and things to do. He is your go to guy, make sure you talk to him while you're there! Jessica was very efficient at getting us checked in and providing us with all of the information that we needed to know about the hotel. She always had a smile on her face which makes the stay more warm and fuzzy. The quality of the rooms was a bit below my normal taste. They are spacious, however they are a little outdated. However, the location of this property is A-1 and would be the main reason that I would stay here again. The hotel is in the heart of Honolulu and almost everything is walking distance. The things that are not walking distance can be accessed by using the hotel's free shuttle service. All in all I think if the hotel can do a facelift to the rooms and install diffusers throughout the property to give it a more pleasant smell that would do wonders. If you stay at the hotel opt for the Junior Suite or Suite rooms that have the kitchen the space is great.

My boyfriend and I, loved our stay at the Oasis! We loved the cleanliness of the room, the lighting, the balcony, and how comfortable it felt hanging out after a long day of exploring the city. The distance from the main avenue of Waikiki was convenient because we walked to the beach, restaurant, farmers market and shopping markets. There were bikes (Biki) that you can easily rent out, right in front of the Oasis. The staff members were friendly and were very helpful when we had questions or concerns. There is also a pool on site if you want to cool off. The design of the Oasis was beautiful and they even had a pond full of coy fish. We will be returning next time we visit!

I’m a bit late with this review but I found the business card in my luggage. I must say I was impressed with the staff the manager, the sweet lady working at the front desk, and even the gentleman who held my luggage honestly was amazing. I choose places based on service so I plan to return. I chose this hotel as a last minute choice. My other accommodations were near the military installation but I found myself in need of a hotel for a few extra nights. This place was a gem. Honestly the lobby was tranquil and quite nicely decorated. The rooms could use a bit more attention but were generally acceptable. I think a fresh paint job could really improve the rooms but I suppose this is a concern for the general manager, such a minor and quick fix to prevent diminishing this beauty. Great location walking distance to all great spots and honestly your people on staff at this location are the true value here. Oh and I enjoyed sitting with the resident turtles. Attorney SR

Came all the way from Finland and spent great 1,5 weeks at Aqua Oasis. Staff was extremely friendly. Hotel location great, everything within walking distance even with small kids. Our room was facing the backyard and quiet. Rooms were clean and everything was working properly. Breakfast good and staff there super friendly. Pool is small but the sea close so that doesn’t bother. This was a great deal for us; will definitely book again next time.

The night club doesn't close until 4 am. The music was so loud that it woke me up as soon as the club opens at 11 pm. At 3:30 am, the drum is still banging. no way to sleep at all. Avoid it if you can.

Loved our stay at Aqua Oasis. Staff were helpful and hotel was close to everything we needed. Breakfast was lovely and the Vanilla Macadamia coffee amazing. Only downside is nearby bar can be a little noisy. Turned on the air conditioning which helped drown out the noise. Would stay here again.

Great location, free shuttle bus options available to shopping centre. Very helpful staff. We arrived two days late due to bad Australia airline. We emailed our issue and everything was handled with ease. Walking distance to everything Waikiki. Great restaurants and bars all close by.

This was my 1st Hawaiian vacation at Aqua Oasis. Everything about my stay was fabulous!All the hotel staff were friendly & most helpful. Special kudos to my chambermaid PRINCESS (her REAL name)...She was superb! I will sooooo be back at Aqua Oasis for my next fall 2019 vay-cay!Photos attached were from past Friday night's stellar beach fireworks from Aqua Oasis' stellar 7th floor balcony!

I made reservation at this this hotel through my company travel site. After reading the reviews I felt it would be a good place to stay. Boy was I miss lead!! When my husband and I our two friends landed at the airport, I called the hotel to see if our rooms where ready. They said no but we could bring our stuff and leave it with them. This was at 1158am. I told them we were going to drive the north shore and would be back about 6. When we got to the hotel at 610pm they told me our reservation had been cancelled. WHAT I ask them by whom and when. I was told that the general manager had cancelled it at 1208. That was 10 min after I had called and asked if our rooms were ready. WOW! I had the front desk young man call his boss who cancelled it. He did and we were told they could not get the credit card on file to accept a charge. I told them my credit card had been having issues since I was not in my home state. I told them the travel company I work through makes it so we dont pay til we check in so why were they trying to run my card without me present. I had other credit cards I could have given them. They said they called me, and I showed them my phone log, and they did not call me. So I asked for the head person of the hotel. She came down to the lobby and I asked her why she cancelled my reservation when she knew we were in town and going to be there. She told me the room had to be paid upfront. I told her my travel company has it set up so we pay when we check in. She then informed me I had no reservations and needed to leave her hotel.You see the Wikkki area was sold out, we had no where to go. Because we had a cheaper rate than what others had, cancelling our reservations let her book others in those rooms at a higher price. We were just asked to leave. They are a RIP off!! We did find another hotel after alot of effort, and my credit card worked just fine for them. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!! The management only cares about how much money they can make. They treated us with disrespect!! I have worked with many hotels in my line of work and have NEVER had this happen to me.

We've stayed at this hotel 3 times and absolutely love it! If you want an authentic Hawaiian experience, this is the place! The lobby is a relaxing hideaway with a vintage vibe. Oh & that breakfast-wowza!

Although adequate for the price & a good location for the heart of Waikiki so disappointed with the overall service.We booked months in advance with another couple stipulating are needs & that we would like to be close to each other so arrive & ended up with rooms so far apart I mean different towers! Found most of the reception staff couldn't be bothered & I advise that it's a scramble for the continental? breakfast not enough seating & even worse when it rains as only half the terrace is covered.So unfortunately this hotel has been crossed off my list for future stays by the way music blaring from street level until about 1.00am if you are unlucky enough to be in the wrong tower

Ilike to read reviews before booking a hotel room. I must say, most viewers stated this hotel is close to wakiki beach that is true. the pros close to the beach ,bike ride,or rent a bike ,if you are 19 to 25 years of age this may be the place for you to stay noisy traffic all night long even through the weekdays. if you are the age of 35 to 55 or older you may want to reconsider the hustle and bustle. yes, you may park on street or you can only valet your vehicle at this hotel;if you lose your beach towel is a $30 charge. however ,overall it was not the place for us .we only stay one night and rooms were very tight and confined. I just couldn't get over shower inside jacuzzi tub,too much. Chief laua was amazing and pearl Harbor.

this hotel is in a perfect location in Waikiki , 2 mins walk and you are in the heart of Honolulu , absolutely smack in the middle of everything , a 2 min walk from the start of all the trolley stops , and they all end there too , blue , green , red , pink lines at t galleria . 5 mins to beach , you can get towels from hotel to use as well . all the main nightlife is around you , karaoke and artist toothe staff the staff here were very helpful , they give us a kettle when we asked , I needed to print a voucher for pearl harbour , and they tried twice for me to do it , using the hotel printer , they really tried to help me out, thanks guys , n nothing was too much trouble for them breakfast, the breakfast is in with the room , not a full on brekkie, but fill the gap , it is buffet style, plenty of coffee , fruit , cereals , cake and pastries, and juices to drink as well and toast alsoroom, the room was a good size , with a fridge , sink, coffee maker , iron and board , safe , and hawaiin tropic toiletries in the bathroom shower / bathfree wifi, beach towels, not a great view though , all high rise around we also used the laundry here which was do it yourself, cheap and the sell washing powder in reception for the same price as abc stores, the pool is on the small side but perfect for a dip after you been walking in the hawaiin sun for a bit , we used it everydaywe will be coming back here next time , I will not even look for another hotel , this has everything you need

The place is central & clean They attempted to charge us for car parking that we did not have & screwed up our room as we asked for & booked a room for 2 single beds which we had to fight for At check out they attempted to charge us for parking & extra fees???We thought it was all finalised as we had paid up at checkoutThe day after check out there are charges of $380 & $118 ???We will be disputing the fees & would not stay here again based on the unprofessional charging & irresponsible fees after we had left

I had a wonderful stay at this resort Yuta and Evelyn had a wonderful welcome. I enjoyed the specious and fully equipped room. It is in close proximity to everything like Irish pubs, Ramen noodle house, shopping and beach.

We stayed here for three nights with another couple, the first room we were given was appalling. The hotel did move us when we complained to a better room, but it was tired and and in need of a serious refresh. The pool is little more than a plunge pool in the corner of the terrace, cleverly photographed to look much more. The breakfast was absolutely appalling, the supposed breakfast buffet consists of a pile of bread for you to toast with packets of jam and margarine, along with some small chunks of melon and quarters of orange. I see other reviewers have commented on this and management say they will look at it. Disappointing that they haven’t bothered. Location is OK about ten minutes from the beach and bang next to loads of soulless designer shopping Malls.

Great location and friendly staff. Large rooms. Hotel is located in a queit street but very close to Waikiki main beaches, shops and restaurants. Hotel can provide airport shuttle on request and has onsite concierge service.

Travelling regularly from Sydney, Australia to Vancouver Island to visit family, I break up the long flight by stopping over in Honolulu, on arrival and return. The Aqua Oasis has been my go to for the perfect two night stop for over 10 years now and I thought it was to time to commend the hotel and staff.Firstly the Aqua Oasis' location could not be better. Only a block and a half from the beach, it is situated in quiet Lewers Street with the shopping strip just metres from the front door. There is also a corner grocery store in the other direction, open long hours. Moose McGillycuddy's bar just a few steps away and Spada Italian restaurant around the corner. Because of my short stay, I have only ever had a single room, but there are suites available.The staff are friendly but not over the top. Rooms are clean with drip coffee and a small bar fridge. The included breakfast is a great option. Cereal, fruit, toast and juice ... enough to set you up for the morning. They also provide cold lemon flavoured water for those hot days returning from the beach and a very useful towel system that gives you unlimited clean towels for your beach visits.Certainly not 5 star resort digs, but for convenience and price, with friendly surroundings, you can't really go past Aqua Oasis.

The reception staff on arrival were attentive and helpful providing all the relevant information about the hotel. It's not in the centre but easy walking to the beach plus shopping area. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was average.

Have stayed at the Aqua Oasis on four occasions.Why do I keep on returning ,2 reasonvalue for money and friendly helpful staff,including Evelyn resort Manager and front line staff Niki,Yuta,Maria ,Mike and Mark.They make you feel like your at home and always willing to offer there help and Hawaiian knowledge.Highly recommended.Mahalo

This cute little hotel proved a special stay due its wonderful staff! A long flight from Australia left us tired and grumpy, but a 25 minute ride from the airport brought us to this cute hotel. Lovely Maria welcomed us as the front desk with grace and kindness. After checking into an affordable and spacious room with a terrace and a view of the ocean, we hit the beach a pleasant 10 minute walk away. We look forward to our return. Thank you, Aqua Oasis!
user_location: Thousand Islands New York, New York
user_name:
edwardhenwood
Thousand Islands New York, New York

review_body: If you don't want to spend 400 dollars a night on lodging, then this is the place to stay in Waikiki, be it business or vacation. Free breakfast and Wi-Fi, a combo hard to find in the area. Their government rate came in cheaper than the maximum allowance as well. The staff here was amazing. Niki at the front desk was great, the ballet and cleaning service was exceptional. All the staff here is sincere and care about your stay. Very professional and friendly employees. They even have a security guard on nights, so you and your family can feel safe. My room was great, very comfortable king size bed, huge tub, and big screen HD TV with cable. The only downfall is parking, but that's true for anywhere in Waikiki. If you have a rental and are military, there is a giant DoD parking lot two blocks away that will let you park 24/7 for 90$ for a 30 day pass.

I love the Aqua Oasis. The location is perfect, the staff is always very friendly, and the rooms are good sized and very clean. I highly recommend staying at this location when you're visiting Honolulu.

This was my 3rd stay here and won't be my last. The hotel is is a great spot close to everything, it's clean and the staff are super nice. We were welcomed back and upgraded to the penthouse which was really nice. All the staff we deal with are so helpful and nice from Nicole at the front desk as well as the other staff at the front desk to Mike and Mark the porters as well as the other gentleman who i'm not sure of his name. Both Mike and Mark remembered us from our previous visit and were very welcoming and helpful with sorting out our transport to the airport. They are always pleasant. Highly recommended. See you next year everyone.

This is not a resort hotel but it does a very good job at serving its clients effectively and without pretensions. Breakfasts are good, but don’t expect hot food or a chef turning crepes. The rooms are clean, if a little worn. It’s a couple of blocks to the beach but lots walk passed here on their way for a swim so it’s not too far. It has a small pool and lifts service up to 10 floors. As to convenience it is a block from the main street of Waikiki but more importantly it is opposite the Waikiki Trolley terminus which is under the Galleria complex (ask the doorman for directions as the entry point is a little hidden). The biggest question: “Would we stay here again?” Answer: Yes.

The Aqua Oasis on Lewers is really close to everything that you may want experience in Waikiki. Almost everything in a walking distance (restaurants, bars, malls, beach, and ABC store of course). It looks outdated and needs to be renovated but still workable. Rooms are fine (try to book 2 queens - roomier) and clean. Continental breakfast consists of coffee , milk , some bagels and wheat/white bread along with butter and jelly and some fruits (pineapple, orange, honeydew) . They stop serving precisely at 9:00. IHOP around the conner (Lewers and Kuhio). The down side is the parking charges - US$ 35.00 per day added to resort fee (in case you need some beach towels). Staff OK!

The Aqua Oasis is an ideal location if you are staying in Waikiki and don’t have transport as everything is in walking distance. The rooms are fine, clean and serviced daily. The buffet breakfasts are worth it and set you up well for the day. The hotel is good for families, we travelled with 2 small children and had a room with 2 double beds that was fine. If you are planning on spending most of your time at the beach and around Waikiki like us and not in the resort, this is a good option as is more cost effective than the big resorts.

Aqua OasisWhat a great spot in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are dated but clean. Housekeeping are doing a great job. Just don’t get a blocked toilet because the guy with the plunger will deliver it to your door and ask you to unblock it. This is after hours. 10pm. Mostly in disbelieve I voiced my opinion that’s not my responsibility and credit to front office we got relocated.To a similar room at a lower level. Possibly could have been handled better. Maybe training for the staff. It’s great to see that they are relaxed. But are they tooooooRelaxed. Anyway I would stay here again. It’s just what happens. Mahalo

3 of us stayed here and really enjoyed it the staff were friendly and helpful, room service was great done daily. Breakfast was supplied in a covered courtyard which was a nice setting. There was a pool for anyone who wanted to swim.Location to main shops and eating places was great loved it would recommend to couples and families.

The rooms are very spacious and although they might not be as modern as some, our room was clean and well maintained. The employees on the reception desk were very friendly. Continental breakfast was included but it was rather limited and the coffee was of poor flavor - perhaps give this a miss.
user_name:
globejetsetter
probably in an airport lounge

review_body: Rooms and bathrooms are quite large although very old and outdated, no ceiling lights which I found odd. Staff were friendly. Breakfast is only served till 9am so I didn’t experience that. Pool is very small. They offer a free area shuttle which comes past every 20-30mins or so. In a good location although I’ve stayed at better hotels closer to the main shops for the same price. Probably would not stay again.

Our family stay at this hotel was very enjoyable - especially the friendly and helpful staff (especially Nicole who is at reception - she was always happy to help with any queries).Also, the customer service from the rest of the staff who clean the rooms and do the daily breakfast was EXCELLENT.. I would definitely go back there as it was also in a central location regarding access to shops and only a short walk to the beach. Additionally, the free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping mall was very convenient. Thanks again to Nicole and all the staff for making our trip FABULOUS.....

Stayed 2 nights here at the end of our stay in Hawaii. This hotel has some good points - it is well located, some of the staff are excellent and the room was spacious.Our negative was that we arrived to find a blocked toilet. We reported this in the evening and were informed that there was no maintenance available until 8am the next day. The hotel seemed initially very casual in their response - rather than finding us another room they gave us access to the public toilet on the ground floor (5 floors down) and seemed to think this would suffice! We reminded them that we had paid for an en suite and so we should expect this. On checkout however, the management waived our resort fee as a gesture for the inconvenience. Breakfast was provided - very basic and lots of room for improvement but better than nothing (only available until 9am though!)Concierge not particularly knowledgeable on the attractions in Waikiki.Positives to the hotel are location and the nice outside courtyard area with good WiFi access. Apart from the approach to the maintenance issue , the staff were friendly and attentive.

A friend and I stayed here and the room size was massive compared to what you normally get. The location was perfect and the breakfast whilst not extensive was delicious and you don't really need much more - fresh fruit and bakery items, perfect! The staff at Aqua Oasis are so wonderful, friendly and helpful. They always have a smile on their faces and are happy to help out with anything! Would 1000% stay here again :) Thanks so much Aqua Oasis!

We stayed here with our 3 young kids for 2 weeks before an international military PCS & from the moment we arrived the wonderful staff looked after us in every way possible!!! We had a tight schedule with all the last minute move stuff & had 2 vehicles to valet at one point. Mike, Mark & Steven made everything smooth & seamless with respect to our huge number of bags, taxis, rentals, timings etc & did so with a grin & a kind word- all the while keeping everything & everyone else on time too. The rooms were beautifully presented & well taken care of each day & the kiddos loved the couple of opportunities they got to enjoy the pool. We would absolutely stay here again in a second & fully recommend it to anyone for business, vacation or prior to a move from Hawaii. Thank you Niki, Mike, Mark, Steven & Analyn for everything you did & do!!! We’ll be back!!! The Dunn’s.

Stayed here for 5 nights and was a bit disappointed. The rooms were quite good but the breakfast was the pits. I have checked on the cost of this hotel and it is over $400 per night, you would think that a couple of choices of cereal, two choices of fruit, toast, two types of pastries and coffee for breakfast is a bit lousy. On checking in, we were told that there would be a surcharge of USD 25 per day. I enquired about this but they could not tell me what it was for. Apparently this was bought in by the council but it was never enacted into law, so don,t pay it. They can not force you. This applies to all hotels. Someone is making big bucks for nothing.The staff were all very good and willing to help.It is quite a good hotel. Pity about the breakfadst.

Hotel is old and has musty, mildew smell. Wish we hadn't booked it. Fortunately only 1 night. Don't understand how it can have good reviews. Never again. Also room was too cold, front desk rep literally told me we couldn't turn the air down because mildew would grow!

Stayed 3 nights for honeymoon. I loved the reasonable price of hotel and everything was satisfying. Location is very great for sightseeing city streets and it takes approximately 10 minutes to get to Waikiki beach. But we could enjoy shopping like luxury brands and ABC stores while going to beach.Room conditions was also good. Clean restroom and wide bathtub. They don’t provide toothbrushes set so you need to prepare it by yourself. Staffs are friendly and attentive to assist guests. When we ask for microwave, they were willing to put it to our room for free. We liked the breakfast as well. Menu is very simple with breads, cereals and two fruits and we could enjoy Kona coffee which made us feel better every morning.I highly recommend this hotel! :)

I asked for upgrade as view from the window/balcony was of a construction area (I was charged an extra $20 per night though, which annoyed me). When you leave your charged another fee, I think it was around $25 for each night stayed, which I was unaware of when booking? Havent a clue really what thats about, but maybe it covers the free breakfast (so your paying for it after all its NOT free). Basic breakfast but need to be there early to get a seat as limited seating (we only bothered with the one breakfast).Pool small/No ocean views. On the plus side, handy to bus/restaurants/shopping and beach within walking distance. Not modern or luxurious, but beds clean and comfy. NIce turtle/fish pond area to sit. There is a lovely man named "Michael" who works here and he assisted us with luggage/tips on where to eat/shopping areas and access to the free shuttle. Seek Michael out if you want any info etc. Hes awesome! If your staying here I would recommend ringing to request a room with no construction views.Considering the extra $20 a night plus the unknown $25 a night fee, ended up costing more for our family holiday than expected. If saving/planning another trip to Hawaii, I would most likely stay somewhere closer to the beach area with a view of ocean. I mean if your going to Hawaii.....I want to wake each day to a view of the ocean.

The location was absolutely brilliant walking distance to everything you need! Our room was huge, clean and tidy! Continental breakfast was basic but that was all we needed! The first look of the hotel is lovely with the garden surrounding the lobby with the Koi pond so relaxing.All the staff were great but would like to thank in particular Maria, Mika and Mark for going beyond our expectations to make our stay and anniversary celebrations so special.We highly recommend this hotel and we will be back.

During check in we were told that we were given a free upgrade. One bed had bed bugs. Filthy room and the outside view was all construction. After complaining, we were told that they were fully booked and had no other rooms to relocate us. Left and went to the Marriott for the same price.

So highly recommend this hotel! The room that my friend and I shared was huge, clean and tidy! The staff were all so helpful and so very friendly which makes your stay so much more. The location was absolutely brilliant walking distance to everything you need! The 3 nights we stayed we were only able to have one breakfast (by choice)and it was perfect just the basic breakfast but that was all we needed! The first look of the hotel is lovely with the garden surrounding the lobby with the Koi pond so relaxing Thank you to Niki and all the staff!!We will be back

Cost to location to ease of access to everything is perfect really. Don’t expect a out of sight ocean view though. I was in 701 which had a huge bath tub and a big room with kitchenette and balcony (think all rooms have that). Staff was all very nice.Breakfast - never got to try and enjoy it, it’s started at 7 and I had to be out the door by 7. Everytime I left in the am though there was coffee and it was really good.The pool - just pretend they don’t have one, though if the sun was beating down and you just wanted to cool off that would be the place. I sat in the chairs and then took that one picture, the other one is from the room.

Close to everything we wanted when we first arrived. Room was comfortable and from balcony could see some nearby construction but didn't get bothered by noise. Chose this spot for location and free shuttle service for shopping which was easy to use. Loved learning a new Hawaiian word each day.

Great location . Price good includes breakfast and a nice gift basket at Check in. Close to everything as well. Wakiki beach just blocks away as well as international market. Staff friendly and helpful.

I stayed at the Aqua Oasis for 4 nights early April/2018. Of the hotels within my budget, this one had the better reviews. The cleanliness of the rooms is what got me to book with them. I'm happy to report, the hotel lived up to my expectations. My room was very clean! It was also very roomy and the king size bed was great-it was very comfortable. The A/C is pre set in the room at just the right temperature. I never had to adjust it. I was welcomed to my room with a gift basket full of goodies and bottled water. That was a first for me in Hawaii and a very nice touch! I found the Staff very friendly and helpful. I requested a microwave on arrival and while I was out getting some things from Long's Drugs across the street, they put it in my room. I had the continental breakfast one day but wasn't able to eat much due to my gluten sensitivity. I expected as much though.Overall, I'm pleased with the hotel and my stay there. Everything you need is in walking distance I found.

We stayed here for a week and enjoyed the free breakfast every morning along with the excellent hospitality by all the staff and Maria from front desk. The location is excellent in the middle of Waikiki and there's even a free shuttle to Ala Moana. There is free wifi and a nice place to lounge around in the lobby area.

We were upgraded for free, staff was nice, hotel was clean, it certainly not the best hotel in Waikiki but for the price i would say its great. There is a free breakfast its near everything you’d want to do around

We had a great stay st Aqua Oasis 22nd march to 5 April 2018Our room was clean and quite large plenty of room for myself and my daughter to make ourselves feel comfortable. Easy walking distance to everywhere in Waikiki. Shopping, Beach, Restaurants,Buses etc.Our housekeeper Angelita was very pleasant and when she was on duty our room was always made up well.There were building works going on in the Building next door to ours which did mean we were woken by the sound of trucks at 7am but that was not under the control of our hotel. Just unfortunate timing and it didnt bother us too much as we went out each day to see the sites and go shopping.All staff that we dealt with were always very pleasant and helpful.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Aqua Oasis and would definately stay there again.Elizabeth and AmandaAustralia.

We had a great time at Aqua Oasis. The location is great, just over 2 blocks to the beach and 5 minutes within the main streets of Waikiki. Older style hotel, we were on the 5th floor in a Junior suite, king bed, sofa bed and rollaway, large bathroom, great balcony at the back of the hotel. Small pool which we like as we spend most time at the beach. The staff are very friendly from reception (can't remember names) and Mark - he looked after us, greeted, parked the car for us etc. Continental style breakfast OK, we went down and got what we wanted and returned to our room, suggest cream cheese for the bagels, we also went to local ABC stores to pick up other food items. Would stay again hope in the near future.

Upon arriving the front desk reception was super inviting and helpful. She pointed out all the best places to eat and go shopping. We quickly got to our room and it was nice and air-conditioned very spacious and clean.  The bathroom towels were large and fluffy in the tub was huge. The beds were extremely comfortable and clean.  The local gentleman that work there, Mike and Mark were extremely helpful, courteous and professional every day we saw them. Always had a smile on their face.  The continental breakfast was very lovely lots of assorted fruits and breads, donuts, bagels and cereals great local coffee.  The swimming pool was clean and refreshing and the outdoor area where you lounge in the sun was quiet and comfortable.  Just a short walk to the beach and shopping and restaurants are everywhere around the hotel. The whole family of five stayed for two weeks, We were sad when it was time to leave and we will be going back on our next vacation.

First time in Waikiki. Hotel had a great location right in the middle of the shopping and about 10 minutes to beach. Staff was very helpful and happy. Very helpful local guy set up in the lobby to give info on local spots, things to do ect. Rooms were clean and AC worked good. Hotel seems outdated especially the bathrooms in the rooms. Pool was the size of a large hot tub, breakfast was toast and pineapple with coffee. There is also a 25$ a day "resort fee" not included when you book online. Parking is valet only and 35$ a day.

We stayed four nights at a king bedroom. Room was spacious and clean. Bed was comfortable. Everything worked and staff was most friendly. We like the convenience of the location and the coin- operated washer/ dryers. Very useful for a longer stay. This is a quaint family- owned hotel. Nothing fancy but offeringGreat value- for- money.
user_name:
SWCHAN
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my 2nd stay with Aqua Oasis.We took the junior suite this time round because we had 2 adults and a child.The room was great.Service at the lobby as excellent.Special thanks to Jhara and Michael.The breakfast was simple but it's good enough.I was wondering if you could have the hard boil eggs again like last year?I am sure it will be popular having some protein.I love the shuttle bus around Waikiki area.The drivers are so friendly and they will always tell you the last pick up time in case you'll miss the ride back.Aqua Oasis has made this family trip very memorable for us.Thank you..Once again!We will definitely be back again!

I took this hotel to break a trip from the Kauai. The rooms are small though but functional. The breakfast is good enough for the day. The shuttle bus is very very convenient to go around , and at the same time it doubles a s a tour around the city. Different drivers give a different personal aspect of the city.

Husband surprised me with a weekend staycation at this hotel last weekend. The only reason I gave them three stars was for the polite staff and customer service. The room was old, the bathtub was large, but slightly grimy. Paint was peeling above my head in the bedroom, and the view was horrible. The breakfast was not worth the time.A plus is that it is a central location to shops, restaurants, and beaches. Dont think this is luxury, it is not.I won't stay here again

Booked the standard room which wasn't cheap and they charge $25 dollars per day at the end for amenity charge which includes a very basis continental breakfast which was the same offering each day. Two weeks of the same boring breakfast. Although on 9th floor could still hear rubbish collection trucks early in the morning, noise from people coming out of bars in the early hours and construction site opposite. Doors to balcony need to be double glazed. Bath was difficult to get in and out of due to having to step quite a way into the bath. Found door to room left on the latch by cleaners one day and another day they hadn't even cleaned the room. When I went to reception they said they would send up fresh towels but cleaning staff had gone for the day so nothing could be done. Not enough room at breakfast for everyone to sit. Room average size. I have had larger rooms in Florida hotel room. Not enough light in room to read.

Yesu at reception and everyone else in the hotel went absolutely out of their way to make our stay a pleasantly memorable one. The hotel was well located, clean and comfortable. The rooms were big and spacious. Plenty of space for all 4 of us. There is also a complimentary shuttle to Ala Moana, which was very convenient.If I ever come to Waikiki again I have no need to look for a hotel anymore because I know that me and my family won't be more comfortable and more at home than at the Aqua Oasis.Very highly recommended. A wonderful experience.
user_name:
Gibran A S
Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic

review_body: Loved our stay here will return. Clean spacious suite. View of the back alley wasn't fantastic, and some nights the parking lots seemed to be a party spot. But the hotel itself has so much to offer, the staff were awesome, the breakfast was great. The wifi was strong. The location is perfect, public transit from the airport to the hotels front entrance is extremely helpful and easy to use. Very happy with our visit.

I would always strongly recommend this property to stay, for a long stay or short stay. The rooms are absolutely clean, strong quick wi fi and with all of the normal amenities in the room. There is a free continental breakfast offered every morning, with plenty of coffee, and a daily newspaper. Rowelyn was our housekeeper, and she did a thorough job each and every day, making sure that everything was real clean in our room, and always left extra coffee! There is Laundry machines, washer and dryer on the main floor, just behind and around the corner of the front desk, for only"$1.50 load. There is a nice garden area just to sit and enjoy nature and have a smoke if you so desire. The location is close to several good restaurants, and it only took us about 7 minutes to walk to the Beach. The hotel is in a quiet area of Waikiki, and there were never any loud parties going on in the hotel. All of the staff know their jobs, and they do them well. Just can't say enough about the hotel it was great..............Ralph and Richael Tweten This is our third long term stay here and we love it.

For the second year in a row we stayed at the Aqua Oasis on Lewers Street. I called the hotel directly to make our reservation and spoke with Dee who gave us a better deal than what I was finding from websites. What brought us back was the staff and how they treat you like 'ohana' or family and the accomodations. Everyone from the General Manager - Evelyn Shiroma, to the desk clerk - Jhara, to the doorman - Michael, to our chambermaid - Angelita are a delight with friendly smiles and greetings of 'Aloha'! We adore this hotel because of its location, just off Kalakaua which is the main thoroughfare in Waikiki. Close proximity to everything - Quicksilver down the street for beach apparel shopping, Long's for sunblock, munchies, snacks and just about anything you might need. All the restaurants, shops, and beaches are within a half mile radius of the hotel. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the bathroom is spacious. We typically started our day with a continental breakfast and to read what entertainment was available on the whiteboard - surf report, Hawaiian word of the day, weather. Mornings are fun sitting with the other guests of the hotel and striking up a conversation. Having just returned, we are already planning our third 'annual' trip to Honolulu and our stay at the Aqua Oasis! Aloha!

The hotel ambiance was just in point. If you are looking for a hotel to stay , i personally recommend this. While checking in the guy named jake was very helpful and professional in terms of assisting us and the staff are overwhelmingly . This not a expensive hotel to stay but they provide good service.

Yasu and his team were both friendly and professional. Significant street noise which in inself gave credence to the hotel;s claim to be very central to the night life in Lewers Street and Waikiki in general.

Baby gap pool, wouldnt do anything with that but the room was sweet. Got upgraded and was very comfy night with good size tub. Clean and super friendly staff, would go back. Missed the breakfast, cuts off at 845, which was the lamest.. nothing a morning beer cant solve.

I love this hotel and recently stayed there on my third visit in two years. While it’s not 5 star, it offers a “boutique” feel and is truly an oasis away from the craziness of present day Waikiki. The rooms are adequate, as is the breakfast. (I buy some 49c cream cheese sachets at the corner ABC store to add to my daily breakfast bagels). But, what I love about the hotel is that it is so close to public transport and so far removed in feel from the hustle and bustle of the chaos of Waikiki. The pool area is very modest, but is never busy and gives the feeling of being at your own home and is very “chilled”. It captures sun for most of the day and all the staff are extremely friendly and welcoming.

Although it was a "reasonable" price (compared to other hotels in the Waikiki area), they have a lot of room for improvement. This is an older hotel that could use some updates. If you want to hang out in the crowded hotel zone, this is place strategically located. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, but here are some observations:1. My wife and I were in a room with 2 double beds although we requested and confirmed a King bed - so much for a romantic getaway - we had to sleep in separate beds for 5 nights...the first time in 33 years of marriage...bummer!2. They sprung a $35.00 per day valet fee to park our car on us which was unexpected and unbudgeted - I can't find anywhere on their website where they specify the amount.3. Like most Hawaii hotels, the tack on a $25.00 per day hotel fee - as their website says, "This fee allows guests to enjoy many resort services and activities without having to incur additional miscellaneous charges." We never saw anything that justified the additional charge. Why not just publish your daily rate instead of tacking on all these additional fees?4. Continental breakfast is provided - pretty sparse, but we made due. The pineapple was pretty good. Also included 4 cereal choices and stale donuts. Incidentally, I saw one of the kitchen staff hand washing the breakfast dishes in a side room. I don't find that to be a sanitary means to clean dishes that other people use - I wonder what the state board of health feels about that....5. Our room could use a good cleaning - there were greasy hand prints all over the place including on all the doors and light switches.6. The swimming pool was slightly larger than a bathtub - this thing is so small you would have to step out of it to change your mind. We never used it, although it would have been nice after a long day - just too small.7. The dining area for continental breakfast is pretty small - if you want to get a table, you need to get there when they open at 7:00 am.If you are budget conscious and don't mind staying at a lower end hotel, this could be the place for you. It's close to the action, but as previously said, they have room for improvement.

Me and a friend stayed here for 4 nights and I was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even offered a bigger room than the one we had already booked at no extra charge. The location is just the best. Close to Waikiki beach, shopping malls, restaurants and a bus stop just a few step from the hotel. I highly recommend this place for anyone staying in Honolulu.

I stayed at the Aqua Oasis from Jan. 29 to Feb. 2 while I conducted grant writing workshop at the University of Hawaii. My room was wonderful; staff was professional and accommodating. Highly recommended hotel for business or pleasure!

We booked a junior suite for my daughter and sister-in-law during a wedding in Honolulu. They stayed there over the 2017 Christmas holiday. The Jr suite was large, good amenities and located close walking distance to everything associated with Waikiki. The cost of the Jr suite wasn't much more than the regular room. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Loved the turtle pond. The complimentary breakfast was an added bonus especially for families on a budget. This is one of the few hotels on Waikiki offering a complimentary breakfast. Everything considered I highly recommend the Aqua Oasis. Have a wonderful time in paradise Trip Advisor travelers.

We stayed in a room with a kitchenette with our three young children; the location was fine and the staff were all really helpful. One staff member in particular (apologies for not recalling her name, she worked at the front desk on the evening of the 10th Jan) gave great recommendations for the kids and came up with some great solutions for our various random issues as we settled in. The continental breakfast was good (kids loved the donuts), the lobby with the turtles and fish (and lizards if you look) was exciting for the kids, the room was a good size and had good air conditioning, the pool was convenient and not busy and the shuttle was really useful. I'd read in earlier reviews that the rooms were loud, but ours was at the back of the hotel and we had no issues.A few things stopped it from being perfect; the kitchen wasn't well equipped (although the front desk sent up bowls, etc, when we asked) and could really use a kettle and a dishcloth. There was a sign in the bathroom telling us to hang towels to keep or leave them on the floor to change, but there was nothing to say there was no service unless requested. The pool was nice but has a really steep gradient so wasn't particularly great for kids. We'd definitely recommend it, it wasn't a bargain but it was a fair price in an adequate location.

I can't remember if it was room 212 or room 221 but it was located directly across from the housekeeping office. So forget about any sleep after 5 a.m when the employees arrive for their shifts and start opening the door, punching in, taking out cleaning equipment, etc. It was also an ADA room (which I didn't need) and it looked like it was half built. Besides a very awkward shower set up (due to it being ADA), there were patched walls that were in desperate need of paint. I kindly asked for another room but was told they were all booked and couldn't move me. Hmm. . . I decided to check if this was true and went online and saw that they were still accepting reservations for that evening for the same type of room I had. Thank goodness I was traveling for work because I can't imagine staying in that room for vacation, no matter what the price was. That room should only be rented as a last resort. Like if there was some sort of emergency and they had to put people up wherever they could. This was my second time staying here. First time was great. Won't stay again.

The staff at Aqua Oasis go out of their way to please. I had requested a quiet room, but because I arrived close to midnight, they gave me the last room, which was next to the elevator, and to noisy construction. I asked to be moved to a quiet room the next day. Ryan, Jhara, and Cliff worked together to move me into a great room that was significantly quieter. They were great! The Bell Captain, Michael was really helpful booking an airport shuttle for my return trip. Bravo to the staff at this hotel, that is situated in the best part of Waikiki.

Very reasonable, convenient location, friendly and nice staffs.何度も利用しています。リーズナブルなのに立地がかなり良く、スタッフの方々も親切に対応してくださいます。朝食は無料で提供され、ロビーにはウォーターサーバーも用意されています。また、ランドリーはフロントのすぐ裏にあり他ホテルに比べて安く利用できるのでとても便利です。お部屋はキッチン付きではない方に毎回宿泊していますが、広めで過ごしやすく、バスルームはバスタブが結構大きいのでゆったりしていて、シャワーカーテンの代わりにガラス戸で仕切られているため水がバスタブの外に漏れることもなく、とても使いやすいです。セキュリティも入り口のところに見張りの方が常駐しているため安心して過ごせます。ビーチに行くときはビーチ用のバスタオルを無料で貸し出ししています。ハワイ渡航歴10回以上で、これまで数々のホテルを利用してきましたが、この価格帯で提供される設備・サービスとしては文句のつけどころが見当たりません。とにかくコスパが最高なのでハワイのリピーターの方々には特にオススメです。

We spent four days at this lovely hotel between the Christmas and New Year holidays. The room and lobby are tastefully decorated. The location is convenient. Staff are friendly. Breakfast is basic, but the server named Analyn is very kind and helpful.

We rented at Aqua Oasis a small suite (#707) for our family of adults and teenagers for 8 nights. Hotel is located in 5-10 min short walk from the beach (entrance through Sheraton) and just 2 min from the central shopping street in Waikiki and also 2 min from bus stops on another street.Keep in mind that you cannot see the ocean from the room. Also the street below is very noisy (expected for a central location) if you sleep with opened balcony and window. Of course you may close everything and turn on A/C.The room is very clean, towels are big. You also have beach towels service.Front desk personal is very very nice and always will help you. Shower is in big bathtub and the shower head is on cord.The breakfast is truly continental. You get fresh oranges and pineapples, some cereals, milk, hot water, tea, 3 typed of excellent filtered coffee (regular Kona blend, decaf, and Kona with some vanilla). Also there are sweet donuts, 2 types of bread, sometimes bagels and sometimes croissants. There are not waffle machine, eggs, cheese or yogurts. Kona coffee blend was very tasty.They also have a free shuttle that is running 1-2 times per hour between the shopping mall and all other hotels (~8 in total) of Aqua group.Despite street noise and basic breakfast I give to the hotel 5 stars for a very good service and overall quality for a very reasonable price.I would definitely consider this hotel if I travel to Honolulu other time.

The hotel is really nothing special. We were a last minute booking-nothing was available and we got a Delta Medallion discount. There is only one front desk person -who is also the valet and concierge. She was super friendly-she had excellent suggestions for area cuisine.The morning desk person was very unaccomodating and kind of crabby (okay really crabby)The hotel is pretty outdated, but that is the charm-one doesn’t come to Hawaii for the shower, fixtures or the room decor-Hawaii is, well, full of spectacular scenery!Overall, Aqua Oasis gets major kudos for very friendly and kind staff.

We booked this hotel for the first half of our honeymoon. Lots were booked up as we didn't realize it was Thanksgiving when we were arriving. I booked a junior suite hoping it would be a bit nicer and mentioned our honeymoon in the booking. We weren't offered anything for our honeymoon - not even a welcome drink/water - anything.While the location of this hotel was great - it was just a couple of hundred metres from the main street - so walking distance to all the shops and restaurants and the bar Moose McGillacuddy's, and just a couple blocks to the beach, the aircon in the hotel was so noisy and right above the bed but it was too hot without it. There was also a bit of a musty smell - not sure if that's just the humidity or the filter needed changing.

We needed a room at this hotel for 6 hours - 12-6pm as we were stuck leaving our Airbnb before our 11pm flight. Hotel solution was for us to pay for 2 nights. We would have loved to have stayed here and been able to say they valued customer service. That was not the case.

The hotel was ok. The wifi in the room did not work well. Lobby wifi worked better. The cleaning of the room was ok, but could have been better. The location to Waikiki and public transport was good. Free shuttle to shopping was handy as part of the hotel offering. The breakfast is very basic, with toast, cereal and a couple of pastries.

The room was perfect and very clean. The staff so friendly and nothing was an issue.Location perfect just a block and a half from the beach and a half a block from the action.Breakfast was basic but that is all you need.

we highly recommend Aqua Oasis, we arrived early and our room was not ready but we were offered another room. Yasu was very professional yet friendly at the same time nothing was a problem he made us feel welcome gave some great tips. The location is great away from the busy streets but walking distance to beach, shops and restaurants. Breakfast is basic but to was fresh and enough.

Unfortunately, I have to give this hotel an average rating because of the noise at night. We have stayed here before but never had a room on the street side usually we stay on the construction side ( no noise at night). The noise from the Irish pub and the bar opposite finished at 3:30 am weekdays and 5am weekends.On the upside everything else was great ,staff pleasant, very clean large rooms complementary breakfast, complementary shuttle bus .Overall bring your earplugs and you’ll have a great stay!

We stayed at the Aqua Oasis Joy recently. We had booked a junior suite as well as a junior suite with a kitchenette. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are so many choices around the area, that this was not an issue. A continental breakfast is provided, 4 types of cereal toast, bagels, fruit etc.Staff that impressed were our housekeeping person, Rowelyn and Yasu on the front desk.The Aqua group offers a complimentary shuttle for guests to and from Ala Moana shopping centre every 30-60 minutes.

This is our second stay at Oasis. Stayed for 12 nights. Large room with very comfortable beds and air conditioner worked well. Evelyn was great in organising our accommodation and it was great to see the same friendly staff. Miko and Yasu were fantastic rooms were cleaned well and efficiently. We missed out on shower gel a couple of times but Miko on the front desk was able to give us some so no problem. The toiletries are quite small with amount of productso with two of us washing our hair they didn't really have enough. We had a problem with our TV connection losing signal. It was fixed quickly but we found it dropped out a few times. We were able to fix it ourselves by checking the connection but it was a little frustrating. The continental breakfast was great this year with the addition of cereal and a juice bar. There was plenty to give us a good size breakfast and variety in the pastries. Only negative was one day there was no jelly for the toast. The Ala Moana shuttle service is good but there is quite a wait for it, sometimes more than half an hour and it travels a long way before you get to the center. It would be good to have one more shuttle so they are more frequent. It can add an hour to your trip. Earl is really lovely and full of good tips for your shopping trip.Overall a very comfortable hotel close to everything with fantastic staff. If you want views it's not the place to stay. There was noise from a construction site for a couple of days but it wasn't too much of a problem. Thank you again for a lovely stay.

location was very good,short walk to the beaches,lots of restaurants and convienience stores.Rooms were fairly large,(had 2 doubles and a rollaway bed)and clean,Huge balcony(lanai).free towels to take to the beach.Our room faced a busy part of the street,we were on the 5th floor so you could hear traffic as well as noise from the pub next to the hotel.Our room was next to the Elevator,which we did not have any issues with the noise from it,but the area had the smell of food being cooked everyday of our stay,I should have mention this to the front desk.Breakfast was very poor,same every morning,not a lot of variety or hot breakfast.There were a lot of nearby restaurants and a couple of food courts.Check in/Check out went ok,Nicole from the front desk was really great,always ready to help and have a chat.We made a request in our reservations for 2 double beds and a rollaway,when we arrived in the room there was no rollaway,had to arrange it with front desk to get housekeeping to deliver and make the bed.The rollaway bed was in a very poor condition,the springs were sagging and the matress was so thin that you could feel the springs through.Requested another bed with front desk the next day,recevied a much better rollaway bed.Front desk staff are very helpful and responsive do their outmost to resolve any issue.in fact all of the staff at Aqua were good and helpful with information. All in all we had a great stay in Ohau and at Aqua Oasis.Wished they had a free shuttle from and to the Airport.

My title says it all, 5th time to HNL and I always stay on Lewers St, it is the place to stay. Central with easy access around HNL and Oahu.The hotel is a little older than some, it has everything you will need. The safe packed in and had to be reset. Reception was helpful over all.Parking available (payment required).When it rains the hotel can be slippery all over! Beach towels available for use. The breakfast while included in the rate (which you obviously are paying for) is very very average. It's repudiative day after day and very limited. And AQUA OASIS live by your own rules, if they towel is hanging up I'll use it again!!! If it's in the bath change it over please. Mine was ALWAYS HANGING AND WAS ALWAYS CHANGED.

I booked 2 nights in Aqua Oasis on a rival website to Trip Advisor, and that website gave me some incorrect information about the hotel which caused me to book a Standard Room. Upon arriving there, I found out that the information provided to me was incorrect. I was a upset (I had been lied to!), but not at the staff/hotel...at the stupid site which fed me incorrect information (and which I will never use again). The lady manning the front desk upgraded me from a Standard Room to a Junior Suite at no expense and took very good care of me. She didn't have to do that...but that's how the service of this establishment takes care of its guests. I appreciated that greatly.Aqua Oasis is a nice, independently-owned hotel located in downtown Honolulu. It is several located several blocks from Waikiki Beach, and it is in easy walking distance of the beach, lots of restaurants, shopping and entertainment locations. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are nice, and the prices are reasonable. Breakfast is included from 7am-9am for all rooms, which is a nice touch (many of the hotels in this area did NOT include breakfast, or they only include it to people staying in higher-end rooms). The Junior Suite I stayed in had a full kitchen (full-size refrigerator, stove, microwave, sink, dishes, etc. The only thing it lacked was an oven.), its own private, furnished balcony, a large King sized bed, spacious bathroom (with the fancy electronic toilet that had a built-in bidet and dryer), a nice flat-screen TV (42" or bigger), and other nice amenities.The major issue with this hotel (like all of the surrounding hotels in the area) is that parking is limited. There is a small, scary parking lot located on the backside of the hotel that charges $45(!!!) per day to park your car! Judging by the questionable people hanging around in that parking lot, I would recommend paying the hotel $30/day for their valet parking. It is secure, keeps your car safe, and the staff is prompt to get your car when you ask for it.Great ambiance, wonderful staff, and a convenient location makes this a hotel that I recommend you consider when staying in the Waikiki Beach area. I would stay there again.

This hotel is a real all rounder Very clean, just off the main street, close to the beach, in the middle of the shopping district, public transport is less than a minute walk, free shuttle to Ala Mona shopping centre If you just arrive and you need a convenient store there is Abc stores and the Whalers Great places to eat is Moose's, Korea bbq and Thai. All in the same street as the hotel. Keep in mind you can see fireworks every Friday if you are on the top floorsThey also have a self service washing machine and drying in the hotel. It cost six quarters Overall had a great time will rebook when we come back to Waikiki

Had to overnight with some clients. Of course I got the standard room (twin beds) but it was totally fine, we were just over nighting with a business group in town. The Oasis is refurbished from the old Joy. They did a pretty decent job with the upgrade but as with the older hotels like these, there is only so much you can do. But they did a good job so no complaints. Room was decent sized, a/c worked well and it was fairly noise free (quieter side of Lewers). Bathroom was clean and the water pressure was good. Standard bathroom amenities. Really didn't spend more than 6 hours in the room so it did it's job. Included breakfast was good: cereals, baked good (muffins) boiled eggs, juices, coffees- worked for me and group. The open air lobby is funky but kind of fun: swing chairs, fish pond area, and a soaking pool (you can't jump into it, too shallow). The sun/lounge chairs work as long as you are there when the sun hits the deck (due to other buildings the sun isn't always there. Best part are the staff, they are super friendly and willing to answer any question with a smile (even the valet guys).The Oasis works, totally functional, nice rooms for an overnight and the breakfast was everything you can want for an included meal in Waikiki. HINT: we took the group to the karaoke joint on site; it's probably the best song selection in the island and great prices. Not the most modern but the rooms have ice cold a/c and no tech issues. They even bring drinks to you when you intercom and you can bring your own food. Lots of fun. Back to the hotel, I would definitely bring clients back to the Oasis on a short stay. It's not a resort but great for overnights.

Mahalo to Yasu and the Aqua Oasis Ohana for making our staycation fun! Room was large and spacious. There was a shuttle to take us around so we took it to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Nice continental breakfast with the basics...cereal, toast, fruit, hard boiled eggs, and donuts.

Stayed here twice now, and will continue coming back. Location is awesome, as is the price. Yes, the hotel isn't a new modern resort, but it's rooms are massive, very clean with comfy beds, and good quiet air-con. The check-in staff member (Yasu I think his name was?) was super friendly, allowing us to check in 3hrs early, much appreciated after a long haul flight! Lots of help with shuttle services, taxis etc... and free biscuts on check out! Also free breakfast with toast, fruit, juice and doughnuts! All these little things add up to 5 stars from us, see you again soon!

FANTASTIC STAYCATION!! Stayed over the weekend and one of the best staycations ever!! Staff is friendly and the hotel is located conveniently in the center of Waikiki for easy access to everything Waikiki has to offer. Room was clean and spacious and very comfortable!! Definitely my staycation spot from now on!! Thank you Aqua Oasis for a wonderful weekend!

We stayed for 3 nights at the Aqua Oasis after having disembarked from a cruise to Hawaii. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a really pretty junior suite on the 3rd floor with a sofa and a small kitchen. The hotel's location is great: only a few minutes' walk to the army museum and the beach, and perhaps 15mins to Waikiki-Beach where the statue of "Duke" is located.If you book, you may want to ask for a room on one of the higher floors (5 and up), because the (bad) singing at the Karaoke-Bar can be heard a tad too well.

Started the weekend in one of the suite rooms on the top floor. The room was fantastic a was the staff. The hotel has valued parking, and the bell service it's waiting curbside upon arrival. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to everything exciting in Waikiki, and there is a quaint little Korean barbeque right next to the hotel. Everyone is friendly, and the service at the hotel is excellent. We will definitely be staying here again!

We stayed at the Aqua Oasis on the last night of our honeymoon. They upgraded us to a sweet for free and it was wonderful! Great staff, around great restaurants, just blocks from the beach! Pool is on the small side but they have a dry sauna and nice lounge chairs.

This was centrally located for a person travelling on there own.Close to the beach and shops. Hotel offered free bus around the island.Room was clean and tidy and staff helpful. Swimming pool not big but was nice to cool down before dinner.
user_name:
Shirley F
Methven, null, New Zealand

review_body: We only stayed for two nights pre cruise. I like the location being close to shops and restaurants although a shortish walk (about 10 minutes) to the beach for a swim. Main beaches are somewhat further away. I am not sure on the size of normal rooms as I think we were upgraded to a "suite" with a lounge and kitchen so found it all spacious as was the bathroom. We enjoyed the Irish pub across the road as well as heading to Hula's and Dukes in the heart of everything. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast adequate. Nice, small pool and a lovely, fountain, courtyard. They have laundry facilities. All the staff were welcoming and helpful. All places in Waikiki are going to be noisy unless you score (and can afford) a room right on the beach but we didn't have a problem sleeping and I'm a light sleeper. Great option to have cooking facilities if you are here for a longer stay. On our return visit to Waikiki we stayed at a place overlooking the beach however for a short visit or stop over I would come back here - also a great Japanese BBQ restaurant across the road

This hotel is very accommodating to military on TLA. Rooms were spacious comfortable and everyone on staff is gracious and helpful. Very pleasant experience. It was also the only hotel in the area to offer the continental breakfast, which was very nice.
user_name:
Ezra S
Williamsburg, Virginia, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Aqua Oasis for 7 nights. The room was large, the twin beds comfortable, the bathroom functional and to our surprise: a continental breakfast that was good enough for each and every morning. We had coffee, fresh juice, pastry, toast and boiled eggs. The time of room cleaning was variable, but we managed to coordinate even though several times we had to leave and wait in poolside while they finished their work. With the exception of the first day, the folks at the font desk were friendly and efficient. The reason we marked down half a star is because the property is aged, have been in service quite some time under several names. It could use an upgrade to contemporary standards. In addition the size of the pool is very small by any standard.

Stayed here on our first and last night in Hawaii - was such a great location spot as a stones throw from the buzz of downtown Waikiki and everything you need. The team were really helpful and the rooms were massive and had big bathrooms and kitchens. The wifi dropped in and out and was better when we used other room numbers (checked and they had it free so they didn’t get stung with our browsing!) but seriously you are in Waikiki, short stints are all you need.To be honest there is so much around that you won’t want to spend much time in the room but if you need quiet time, cooler temps, isolation from the shops at a decent price then this will hit the spot.

翌日友人と合流するため街中のお手頃なホテルを探して宿泊しました。リノベーションはされていますが、基本は古いホテルなんだと思います。ベッド周り、テレビは綺麗でしたが、水周りがあまり綺麗ではありませんでした。洗面台やバスタブなどに短い髪の毛が数本落ちていたり、洗面所のコンセントは汚れが付いている、ドライヤーもベタベタした何かが付いている…。お安いホテルなので仕方ないかなとは思いました。ベッドルームのスタンドライトは壊れているか電球が切れているか、点きませんでした。どうしても苦手だったのはエアコンの汚れ。どうもお部屋がカビ臭い…よくよくエアコンを見ると吹き出し口もほこりがビッシリ。身体を壊すと思い、エアコンは止めて窓を開けて過ごしました。もう泊まらないかな。This hotel was renovated, but basicly old.Some short hairs were there in the bath room.There was something sticky on the hair dryer.There were too much dust in the airconditioner.

All the staff was really nice and accommodating for my family. Yasu and the other lady with long black hair and glasses (sorry I forgot your name!) we’re on point with their customer service. Place had everything we needed and the location was the best. We were able to walk everywhere!

The Aqua Oasis is very well located in downtown Honolulu well within walking distance of all the shops and beaches. It is also close to public transport and tour pick up points The staff were very helpful and the room was spacious and clean. Price was also very competitive.We would stay here again

We stayed here for five nights. The room was spacious and comfortable and since it was a junior suite, it had a large balcony and a kitchenette. The only negative was the moldy smell in the bathroom (the towels were fresh, so I am assuming it is in the plumbing or walls somewhere). Also the street was a bit noisy for our taste. The pubs close at 4 am and we were woken up each morning around that time. I don't blame the hotel for the pub behavior though. We were on the sixth floor and the noise was still substantial as it is a narrow street.All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The valets went out of their way to be helpful. I only came across one young woman at the desk who did not seem to be clear on details of the hotel, but she found someone who was able to help us (maybe she was new). I was very happy that the hotel had a laundry that we could use, that was very helpful for our stay.The free breakfast was minimal and can get crowed (maybe purchase a second toaster for the guests), but I think it was as advertised. Overall the room was a good value for us. We knew it would not have a good view, so that was not a surprise either. I probably would have scored it a five if the smell in the room was not present. I had seen that in other reviews, but I did not realize it was a permanent situation.

I stayed here in January and again in August/September and again i found the service was great. Niki and Yasu at the front desk and so nice and made you feel so welcomed every time they saw us, in fact all the staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Michael at the bell desk goes out of his way to help you. Thank you to all the staff. The hotel is in a good location and the corner rooms are large and spacious. The only thing I would suggest is adding maybe yoghurt or cereal to the breakfast menu for a bit more variety and also because like me I can't eat pasties so i can only enjoy a coffee or juice.

(Review will be very helpful for Military)Aqua Oasis was our home for the last 43 days. We were here since my husband was on permanent change of duty station(PCS). This hotel was in one of the approved hotels for military on PCS. My husband called a different aqua hotel but they didn't have any availability at that time. We gave them our "wish list" -- pool, free parking, breakfast, laundry facility, gym and in Waikiki. Then we were referred to this hotel. This Aqua hotel checked mostly all the boxes except for the gym. I'm so glad we chose this one. They are very helpful and when you are on PCS it is very stressful. The hotel knows the process of TLA, they will match the rate in Schofield Inn as well. We didn't have to spend any extra money since their rate is just on the TLA hotel budget. The best thing I like is the free parking as well. Parking can be quite expensive, imagine having to pay $25-30 per day. Also, not all hotels in Waikiki offers free breakfast. Its not much: bread, pastries, hard boiled egg and fruits, but it helps. Its not a big hotel and that is a pro for me. In bigger hotels, the lobby gets crowded. You'll have to fall in line just to talk to the receptionist and when you are in PCS you just tend to get in touch with the receptionist more than checking in and out. Also, it is valet parking and most hotels in Waikiki are valet. Since this is a small hotel you can get your car faster than in larger hotel. This helps especially in the morning when you need to go to work at Schofield. You don't have to wait very long for your car. By the way, from here to Schofield it takes about 40min- 1 hr drive. The traffic is mostly getting into H1. But its opposite the traffic so its doable. We have a room on the 4th floor. Queen bed with balcony. Its dated but its ok. Comfortable bed. AC works. I just wish it has ceiling fan. A bit small too, but we have 8 luggages. There is small fridge and a table and chairs. The bathroom is big but the tub is awkward. Only one time I saw a cockroach inside the room but I think its because the door has this big gap under it. Since we stayed here for 43 days we almost knew everyone. They were very courteous. The hotel is clean. You can see staff always maintaining the area clean. They have a small garden with fishes and small turtle. Very peaceful. They have a laundry facility which again is helpful for military. Its also in the center of everything. Walking distance to the beach and all restaurants. Free beach towel and chairs. We definitely recommend this area not just for military family in PCS but also for tourists.

Aqua Oasis was an amazing place to stay, friendly staff always willing to please, great rooms with King Size bed, room cleaned and made up daily.Excellent location, easy access to all that is on offer in HonoluluGreat value for money, the place to be

Me and my sister book this hotel every year for our birthday, so we always come twice a year! I forgot what her name was but the woman at the front desk is always so kind to us and she even upgraded our room to a bigger size because she saw that we had a bunch of things with us for my sisters birthday! Their beds are really comfortable! And all the rooms have a HUGE bathtub for soaking! I would suggest to get their junior suites because their toilets come with a heating option which is nice. The location is great because it's close by to a lot of restaurants and minutes away from the beach. Always more than satisfied when we come here. Can't wait to stay here again next year!

We come a couple times a year & stay at this hotel. The hotel is very tranquil. Rooms are nice Staff is great & always provide us with the best service! It’s in the heart of Waikiki and within walking distance to the Waikiki strip. Hotel also offers valet service!

Clean and tidy, advised we could have lunch in the restaurant on arrival but it was closed. Good location to shops and restaurants so not too inconvenient. Average rooms and not much in the way of facilities.

Was great to catch up with Rosie who was our room attendant last year. Great service and thanx for the hot weather. A short walk to the beach and lots of eating places along the way. All the shops you can think of if your big on shopping.

A great hotel!Will definitely come back again.Special thanks to Miko,Clifton and Michael who were very helpful and friendly throughout my trip.I was alone with my son and they were so nice to us and helping us to arrange transport etc.The shuttle services was definitely a plus point going to the mall and even to the beach!The staff at the hotel and the shuttle bus drivers made my trip a memorable one.

This boutique property has become my new favorite place to stay in Waikiki. I have been coming to Waikiki for years, and things have continually changed. With more luxury properties taking over, it moved me from my Ohana family over to the Aqua family. I discovered this hidden gem last year, and have been coming back ever since. This small property has better amenities than some of the larger properties have to offer...is very quiet, and is right in the heart of it all. While the property itself is an older property, it has been renovated and is very well maintained. Internet is great, rooms are very quiet and the staff is so friendly. I arrived from this trip sick and went straight to my room to rest. It was so comforting to feel so at home, and know that my stay would be quiet and peaceful while I recovered. I hope they bring back the bath products they had last year...Hawaiian Tropic is nice, but I loved what they had before...actually searched it on the internet and use it at home now as well. You can't go wrong with this property, and the pictures on the website are very accurate so I wont even bother posting. I have found my new home in Waikiki.

Great location, generously sized room, very clean, friendly helpful staff, reasonably quiet and I really liked the nice little restaurant attached too. I would definitely go back. Highly recommended to all.
user_name:
Alan H
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: This was our first stay at Aqua Oasis, the location was great, our granddaughter who is a health and fitness junkie lol; loved running to the beach each day and doing stretches under the coconut trees she was beyond excited (for those who think its dangerous exercising under the coconut trees; they do maintenance by removing the coconuts) Lots of things t do and places to eat along Waikiki, from morning to night.Aqua Oasis is beautiful, they have a koi pond, smokimg area, nice area for continental breakfast. Just wish the had cereal and oatmeal offered in their continental breakfast. The room was very roomy and clean.

Me and my wife needed a last minute getaway on a budget. I couldn't believe just how pleased we were with this hotel! Great staff, great location, for a great price. Do not confuse this budget hotel with a budget experience. We prefer this over the other more expensive hotels in Honolulu now!

My wife and I were overjoyed with our stay. The staff gave us a room upgrade for our anniversary to a junior suite with kitchenette. The room was very large and clean. The tub was huge! Valet service was fast and nice. The concierge, Sara, is superb! We will return as often as possible.

Such a quaint beauty tucked into Lewers street, Waikiki. Staff could not be more helpful! The concierges Sara Beth and colleagues are fantastic! They recommend only the very best and ensure guests experience authentic culture. Rooms are very spacious and tidy. Housekeeping maintain a high standard. The only downside was the noise from the Irish pub across the street at night. We upgraded to a suite on the other side of Hibiscus tower to avoid the noise. Friday nights are supposed to be the worst so be aware if you are facing out towards Lewers street! The staff were very accommodating and understood the need to change due to noise.
