The breakfast is VERY minimal (Light snacks of boiled eggs, sliced pineapples and oranges, toasts, bagels and juice). There is a IHOP right around the corner if you wan something more substantial. When we arrived we were granted a twin bedroom (re: mother daughter stay) and upheld the promise of the same once upgraded. Overall wonderful service from staff! The pool is small and outdated and the beach is approx. 5-10minute walk away but comforts of the rooms and staff are priceless!

If you are looking for a clean affordable hotel in a great location in Waikiki, stay here:) The staff are very friendly and helpful and provided a spare foldaway bed at the last minute w/o extra charge. Very generous of them! We were also given free continental breakfast & a free Ala Moana shuttle to and from the hotel. Laundry facilities are also available and so are towels and beach chairs free of charge. A great value, extremely kind and helpful staff, clean hotel. Locale is perfect, close to bus. We will definitely be back! The only complaint I have is that the water pressure is weak at times and the internet is spotty. Hope the latter is especially fixed. We need internet to communicate back home. Also one more thing--there's no gym despite the pix in the photo gallery:(

My family and I stayed at the Aqua Oasis for about 3 weeks back in July of this year. I never give reviews, but believe this hotel and it's stuff deserves recognition for provided us with such a wonderful stay. The location is great with many restaurants and shops in walking distance. Valets Mike and Mark are awesome handling your vehicle.The rooms are large and clean. The free continental breakfast is an added bonus. You can't beat the room prices, not in the heart of Waikiki. The staff are always friendly and helpful. They work really hard to make sure you are having a pleasant day. Thank you for treating us like family!!

O'ahu was our last stop of our journey through the Hawaian Islands.We looked for a hotel and I called in for a reservation. I called in for a reservation on that same day for the Aqua Skyline, but that was fully booked but could made a reservation for their partner hotel Aqua Oasis. Everything went smooth with the reservation and drove to the hotel. At the entrance stood a member of the hotel staff and took care about the car. Lucky that the hotel had valet parking (guess finding a parking lot in Waikiki wouldn't be easy).Miko at the Reception welcomed us in such a warm manner that we feeled very welcome at the hotel. The check-in went very smooth and quick and she explained us everything we need to know.Continental Breakfast and WiFi was included and a cold citrus water is abailable all day. The room had a good size, had everything needed and was very clean as well as the bathroom.Vis-a-vis the reception was the common area (where the breakfast is served in the morning). Here is also a deck with a few sun chairs and also a small pool. Around the reception was a laundry and a pond (with Koi) with an attached smoking area (maybe not very important but important for us).Regarding going to the beach or needing stamps (yes we are one of them who still send post cards) or with the public transport or something else, again, Miko was a very great help.All in all the whole staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful.Around the hotel are restaurants and shops. And the beach is in walking distance. But you could also get a voucher for a shuttle service from the hotel and beach towels you get also.We will definitely visit this hotel again when we are back in Honolulu.

Their breakfast was good! Especially, pineapple juice...and macadamia kona coffee. Delicious.. We could enjoy fireworks from our balcony. It is located in Waikiki, so convenient to go everywhere. The staff is very friendly. Beach towels are useful. We want to go back again soon.

Aqua Oasis is one of the most amazing hotels I have ever stayed at! I live on Kauai and gave birth 2 months early and my son had to be medi-vac to Kapiolani Hospital NICU. My husband handled all of the arrangements for us and our other 2 children while I was in the hospital and the staff at Aqua Oasis was amazing while we were there. The room was perfect, clean and comfortable. Our unit had a kitchen, king bed and pull out couch. All the amenities of home. We were there for almost 3 weeks while our son was in the hospital. The staff was absolutely amazing. Especially the valet. We were constantly going back and forth to the hospital and each time we needed our car the valet especially Mike...(Uncle Mike) was sincerely concerned on how our son was and wanted to make sure we were doing ok. It was a huge relief we didn't need to worry about our accommodations and we could concentrate on our son. All of the staff was amazing...front desk to housekeeping. We always had a clean room and fresh towels after a day at the hospital and the breakfast was perfect to grab and go each morning. I am thankful for the amazing staff and feeling of home while we went thru one of the scariest times of our life. Our son Hunter is doing amazing and we can't wait to come back as a family soon. Mahalos Aqua Oasis!! You Rock!!!!

Great location. Not far from the beach and restaurants. Awesome staff. Miko @ guest services was extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone was really nice. Quaint hotel with a homey feel. The room was spacious with a kitchen and the tv has more channels than normal. Which is great for me with kids. The laundromat was reasonable and convenient. Breakfast in the lobby was good too. I Definitely recommend this hotel.

We were stuck in Honolulu coming back from Kona, space available airline family, so we dropped into Aqua Oasis for a couple of days. Nothing fancy, cheap price, and the free breakfast was nothing great, but nice people work there. The location is great, a short walk to the beach and nightlife, so that is the best thing about the Aqua Oasis, location!! This place reminds me of staying at the cheaper hotels around Disneyland as a kid, but you never really cared because you only slept there!

Highly recommend this hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our 10 day vacation. The location was perfect. Our room was clean. We received an upgrade at check in so our room was very large with 2 very comfortable queen beds. The entire hotel has a lovely smell. There is a small pool that looked very inviting. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return next year.

Location is good, short walk to the beach. Clue to shopping and all that Waikiki has to offer. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful with answering our questions. The guy who got our car was a hoot and very pleasant. I would like to see an improvement in the air conditioning. We used the laundry facilities at the hotel. This was convenient after a day at the beach. Will stay again.

A Gem in Oahu you don't want to miss. Great staff, fantastic location, superb continental breakfast, close to everything in Waikiki, clean rooms, well worth it. Will stay again!! Great valet service, happy people

I just moved to Oahu and well I was waiting to rent a place I stayed at Aqua Oasis,It was a great experience!!! Very good customer service staff was so helpful and always smiling! room was clean and comfortable. I definitely recommend! Camila B

We always go to the Aqua Oasis. We started going in 1999 and we still go there every time we go to Oahu. It is located in the North End of Waikiki and within walking distance to the shops on the Boulevard and it is across from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and a short drive from the Ala Moana Mall. The Hospitality from the staff is just great. We also noticed that many of the employees are there year after year and they always give us a warm greeting when we pull up in our car. The smallness of the Hotel makes this place so much better than previous Hotels we stayed in. This only has 8 stories and we like to stay on the 7th floor in the Suite with the Kitchenette. It's got a good view and our room has a Lanai. They serve a nice Breakfast in the morning downstairs in the Lobby and even a paper next to the desk. If you want Aloha and a very comfortable room or suite in the Shopping District this is a great place and I highly recommend it. We have been coming for 18 years and still Love the place. Also I forgot to mention the Free Wifi that comes with the room.

The Oasis is in walking distance to lots of shops & restaurants! We were out & about everyday so the pool was perfect for the kids to take a quick dip. Felt comfortable knowing parking is secured.Best of all...the STAFF at the Oasis! All were helpful & friendly! Even though the front desk team is working in what feels like a sauna, they're all so courteous & still had a smile on their face! Bell/valet were always there to great us & were so efficient. It was nice to have a daily tidy...made our stay that much better! MAHALO Aqua Oasis!!!

The Aqua Oasis in Waikiki was a home away from home as we were transitioning from the islands to the mainland. The staff there were friendly and helpful with any issues that we had. The valets Mike and Mark are outstanding and willing to bend over backwards to make sure you, your car, and your belongings are taken care care of on a daily basis. The suite we had was nice as we are a family of six so it is hard to find a place for a family that large. It was just off the main strip in Waikiki which made it convenient to see the shopping areas and eat at the limitless restaurants but not hear all the noises associated with it. Great experience look forward to coming back in the future.

Convenient overnight stay in middle of shopping district. Room has king bed, good air conditioning and a good bathroom.Wifi is free and a continental breakfast is included.Small pool but all the basic amenities that are required for a short stay.Good choice of restaurants very close and not that far to walk to the beach.Friendly staff and would stay here again. Good value for money!

If you want good Wi-Fi, good continental breakfast, working elevators and 100% of the staff courteous, this hotel is NOT for you. Construction right next door. Constant noise of cranes and jack hamrs.

This is our second time staying at an Aqua resort, and we can say that both times have been pleasant experiences! Wish we had taken more advantage of the shuttle offered, but when it's so beautiful outside sometimes it's more fun to walk! The hotel has an outdoor lobby and each time we returned we were greeted by Mike outside, a great resource having been born and raised on the island! Our first time to Waikiki we stayed at Park Shore at the other end of the strip, so a bit of a change of scenery was nice. There is an ABC store just steps away for all of the essentials and many good food and ice cream shops nearby! Definitely try Pineapple county next door to have the best and cutest ice cream sandwich you will ever have, shaped like a pineapple! Just a short walk away you will also find Marukame udon and also Sam's kitchen, which we loved and are must go to places. Though the accommodations here were a bit more modest, the price, clean rooms, friendly staff, and convenient location more than made up for it! Mahalo Aqua Oasis!

This hotel was great. I stayed for two nights. They are centrally located in Waikiki within walking distance of some great bars, restaurants and the beach. The staff was friendly and did their job well. The lobby has lots of seating and is well decorated with beautiful foliage and a koi pond. The room was clean and well maintained. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki.

Overall good service, convenient location for Waikiki beaches and surrounding eateries, shops, etc... Front desk staffs were very friendly and helpful. I liked the little tuck away garden with kois, beautiful! Can do a little more on breakfast availability items though.

We enjoyed our stay at Aqua Oasis. Room was exactly what we were expecting. Comfortable and spacious. Staff was so very nice- from bell hop, front desk, valet and house keeping. Everyone was nice, polite, and trying to make our stay enjoyable. Highly recommend

We were booked in this hotel for 2 nights .We arrived and were told our room had a plumbing problem ,there was no other room s available & they had booked us in another hotel no apologies, just told to go ,don't know what this hotel is like apart from man at the desk being rude but where we sent was horrible, So no service no star rating. Very unhappy will letting our travel agent know

Stayed here during a recent trip to Hawaii and found it to be good value for money. The rooms, while not ultra stylish or modern are very spacious and comfortable. The hotel itself has a nice feel and is conveniently located near some of the main shopping streets. A basic breakfast was a bonus. The downside is that the street can be a little noisey at night and that staff didn't always have exactly the right advice for visiting attractions. We were visiting Maui separately so weren't too fussed about being a few blocks from the beach. The pool is also tiny and unlikely to be something you would use, but this is a nice boutique hotel that overall I would recommend.

Room was very comfortable. Handy to local shopping and beach. Swimming pool was rather small. Breakfast basic but good. When making bookings for tours at the hotel, they like to use only one tour company. Do your homework and be proactive. Disappointed with recommended tours.

Located on Lewers St, was the perfect location for everything we did. Many beaches just minutes away, even one at walking distance. The room was always clean and well-kept. I loved the kitchen and there was also free breakfast (which could use some help like scrambled eggs or bacon). The elevator was another issue, a little small so could get a little crowded especially during breakfast or check out time. But other than that, the pool was clean and kept at a good temperature, the staff was very friendly (not even one compliant about the staff!). Definitely will be visiting again since there is never enough time in Hawaii to visit all the amazing wonders this place has to offer.

visiting on honeymoon , you get what you pay for , in a king sized bedroom, dated bathroom with a hot tub faded from the 80s and a breaker unit with type typed instructions .... strange smell from the a.c , stayed in the aqua resort in kauai which was paradise :(

I love this hotel. My friends and I stay here frequently when we have special events in Waikiki. The rooms are spacious and the staff is friendly and courteous. Plus free parking a centrally located next to some great restaurants and shopping centers.

Great position easy walk to beach, shops and bus station and was very homely. The beautiful orchids and plants that adorn the front of the hotel and surrounds make for a very pretty welcome, they are so beautiful.The staff were very helpful nothing was a problem to them.The free bus to the Shopping Centre was a bonus and a great service.Continental breakfast was nice each day.We used the pink,blue ,green line buses to get around. They were very cheap and on time. If we were there for a week or more I would buy the weekly package as this enables you to travel out of the city and see more without having to go on a tour bus.They are hop on and off so you can pick what you want to see.

Beautiful varieties of orchids, fountains, and tikis greet you in the open air lobby!! Nice breakfast included a plus! One really feels the 'Hawaiian' mystique in this great little hotel!! Good value and location...

It was amazing and big and the location was perfect with shops and restaurants.the room was big and had a lot of room and its was a holiday I will not forget. This holiday has been great and I will come back to the hotel

This hotel is well located in Honolulu. The Staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size with comfy bed and good pillows. The bathroom was large but the shower was a little awkward as it was over a rather wide bath, however water pressure was good and water hot. Room in the bathroom for everything and the towels were of good quality. We had a little kitchenette with fridge, microwave, stove top etc. There was a coffee maker and also tea bags. We had a good size balcony but it only looked onto the street, but it was nice to be able to sit outside. Breakfast was good with lovely fruit, toast, buns, tea, coffee etc. The young lady maintaining the breakfast was very good at replenishing everything and very friendly and kind. The room was very quiet with the doors closed. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

I stayed for 2 weeks and a bit and practically became family with the staff with the treatment I got. Great location with shuttle services to Ala Moana throughout the day, and walking distance to bus stops and convenient stores. A great option for staying in Hawaii.

My loyalty and praise to the entire experience! The Aqua Oasis made me feel like I was at home and offered me convenience, class, and happiness! I highly recommend this property to independent travelers, business travelers and to families like mine (the honest prices kept my hard-earned money in my pocket so that I could indulge more in Hawaii!)❤️. I cannot wait to return!

I will never stay at this hotel again. The noise from the pub outside is intolerable. Up until 04:00 with loud banging of drums and yelling from the streets. This has happened for three nights now. The hotel itself is fine.

They have good staff! Very friendly and multilingual.Mr. Yaso was really nice had lots of information about the town and area. Very professional too.Rooms were moderate but loved it with free breakfast!

Aqua Oasis is the perfect mid-range option in the heart of Waikiki. The spacious, almost retro (I.e. Cool) rooms are kept spotlessly clean and include local Hawaiian decor. The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, a short walk from bars, cafes, restaurants and the main shopping street. A perfect place to stay.

Staff are happy to hold your luggage before your check in time, which is great as it allows you to walk around and sight see without carrying all your bags! Rooms were very big and clean. All with aircon and big Television. There is also free internet for each room, which is a major bonus! I loved to fact that each room had a bright colour on the outside of your door to walk into your room, it looks amazing whilst walking through your level. There was no real good view of the beach or diamond head, as many other larger hotels block the way. Waikiki beach is only a 5-10 minute walk and you are central to all the major shopping centres. This hotel is very local to many activities and major hot spots around Waikiki. Staff were very nice and always greeted you on your way in or out of the hotel. The hotel also offered a free shuttle to and from ala Moana centre with stops along the way, this is very convenient to get around Waikiki! Breakfast is very minimal with toast, boiled eggs and fruit. I hope in the future more selections such as cereal will be available. A DVD card is also available to rent movies if your after a quiet night in. Overall I would definitely recommend to stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again in the future.

We managed to get a deal online for a junior suite (at the same price as a standard room); junior suite was large, with 2 double beds, kitchen, in-room safe, living area with couch/sofa, free WiFi, beach towels, and a nice sized balcony; good water pressure in the shower; continental breakfast. Skip the pool here. I don't know what the standard rooms are like but if you can get a deal on the junior suite, it is worth it (we got room 407, which faces Lewers and overlooks the hotel entrance). Staff are not the most informed but they are pleasant. BUT, when checking out, be sure to check your invoice!!! A few people in our group were charged for daily valet (we did not have a car), someone was charged for 2 rooms (when only 1 was booked). The staff corrected it but it took a bit of time at check-out.

Location is great. The service was good. Internet is free. The breakfast was poor no cereal only toast, no sweet cakes, fruit, coffee and juice. The rooms are in need of a refurbish and we're smaller than the pictures looked. The rooms were clean. Was disappointed for the cost it was more expensive than a 2 bedroom house in Kona for 7 nights. At night the area is not desirable there was some incidents outside the hotel as there is nightclubs etc in the street (I wouldn't let my teenagers go out alone i saw some people fighting in the street below).

I stayed here in late March of this year. This seemed to be lower priced for the qualities of the rooms than I'd expect, maybe because there was construction going on, on 2 different sides of the hotel which I hardly noticed, but i guess it could take away some from your view if that's important to you.So the room seemed very nice and the a.c. was capable of getting the room very cold if you wanted that. They had a non stocked mini fridge, but there are near by stores that have all kinds of snacks and drinks including alcohol. Those stores also have things like beach ware and sunscreen. The room had and ironing board, iron, hair dryer and safe. I found the internet wasn't trouble free but worked well enough to get done what I needed to get done.They have a small swimming pool on the ground floor and a small koi pond, which was nice to sit by and have a drink. They have a restaurant and a continental breakfast which was fairly simple with bread, rolls, toaster, boiled eggs, juice.This is a good area for night life with plenty of restaurants that had bands and the main drag is near by with so many shops, more restaurants and plenty of things to entertain you when you go for a stroll at night with street artists such as ones who will do your portrait or break dancers or one man bands.It's not that convenient to the beach, but if you don't mind a bit of a walk, it's doable. It cost me $15 to get here by shuttle from the airport and I took the same thing back which picked me up right at the front door. I also went fishing as part of a tour that picked me up about a block away. They have a person there during business hours to help arrange any tours you might want to go on and the woman I dealt with was very pleasant and helpful. I took the shuttle out to Pearl Harbor which cost $15 and I called for a return trip with the same service. It's part of a regular root they run. So it was a very pleasant stay in a good location for night life and shops galore.

I came to Honolulu for a conference and booked the Aqua Oasis for my last three nights of stay because the hotel I decided for in the first days was overbooked. Unfortunately I had to shorten my stay in the last couple of days and return home earlier than expected. I therefore contacted the Aqua Oasis via email asking them to reduce the cancellation fee of 135 USD. I waited 36 hours without a response. When I called the hotel, staff told me they had to speak with their manager about the fee reduction and would contact me afterwards. I never heard of the hotel again and had to pay for the whole cancellation fee. From a customer oriented service I would at least expect a friendly reply even in the case of a refusal to reduce the fee.With this behavior of the hotel staff I feel fooled as a customer and I will definitely not book again for my next trip to Honolulu.

We stayed here for four nights after a trans-Pacific cruise. We arrived hours before check-in but the staff were happy to care for our luggage whilst we strolled around Waikiki to see the sights and allowed us to check in a few hours early when we returned. The room was clean and tidy but had an odd smell, which we soon figured out was the air conditioner. (I'd guess it needs a full service.). The AC works fine but there is a pervading slightly mouldy smell when you have it running, so we turned it off and the room was fine (may be this room only). Everything was supplied (shampoo, soap, towels etc..) and the bed was comfortable yet firm. There is a mini fridge to keep your drinks etc in and there are ABC Stores everywhere where you can purchase pretty much anything. One block away from the Waikiki Trolley depot (we got a two day pass -fantastic value) and rode it solidly for two days. Pool is very small, breakfast is minimalist (fruit, boiled eggs and toast) and was a disappointment. Free DVD rental, free use of Beach Towels too. good sized rooms, balcony but a little noisy at night, so keep your door closed. Large TV and good water pressure! Would stay here again. Ps Free Wifi!

My wife and daughter and I have been to this Island at least 15 times now and always try and stay a few days in Waikiki. We've stayed in virtually every hotel here. And this is hands-down the best staff, the best bellhop, the quickest valet, and the best customer service/check-in and checkout experience that we've had here. It's perfectly located right next to our favorite Thai restaurant and our favorite ice cream shops. It's a short walk to the beach and even has a pool and sauna. The best thing here though, is the toilets! They have a butt-washing, toilet with a heated seat called a washlet. I have to buy one! When you stay here, try and stay in room 700. It is a sweet suite! Tell them Christafari sent you!

We stayed here for 7 nights on our way back to the UK in March. I loved this hotel. It's a lovely friendly hotel and the service/ staff are great. We were upgraded to the PH suite and while the decor is a bit dated, the room was huge and spotlessly clean and the bed super comfortable.The room was also surprisingly quiet. The location is good for shops, restaurants and the beach. This hotel is great value,and the staff are super helpful. I would stay here again

We had a one bedroom with kitchen type room for a party of 4. Pluses:The room was a decent size and had a roomy bathroom. The air conditioner worked well and we had plenty of hot water. The service was good.Mixed:They offered a continental breakfast of hard boiled eggs, toast, donut holes, oranges and pineapple. Not bad, but not great.Negatives:Our floor was very high in the hotel. Every night until about 3:30AM we heard a dull booming of music through our closed windows. I would guess that it came from a ground floor bar outside the hotel. Parking was not pleasant. It was a bit unclear how to use valet parking and I generally don't like valet parking. We parked behind the hotel for $30/day in a gravel lot unattended by employees. There was, however, someone that appeared to be living in the parking lot (every day) including giving himself sponge bathsJust Odd:Our hallway was quite dim.

In Lewers Street, we had a junior suite that face out to the street and the noise is loud until the wee hours of the morning. An empty and rubbish strewn building site is directly opposite and don't make for great viewing if that's what you are looking for. Our stay was 18 nights and the staff at reception are variable, some helpful and others seem to treat you like the process we are as tourists, one group in another group out.Rooms are ok and have that typical smell of an aircon unit that has residual damp and mould, perhaps just my view but on entering the rooms, they have a distinct odour.The guys on the concierge desk are friendly but I guess a daily tip to deliver the car might have helped there. They were friendly all the same and I could see them assisting other guests willingly.

Hotel is a great place to stay. Location is close to everything such as shopping, restaurants, and the beach. Staff is friendly and accommodating as well. The hotel itself is a bit dated but rooms are clean and comfortable. The side street has a couple homeless people but they don't really bother anyone. I'd stay there again and would also recommend it to anyone.

If you like to be treated as a treasured friend then this is the place to stay when in Honolulu. From the moment our family arrived we were made to feel welcome and all the staff were kind, attentive and constantly provided outstanding service to ensure we had a happy and relaxed holiday. Our room was beautiful - very spacious and comfortable and we felt very pampered returning there every night. At Aqua even those of us who enjoy a cigarette were treated with respect -VERY rare these days. There is a lovely garden and pond area provided for smokers and I spent a lot of happy hours chatting to other travellers there. So nice not to have to go out on the street by myself. We are already planning our next trip to Hawaii and we shall return to this hotel - why would we consider anywhere else. So very happy with all aspects of our stay at the Aqua Oasis.

Very comfortable small hotel centrally located in Waikiki and shopping. Aqua Oasis is located on Lewers between Kuhio and Kalakaua Avenues. Just a short walk to Waikiki beaches and shopping in either direction. The rooms are comfortable with a lanai and a coffee maker to enjoy Kona coffee upon waking up. There is a continental breakfast buffet which is served every morning at 700AM. The staff are all very friendly and accomodating to their guests. My return next year will be to this gem located in the heart of Waikiki!

This place was a good value and just off of the Main Street in Honolulu to be walkable to everything in Waikiki but also a little off the beaten path so you could get away from the crowds. It reminds me of a European hotel which is pleasant but a little run down. Don't expect a view from f anything other than a dingy street or parking lot but you shouldn't be in your room that much anyway- you're in Hawaii after all! There is free continental breakfast, a tiny pool and a laundry room. The service is a bit relaxed so reduce your service expectations. We had a junior suite which had 2 queen beds, sofa, and kitchen with large bathroom. Great value for the money.

Room was nothing as described, very bad odour from air conditioner but if you open the door for fresh air to sleep you get bombarded by the noise from downstairs nightclub/pub music and loud yelling. I had to buy air freshener which really didn't do much as the odour was so strong. Avoid the 3rd floor if you must stay there. Television has distorted picture and when I complained was told "well that's just how cable is".Not a pleasant stay, don't let the pictures online fool you. Arrived at noon after a long flight and no sleep for 24 hours. Come back later, no help with bags. Overall no service what so ever.

On first appearance I am surprised this has such good ratings, even after a renovation it looks very tired and old fashioned. We were first put into a room with seperate beds, not what we booked and clearly not right for a couple. So we were eventually changed to a kind bed room, no view.On the second night I found a cockroach (about 1/2 an inch) crawling on the carpet - needless to say I didn't get much sleep after that.The room itself was very spacious, I think they put us in a disabled room. Lots of marks all of the walls and just the level of cleanliness was poor. There was no shelving at all in the bathroom or shower to put products, which was a pain. The air conditioning is the loudest I've ever heard, and the area is right above local bars and clubs so very noisy. The complimentary breakfast was terrible, some dry doughnuts, bread and crap coffee - absolutely no options for gluten free or even cereal. Even with the toast there was only very sugary jams to put on, they really need a bigger selection of condiments. The fruit was average - some pineapple and orange.On a positive note, the location is great - easy access to shops and restaurants nearby. We really enjoyed the new Thai restaurant downstairs, we came back to go there again with family. The shuttle bus was handy, but didn't make up for the room.After a few nights we moved to the Hilton to enjoy some luxury and better surroundings. Incredible difference!I would recommend paying more money to get a luxury hotel if you are thinking of coming to Hawaii.

This hotel is in a brilliant situation. Very hand to shops and beach. Rooms very bright and clean. Breakfast was basic, but good, varied from day to day. Loved the indoor/outdoor flow.. Definately recommend this hotel.

This hotel is a truly a great find/value in the Waikiki area: the rooms are spacious & clean, the property is airy & well maintained, the staff is friendly & helpful, and the price is much less than many nearby hotels. Just a couple blocks from the beach, Aqua Oasis is convenient to everything! We had a great stay.

A treasure of a find in the heart of town. We finished our 10 day stay in Hawaii with two nights at Oasis and could not believe the value compared to other accomodation in Waikiki. Spacious rooms, comfy bed, balcony, valet parking (US$30 extra), small boutique place to stay with friendly staff.

Very clean, beautiful court yard, continental breakfast nicely furnished. We had just what we needed since our destination was to see Honolulu and not to lounge in the hotel. Excellent location walking distance to all the upscale shops, fancy restaurants, gorgeous Waikiki beach, you name it. It was perfect for us. Nothing fancy. Just a clean, nice, good service hotel.

Loved our stay... our room was clean, bed was comfortable, tub was roomy and shower was strong and hot! Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.. lobby was open air with a great breakfast included. Short walk to the beach. Was there over St Patrick's day and it was quiet in the room. Other hotels in this price range were completely outclassed by Aqua Oasis!

Room was dark, very noisy at night time as there is a club next door. The rooms athough spacious are only ever half serviced. Breakfast is right at bottom of were everyone walks past in the morning, so we didn't even bother using it. Just went out, even though it was included

We enjoyed our room at Aqua Oasis. I loved seeing the night lights of Waikiki from the balcony at night. It was a great location for all we needed to walk to, a pre-wedding dinner at Hula Grill, the wedding at Hale Koa, catching an Whole Island Nature tour and "The Bus" to travel to Pearl Harbor. We enjoyed walking early in the morning around the neighborhood and felt very safe. We were confused with the total bill, but the desk clerk was very understanding and helpful.

This hotel is a 10-15 min walk from Waikiki Beach. It has valet parking only. The rooms are huge and include a living and kitchen area. The bathrooms have a huge soaking tub and heated toilet seats! If staying for extended period might want to get closer and have direct access to the beach. It is nicely located close to the shopping district. Very small hot tub size pool onsite. Rooms were clean and bed was comfortable.

Stayed 2 nights here in March 2017. Lobby area is nice, with lots of shaded seating, a small koi pond and a postage-stamp sized pool. Cold water available in the lobby. King-size bed was comfortable, but air conditioner was very loud. Porch was lovely but there was so much ongoing construction in the area that it was hard to really enjoy it. Continental breakfast was OK but definitely not for the hungry - just Bagels, sliced bread, butter/jelly, sliced pineapple and oranges, plus hard boiled eggs, pineapple juice (very tasty) and coffee. Wifi went in and out a few times during the day while I was trying to get work done, but they sent someone up to fix it immediately. All in all a good find at a decent price in the middle of a very touristy, pricey part of Honolulu.

I love this hotel! They serve a great breakfast and they have the best coffee!! I checked out and they held my bag while I was sightseeing waiting for my flight. Once I returned they offered me a shower and a beautiful restroom to freshen up before my flight! Close to the beach and shopping!

Great place to stay in Waikiki for locals and visitors. Hotel is located near beginning of Waikiki Kalakaua Avenue, so you need not travel too far into the busiest part of this tourist location. Only valet parking available . Room (1 bedroom suite) with a king size bed and a sofa bed. Perfect for 3-4 people: very spacious with a small kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator, 2 burner stove, toaster, coffee maker, rice cooker, sink, basic cooking and serving utensils, pots, pans, and dishware. Bathroom is huge with deep tub and tiled floors: however, no shower curtains or opaque sliding doors. Water pressure is low. Lots of closet space; small chest of drawers. Continental breakfast served each morning from 7-9 o'clock. Fresh sliced pineapples and oranges, assorted pastries, boiled eggs, white and brown bread, orange juice, and coffee. Pool is small. Pool towels are available. Outside leisure area has tropical décor, three fun, hanging seats, assorted lounge chairs and tables. Nice pond with turtles and koi fishes.Designated smoking area with benches and ash receptacles. Laundry area is outdoor with 2 washing machines and 2 dryers.Because we stayed for 2 weeks, we received free valet parking and a DVD/Game rental card.Staff is helpful, friendly, welcoming and efficient. Thank you Darolyn, Miko, Mike, Mark, Clifton and Steven for a great stay.

This was the third night of an unplanned stay in Honolulu after my husband's "outpatient" surgery (and the most enjoyable). I made the reservation at 3 pm with a very friendly clerk. The hotel while somewhat aged has an open floor plan which was delightful. The hallways are also open. (Hopefully they had a night "watchman.") They have a small pool and sun deck which are inviting. There is a lovely koi pond garden; unfortunately it is also the smoking area but I got to enjoy it for a while. The clean room was decorated in attractive Hawaiian modern. The bed was very comfortable and the towels good. A simple breakfast of hard boiled egg, donuts, muffins, toast, juice, oranges and pineapple was included. Staff was accommodating. The hotel is located just off the main shopping district. I will have to check to see how far it is from the beach, but this is now my favorite note in Waikiki!

Before my stay here I stayed in a nightmare Airbnb so it was really great to come to Aqua Oasis to a clean room, comfortable bed and lovely staff. The pool here is a little small but that's okay, we went out to the beaches during the day anyways. They have free DVD hire which is nice. Most places in Waikiki are within walking distance. I really enjoyed my stay here :)

We came to Honolulu for a short 2.5 day stay, after a week on the Big Island and 4.5 days on Maui. We came here because we wanted to experience Pearl Harbor, as it is our first time in Hawaii. We booked this hotel thru a travel agent, based on reviews on Trivago. We wanted a nice room at a decent price, close to Waikiki beach,which it is couple of blocks from. The rooms are smaller, but adequate, nice bath and great bed. It came at a fair price for the area it is in. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, we needed to copy and fax forms, they handled it for us at no additional cost, in an area where it seems everything has a price. We would certainly stay here again in the future.I also would recommend Trip Adviser when you travel. They can definitely take the guess work out of where you stay, eat or play!!!Ken & Kathy O'Connell Branson MO

Love this hotell. staff are great and friendly will accommodate you. I have stayed more than once and I like the location and price. Rooms are very roomy. The free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre is very handy

My friend referred me to this hotel and I am glad I listened to her. Best decision ever ! First of all, they provide discount on the website to save you money. Second of all, the location is PERFECT if you want convenience. It is literally 8 mins away walking distance to waikiki beach, 30 secs to two local bars, and literally mins away from all the local shops and eats. The staffs all were welcoming and friendly. Valet guys were awesome. The rooms were super clean and stained free. I had no problems. Oh and they also give you complentary gifts when you check in the hotel. I am definitely coming back to this hotel. Pricing and hotel is a steal.

room 810: Hotel needs new ownership and management.Room is large with two double bedsCarpet in good conditionCute bugs crawling on night standOld clock has outdated phone attachmentBathroom vanity wood split with Verneer is peeling off, discolored, no attempt to paint or repairLarge Bathroom has cute insects crawling on vanityNice large balcony, but screen missingAir conditioner works, but fan blade vibrates out of balance, noisy, and headboard vibrates as result.Phone line was unusable and could not talk with deskWifi is free, buy the assigned LAN wireless id was not working, so could not setup. Front desk then said to connect to any id that was strong. Parking is via valet costs $40. Car is parked out back in public pay lot.would rate this 2/5.

Always had a dream to stay here! Although it was only one night, really enjoyed this perfect hotel choice. The bed was so comfortable too, got a great night's sleep. Easy access to great restaurants and bars too.

Our visit was really good. Staff of the hotel is exceptional! The hotel is in the main shopping area and only 2-5 min away from the beach. Breakfast included lemon water, local coffee, fruits, toasts, donuts, bagels. Breakfast was enough to start the day. Also, they help choose and book various tours. Don't rent car, parking is expensive everywhere. You can easily use public transportation. Trolly tours are just across the street. We really enjoyed our stay.

This place was infested with tiny cockroaches, when I bought it to the attention of the housekeeping I was handed a tin of insect repellant. We stayed for 7 nights during that time there were toenails on our balcony right up to the day we left. We asked for extra bath towels and were told sorry we have run out. While the location maybe good do not sacrifice cleanliness. The accomodation ruined my holiday.

Such a cute and cozy hotel. Would definitely come and stay here again. Stayed in the junior suite w/ kitchen room facing Lewer's street. The location was excellent and walking distance to all the major shops and restaurants in waikiki. Had the rental car package which was very nice and valet was always easy since Lewer's street is a one-way. You just park on the curb and give your keys to the staff.The room was clean and the bathroom very spacious.  The staff of the hotel were always sweet and very accommodating! :)

Great Value- Quiet older Hotel in the Heart of Waikiki. Nicely updated and maintained. Easy walking to beach, restaurants, bars and shopping. Balconies to view fireworks on Fridays. Healthy complimentary breakfast bar on the charming patio with plants and water features. Free DVD Rental Box was fun. Very small pool, not an issue for our family we were at the beach. Very convenient valet parking was a big bonus.

My travel website lead me to this hotel and I couldn't be happier. I surprised my mother with a trip to Hawaii for Christmas/ her 75th birthday and the staff bent over backwards to make this the trip of a lifetime for her. Our upgrade got us a room on the top floor penthouse and mom literally danced every time she pushed that elevator button. Special thanks to Yae, Yasu and Mike for being very friendly and answering all our questions. The rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and reasonably priced. Continental breakfast was included as were new release DVD rentals. The location was close enough to walk to the beach, food and shopping.

We had a great experience at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and the staff extremely friendly. The hotel is located in a convenient location that's next to shops and restaurants and just a few minutes walk away from the beach. Yasu did a wonderful job in making sure that our stay was a comfortable one.

I'm a regular traveller to Hawaii but this is the first time i'm stayed here. Although the hotel needs a bit of an update mainly the halls are dark but what appearance lack, the staff make up for it. All the staff we dealt with were really nice and nothing was an issue for them.

My first impression of this hotel was that it is a little tired. But once we were settled into our room I found a very comfortable, clean and pleasant space. We have a room with a kitchenette, a king bed, a spacious bathroom and squeaky clean. The location is great, just a couple of blocks to the beach and surrounded by restaurants. Last but not least every single person we have come in contact with has been very friendly and accommodating.

I had originally booked a different location for our family vacation and we stayed there one night and were displeased and Aqua Oasis had availability for us to switch to their location and we were delighted with everything about it

We stayed at the Aqua Oasis before leaving for a cruise. The quick synopsis, loved the place and would certainly stay again if in Hawaii.We stayed in a junior suite… The room was spacious enough for five of us. The room had two double beds and a sofabed. As well there was a kitchenette and the washroom had a washlet. The breakfast was basic but plentiful. The hard-boiled eggs, bread and pastries were great. I really was happy with this.The issues were small… Construction noise (never seems to stop but the room was reasonably quiet). The streetlight was directly across from the window and could not be covered with the curtains without some stretching.  Finally the electrical outlet plates were not aligned with the outlets. I used these for a multi USB ports and if you weren't careful this would fall out.The cost of the room, the very pleasant ambience and unbelievable location more than made up for this.Lots of great restaurants nearby and the rooms themselves were superb. Worthwhile to stay.

My sister and I stayed in Aqua Oasis over the Christmas period and what a delightful little gem. Its perfect if your looking for quiet place away from hustle & bustle. Thank you to the friendly staff who made our stay seamless ...

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here for good reason, location, rooms and cost. The location is excellent, the rooms are large (unusual for hotels in Waikiki) and it is moderately priced (again, for Waikiki). There is not much I can add to my previous review, only this time we were not upgraded to a Suite (more on that later). We had a Junior suite which is a little bigger than the base rooms but still large only costing a few extra $$ per night. Worth it if you want to spread out a little. Staff were friendly, helpful and the the rooms clean. The aircon in our room was quite noisy, so we had to have it blasting during the day and switch it off at night which worked fine.We booked via the website for a king bed, however on check in they only had two doubles. The lady at the check in said that there was the suite available but it would cost more to have that room. This annoyed me a little as we had booked via the hotel website a king bed and the only one available was the suite. It was vacant and I was a little surprised that it wasn;t offered as a free upgrade. If I had booked through a 3rd party site, no probs, but they encourage you to book through their website, but don;t look after you if an error or something you booked was not available. It has happened in the past (upgrade) and leaves a positive feel about the place. There is a lot of construction and renovating happening in Waikiki, so there will be newer and fresher hotels to choose from in the future which will put pressure on other more dated hotels to go that little bit further for customers.The above 'issue' is a 1st world problem, but in the highly competitive Waikiki market, little things like this help. It DID NOT detract from the stay, it is still an excellent hotel and when we return to Waikiki, this will be at the top of the list....again....If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good spot in Waikiki that offers large rooms, then have a look at this one.

Stayed here for our family holiday. We were served by Clifton and Yasu who was very helpful, got upgraded to a larger room for free. The hotel also had turtles and koi fishes which the kids love. Nice simple breakfast, good for the kids. Kids love the boiled eggs. Will definitely book again and recommend to others visiting Hawaii.

My daughter and I spent Christmas in Honolulu and stayed at the Aqua Oasis. After reading the reviews I decided to book with them. The hotel did not disappoint. The room was clean and big, hotel staff was friendly and professional. Will definitely go back.

I've been going to Hawaii regularly since 1989 & have always stayed on Lewers st, however this time October 2016 our usual hotel had been renovated & the price of the rooms had skyrocketed, so we booked here, and what a nice surprise when we arrived, staff were very friendly & helpful, the hotel is very clean & well maintained & the housekeeping staff are fantastic, very helpful, I will definitely be staying here on my next trip to Hawaii.

I have stayed ant many places in Waikiki, Oahu, and they are always too expensive, and don't care much about you. The Aqua Oasis is the exception. This hotel is centered in a good location in Downtown Waikiki. very close to beach and shops. It is not deep in traffic, or located on a main street, in which you cant even find the parking garage. It is off of Lewers street, which is not busy , so you can drive slow and actually get out of your car and not get ran over trying to get into hotel. Even though the hotel is small, it has the makings to be comfortable and relaxing. There is always fresh fruit at the desk, and free coffee and continental breakfast in the mornings. In the hotel is a fish and turtle pond, with a little garden for relaxing. There is also a little sauna, swing chairs and pool for relaxing. In the room, is a nice selection of furniture that makes you feel like you are on an island, and also on business. There is also a Free(Redbox looking) DVD/PS3 game rental station. This perc allows you to rent for free one movie or game at a time 24/7. Current releases and older stuff. Room has coffee, safe, fridge, hairdryer, closet, stool, sitting chair, bed, desk, Ipod input radio alarm clock, flat screen TV and a playstation 3. Internet is WIFI, and password is good for your whole stay vs each night like the big chain hotels. Bathroom has a huge soaking tube, and papaya scented shampoo, conditioner, bath wash, hand soap and lotion. Valet parking is 30 a day, and they know your name and bring the car down for you. Never a wait, and always at your pace. Overall, it is a 3 star hotel that feels like a high 4 that is quiet, and has everything you need. I prefer this kind of place rather then the big time chains, because I am comfortable and not stressed. Price point was under per diem by about 30 bucks a night, so it was a great deal.

My husband and I have stayed at the Aqua Oasis many times and it almost seems like each stay gets better and better. They even sent us champagne and chocolate to celebrate our engagement in May of this year. We usually book the Junior Suite, but on our most recent stay we got an upgrade to the Junior Suite with Kitchen, which was quite a welcome surprise. And we also got a welcome basket with snacks and water. Vae was who we saw the most during our stay and he is very polite, friendly, and customer-service oriented. The rooms are very big and comfortable. The property is very beautiful and secluded, which is rare for being right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The best part would definitely have to be the big soak tub. Thank you so much Aqua Oasis; can't wait to stay there again!

I stayed there for two nights. Ordered a Junior suite but was upgraded in a one-bedroom suite, thank you guys again!The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom had a bath which was very appreciable. There's a pool which is not guarded and the staff can lend you towels.The breakfast was light but I enjoyed local fruits, not every hotel offers the which is a shame from my point of view given that they grow on the island...You can enjoy the free luggage storage and shuttles to the airport or the mall nearby.I had a room on the 7th floor and I heard no noise up there. There's a very well-known bar right next to the hotel but it didn't bothered me at all.Thank you guys again for the great time I had there.

Lovely hotel, friendly staff. Close to shops, eateries and within walking distance to the beach. Was a great hotel for a first timer to Hawaii. Loved the idea of the continental breakfast. The rooms clean and spacious.

Very well set up for a relaxing stay in the heart of Waikiki. While the room appointments were not especially fancy, they were clean and very functional. I particularly appreciated outdoor access to the room, provision of beach towels, and even complimentary DVD rentals.

Pretty decent hotel, rooms look and are alot better than what the street view looks like.First glance is where are we staying at?But it was nice, clean and the staff was very helpful, friendly and professional.Busy one way street but easy to get to and easy to get out.Only bad thing was trash trucks at 4-5am everyday across the street at the back side of shopping center. So if your room faces east (I believe) you could hear it if a light sleeper.

This is a great hotel to stay if you want to be close to good food and excellent nightlife. The rooms are always very clean and the staff is always helpful and courteous. The Room we stayed in had two large beds with a living room area and a kitchen. The Lani has lots of room to hang out as well. Bathrooms are newly renovated and in excellent condition.
user_name:
Steve M
Kaneohe, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We recently stayed here, it's very central to Waikiki, beach access is a block away, plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff were very nice and helpful, our room was very spacious and comfortable. The daily breakfast was very light, we were expecting more. Overall we had a lovely week

love this place , not on the beach but just a short walk and there. Love the location right on top of moose mcgillycuddy's pub restaurant, walking distance to yard house restaurant over 100 beers on tap plus a lot more. stayed in both rooms , one with kitchen and without they were both very nice kept. For the value and location I definitely will go back. They have breakfast in the am nothing fancy so if ya want waffles potatoes beacon and stuff forget it . they basically have around 2-3 different flavors of coffee doughnut holes chocolate and regular glazed, boiled eggs, nice fresh white and wheat breads with yes real butter plus jams jellies cereal and good pineapple juice can't think of what else. ac is really nice works great the kitchen room has a bidet toilet love it . No oven in kitchen just 2 stoves has dishes and stuff didn't check im sure pots and pans. They charge the resort fee when you check in or if you prepay, other places spring it on you when you check out hate that. They have a pool and dry sauna but no hot tub. also stayed at the aston Waikiki circle and if you want to walk out the front door and be on the beach stay there and pay a lot more for a lot less in a small room that was nice place but rather stay in oasis. nice clean comfortable beds n bedding. The staff are really friendly to. if you want to spend a loot of $ stay right on the ocean and pay out the nose, if you want a really nice place that is quiet and right in the middle of everything within walking distance go to oasis. aka stayed at aqua Waikiki wave before ohana Waikiki east this is my favorite. there is parking $30 night it's valet they park your car or pickup.. . stayed 3 nights.. the lani is nice and big with chairs and table.

We had a fantastic stay at the Aqua Oasis. Staff were incredibly friendly ! Lovey service ! Great continental breakfast ! We will definitely recommend and when we come back to Hawaii, we will be staying here! Mahalo !

The staff was very friendly and helpful, and greeted us with a selection of local treats! Rooms were clean and comfortable, equipt with a mini fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. Breakfast was light, but great- a selection of toasts and Pastry, hard boiled eggs, tea and delicious Hawaian coffee. It is close to the beach, and lots of shopping options.

Stayed in room 600. Upgraded to this room free of charge. We are a Kamaina family. This is our go to hotel. Staff is AWESOME! Kitchenette is wonderful, everything you need is there.Free DVD &games. Location is everything, we could walk to what ever we needed-Longs,Ross, and the parade! Pool is small but price is worth it and beach is close. Front desk will get you beach chairs & towels.Kids love looking at the turtles & koi in pond.Adults love free breakfast,newspaper & shuttle to Alamoana. Great place to stay & be right in Waikiki!

We loved this small & friendly hotel that served as our base for spending 4 nights at the start of our first-ever trip to Hawaii. A great first impression when bell staff met our taxi on arrival and took luggage up to our room. Attentive service continued throughout our stay, including the front desk and breakfast attendants. Our room on an upper floor was clean, comfortable and quiet. We appreciated that continental breakfast was included in their open-air courtyard each morning to get us started on our day with fresh pineapple and other fruit, juice, bakery, Kona coffee and even hardboiled eggs. The location was convenient to restaurants and shops but off the busier streets. Easy walking distance through bustling Waikiki to Kuhio Beach, where we enjoyed the sunset and free hula show on the day we arrived. They also have a concierge service available for planning activities, but we had scheduled ours in advance and it was just a short walk to the Ross Store where we met our tours for Pearl Harbor and the Polynesian Cultural Center.We would definitely stay here again if we travel to Honolulu in the future.

This is the third time in 3 years that we have stayed at this hotel. There's a lot going in favor of choosing Aqua Oasis. Super location on Lewers St., a half block from Kalakaua Ave, the main strip of Waikiki. So easy to get to the beach, shop, or hit a great variety of eateries. (Also don't forget the karaoke private rooms in the bar just opposite the lobby). The price is remarkable, compared to the insane prices of the bigger hotel chains. Also loved the service, Yasu at the front desk, and the porters Mike and Mark were always friendly and ready to help. Not a fancy place, but clean, large patio, large bathroom and kitchen (we got the 1-bedroom suite). But we toured the "junior executive suite" and noticed it was also roomy. This is not a large and bustling resort; more of a quiet and relaxed style, but it is very close to the rush and fun of Waikiki. Concierge Sara Beth is totally friendly and full of suggestions for fun. We plan to go back.

Wednesday 16 November 2016The lobby is an outdoor area allowing you to continue to enjoy the Hawaiian sun and air. A complimentary basket is given to every patron. The pool with mechanical access for the less able are easily seen from the reception area. Solo Hanging Chairs for lounging are also near the pool. Stairs or the elevator give you access to your room.The room and bathroom are quiet spacious. The grand bed is comfy and holds five pillows. Lights adorn the frame of the bed, and bonus -- Dimmer Switches. The flat screen tv has various American channels like TBS. "2 Broke Girls" anyone? Hidden next to tv is a mini fridge. A small circular table with two wooden chairs for lounging rest between the bed and the tv.The bathroom is a great size. The shower/tub combo has amazing pressure. Two bath towels, two face towels and two washcloths are at the ready. Toiletries are Paya products: 1 shampoo, 1 conditioner, 1 shower gel, 1 body lotion, 1 facial bar soap & 1 body bar soap.The breakfast leaves must to be desired, but it's complimentary.Many high-end shops and eateries are within walking distance.Enjoy the surf and sand, just a two-minutes walk away, with Aqua Oasis.

We checked in to the Aqua Oasis late Thursday evening for 3 nights out early Sunday morning. At first glance the location was unassuming and at night it can be a little alarming. Do not let that fool you. The interior furnishing has been updated and looks great. We checked in easily and headed straight to our room. Because of the location (halfway down Lewers street) there are no oceanview rooms but that didn't bother us at all. The room we received was a Jr Suite with two double beds, a nice big clean bathroom, couch and a full kitchen. It was great! We were able to get settled in quickly and found some great eateries nearby. Loved the location and convenience of having restaurants and convenience stores all around us. There is no parking lot so it is mandatory to valet park but it was very convenient. Not a busy property so Valet runs and gets your car quickly. Staff is friendly and we truly enjoyed our stay. Will be back again for sure!

We are quite familiar with Oahu, since we used to live here. Back for business and fun, we were looking for a place that is reasonably priced and near the beach. Aqua Oasis fits the bill. The rooms are clean and attractive and the staff is very friendly and helpful, including the valet, who gets the car immediately. The price is just as reasonable as some of the mainland hotels we've visited this past year. Free breakfast (continental) and free use of beach chairs and beach towels saved us a bunch! My only negative is the fact that our room is tiny, and since we have an 11 day stay, it's hard to organize and it is not comfortable to sit and read or watch tv. However, the open courtyard is a great place to sit and read or use the pool. BTW, there is free shuttle service and the washer and dryer are on the premises. Very well-run hotel with super helpful staff.

Rooms need some renovation but it was clean. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Mike, the valet was so friendly and such a hard worker! In the heart of Waikiki! Thank you for making our vacation such a pleasant experience!

The rooms are big and clean. The staff is nice. The hotel is located in a great spot. If your goal is to save money and stay in a decent place, stay here. Not new. Not a resort. Good deals are available. Near the beach - and they'll provide a good beach towel. Good TV and wifi. Large bathroom.Don't expect to hang at the pool, which is small and odd. Breakfast is brief and not much. Toast. Some fruit. Hard boiled eggs. Juice. Coffee. A bagel and a donut hole if you are lucky. Some air conditioner noise.

The Aqua Oasis was friendly from the moment we step out of our transport from the AP. The Oasis is small by comparison to other Resorts in Hawaii but very clean and has all amenities that the bigger resorts have except the pool is small. The complex is totally disable friendly, including the pool. Our room was spacious, bed, pillows small kitchenette and bathroom very clean and comfortable. Even had decent size towels:) The Oasis is central to most of Waikiki. The Resort Fee of US$18 per day was nothing as you receive breakfast daily, DVD hire, transport to and from Ala Moana Shopping Center including drop off near Walmart and Ross Dress for Less, to name a few of the benefits of this Complex. We had a room to the back of the Oasis and we were lucky as we even saw the Hilton's Fireworks from our balcony. We would recommend this facility over the Princess Kalani where we stayed in March 2016.

The best part of the hotel is its location. Right in the middle of the shopping craziness and close to the beach.Staying in Waikiki is expensive and though this hotel can do better when it comes to facilities and rooms, it is okay for the price.The breakfast can improve... options are too limited.

Very reasonable deal for a great location and newly renovated room with modern design and very clean. Staff is very friendly and with this reasonable price includes simple breakfast. Shuttle service between airport is also available at $16. I choose this hotel every time when I go Waikiki. If parking was free for the guest would be really helpful as it's so hard to find a parking spot in Waikiki.

Hotel Manager Evelyn is so filled with Aloha to meet our every need to have made our stay most enjoyable and relaxing. Her staff is very courteous and friendly and treated us like Ohana.Our room was very comfortable with a large bathroom.

This is our second year staying at Aqua Oasis. We love the location, the comfort of the room and helpful staff. They have a free continental breakfast to start the day, travel concierge for car rental, tour booking and general vacation advice and suggestions. The garden with fish pond is a beautiful place to hang out and the pool is ideal for the kids to splash around in as the parents plan the day. We will be back next year for sure!

I stayed at the Aqua Oasis previously known as the Joy Hotel. The staff was amazing really showed me the aloha spirit. The hotel was on the smaller scale but the rooms were real nice and the location was superb. Bottomline what the hotel lacked in size was made up by the awesome staff and aloha spirit. Especially, the staff at the front desk really went the extra mile to make us all laugh and enjoy the environment. I would recommend this hotel to travelers looking for that nice hideaway yet perfect location.

You guys did an amazing job. We booked a 2 twin bed suite and upon having it unavailable we were bumped up to the penthouse suite. Very happy with the service and customer care. Will be back in future.

no issues all ok average hotel stay. you are in an average hotel, average service, not 1st class, no microwave sucks, floor staff very nice, front desk average 1 woman at front desk RUDE. the guys front desk and parking guys were 5 star! No, not of alternative life style the men were just really good! there is a manager female she was awesome, married to one of the bell/park/at front entrance. they both should get an award....surprised they are not at a high end HI resort!

Just off the main strip, the Aqua Oasis is within walking distance of everything in Waikiki, including the beach. The staff were very friendly with great recommendations for things to see and do. The price was reasonable too.

Very comfortable and well located to walk and get the feel of the place. Staff very pleasant and room very comfortable and clean. Construction of new apartments nearby but did not worry us just spoilt the view a little. Would happily recommend for a short stay. Pool only small but beach not far away.

The room is large with lots of amenities. Just a couple of blocks off the beach...away from all the commotion of Kalakaua Avenue. Yasu at the Front Desk is especially kind and helpful. He even ran our Boarding Passes for us when we checked out!

This hotel has all the things you need to come back to after a long day in the Hawaiian sun. The staff was very accommodating, friendly, and knowledgeable! Very nice rooms, and at a great value. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a smaller place to save a few bucks!

Would absolutely stay here again it was very clean and well thought out areas. Swinging seats to relax in.common area. Light breakfast to start the day, ice cold water on tap in lobby. Secluded smoking area with lighting all night and a large fish pond. Thanks for not making us go out into the street. Staff very friendly and helpful. Tea & coffee facilities also microwave & refrigerator in room. Concierge desk was open 24 hours with security at night. Was in a great position and trolley service was not included in our stay, with trollies stopping regularly and help for this service was available at the desk. Thank you to the management and staff at Aqua Oasis for making our stay so comfortable and relaxing whilst being within walking distance of shopping plus having transportation in our package. Looking forward to my next stay at your fabulous establishment.

Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location close to restaurants, shopping and a short walk to the beach. Some reviews stated very noisy location, however we didn't find this, some low noise but nothing to keep you awake. Breakfast is basic, plenty of fresh fruit, muffins, toast and eggs, the macadamia coffee was good. We booked a junior suite, plenty of room for three woman and large cases.

Our middle child, her husband and two young children are staying st this place while they find a house to rent. They are military and will be in HI for three years. They say that the Aqua Oasis is absolutely fantastic! She says she wouldn't mind living in this hotel for the full 3 years! It is very clean, has a nice breakfast and the hotel staff are like family. I am so grateful they are in a safe, clean place and they are able to enjoy themselves. Thank you Aqua Oasis for alleviating a great deal of stress on their part as well as mine!

Nice big junior suite! VERY clean and comfortable. Super nice staff and Great location. Shops and restaurants right down the block! I would stay again for sure!! I missed breakfast but coffee was out nice and early!

Room very noisy because of the construction site next to the hotel. Breakfast not worth mentioning, only white bread and donuts, one type of fruit and boiled eggs. Otherwise staff very friendly and cleaning good.

This was a great place to stay. I arrived at 10am, away before my 2pm check in, but they did their best and had me in a room within the hour. The room was great. Very spacious, everything I needed, a coffee maker, and very relaxing. It was clean, bed was great and could not fault it. Was disappointed to see I couldn't smoke on the balcony, but there was a smoking area nearby. I just felt valued as a guest here. Staff knowing my name and saying good morning and doing whatever they can to make your visit more pleasurable. Beach towels available for the beach, a shuttle to the shopping centre if you need it and lots more plus points for this accommodation. I would certainly go back here again. great location.

This was my first accomodation experience in Hawaii. I stayed in this hotel during the intl conservation congress. The room was very comfortable with convenient amenities. The breakfast is offered. It is situated only a short walk to some restaurants, bars and stores in Waikiki.

I travel to HI for business. This is a great hotel for that purpose, with a kitchen option for extended stays, great location, and mid-range price. The managers and staff meet the highest standards, but do so in a sincere way, remembering me by name 6 months later. I have stayed here many times over the years. As other reviews mention, it draws families, and a generally quiet set of travelers. Also mentioned is that Lewers St. can be noisy on weekend nights, but the other side of the buildings face away from Lewers, which is much more quiet. It's a clean, convenient, efficient, relaxed place to stay at a good price -- and large rooms.

This is a fantastic mid-range option in a great location. The hotel is clean, comfortable and the staff are very friendly. There are on-site laundry facilities, kitchens (in selected rooms), and plenty of outdoor tables and chairs, so this is perfect for those who want to have some casual meals, do some self-catering, or order take-out to avoid the long wait for a table at many Waikiki restaurants. The only downside is that there is a lot of street noise at night, but ear-plugs are provided. I would definitely stay again!

great staff nice rooms my sister and my self loved the relaxed feel about this hotel the staff MARK CLIFTON /and the lovely ladies who cleaned our room and we got to know personalyevelyn rowelyn rosie just made agreat start to our usa tripwould go back again no problems

This hotel is very well appointed with friendly staff. Very near the main streets of Waikiki. Only a few steps to local restaurants. The pool area is small but adequate for those who don't want to sit on the beach. This hotel seemed to attract quieter, family groups which is a good thing for these groups. It is not a 'hip' hotel.

Disappointed with this hotel from moment we arrived, kept waiting to check in, 45 mins before due time (3pm). Reception clerk appeared hassled.'upgraded' to junior suite, not much different, only a room, had sink and coffee maker. Shower over bath, dislike this arrangement, fear of tripping whilst getting into tub.Breakfast just basic juice, coffee, hard boiled eggs and toast. Only served until 9 am!! People on holiday needs to be until at least 10 am.Small pool, basically only for few people at one time.Overall over priced for what it is, next door to run down buildings,

I didn't expect much when I booked, but the room was spacious for one person and well cleaned. All the staffs are very friendly and kind. They made my first visit Hawaii easy and Conchita cleaned my room during my stay quickly asked other staff to fix poorly drained bathroom. The location is pretty convenient, and I could visit many shops and restaurants on foot and tourist attractions by shuttle bus from the DFS located across the hotel. I will stay this hotel next time again!

Had an awesome time there. Our housekeepers Rowelyn, rosie and evelyn were fantastic. Couldnt fault the hotel. Not far from anything . Would recommend to anyone. Would definatley go back again. Great staff very helpful. In fact the whole staff were awesome. We were thrilled with Clifton,Mark and the staff

I will give 5 star for customer service. For Yasu, when we arrived, he promptly greeted us with a smile even there still a customer in front of us. I feel valued as a customer because he value our time that he does not want anybody to wait just to check in at their property especially a lot of us coming from a flight from somewhere else. Then for Josephine, I know that people is trying to get their breakfast in the morning, she keeps on top to refill all foods so that everybody will get their share. The room we got is equipped almost everything we need. There is a little bit of unwanted smell but if you open the windows, it will disappear. I assume that someone cook something else in there but did not try to circulate the air. Self parking, do not expect it, they only have a valet parking. If you want, park on your risk on the street. Most of the attractions are accessible by walking. By the way, you can borrow towels, chairs and umbrella in the front if you want to hang out in the beach. Overall, this property is great for family. By the way, don't get surprise if you need to pay for resort fee in the end of your stay. It is stated on their terms.

We arrived at 4.00am in the morning after a cancelled flight however even at this hour we received a warm welcome, found the check in process quick and easy and we were soon in our room, a Junior Suite, ready to catch up on some overdue sleep. We found the beds very comfortable and the air-conditioning kept the room at a very comfortable temperature, although when we arrived the fan was on maximum making it a little noisy, but after finding the controller the next day we set the fan to automatic making it almost silent for the rest of our stay. The décor is a little dated but the room was very comfortable and was kept nice clean and tidy by Rowelyn and we couldn't have really asked for more. We found the location excellent and all the staff really friendly and accommodating including Sarah at the concierge who did an excellent job organising a sight seeing tour for us. The whole stay felt very relaxing and we'd definitely stay here again.

From the moment we arrived, the staff struck us as being incredibly friendly and welcoming, which didn't falter throughout our stay. Yes, the hotel and the room are basic but cosy and didn't feel overcrowded as we feared. There are suitable amenities for the room: hairdryer, iron, fridge, safe, tv, wardrobe space and the general coffee making facilities. The hotel is well kept and clean, and the swimming pool is perfectly situated for some quiet afternoon sunbathing. The smoking area is beautiful, with a pond full of koi and terrapins. We had a slight issue with the air conditioning unit leaking but this was dealt with immediately and we were surprised with a lovely compensation for the trouble by Vae when we checked out. The location is perfectly situated in Waikiki for shopping, beach and pickup locations for the excursions. On this note, Sara Beth from Elite Concierge was incredible with helping us to pick and book our itinerary for the holiday; she was friendly, knowledgeable and, above all, not pushy. Definitely recommend as a base for your stay.

Comfortable, well appointed rooms with cheerful, friendly staff. Certainly worth using as your base for any Honolulu experience. Excellent location only a short walk to some of the best bars and restaraunts in Waikiki as well as the newly opened International Market.

The staff greed you with the aloha spirit from the moment you park your car. The valley is very quick and friendly. The front desk staff are very helpful with pretty much everything you need. They offer free breakfast and coffee every morning and you can't bit the location. In the heart of everything. Highly recommend it.

First the bad: When my girlfriend and I first arrived to my hotel room, we were hit by a very strong old moldy like smell. We attempted to locate the source of the smell and discovered that it was coming from the air condition. We notified the front desk who then switched us to another room. The second room also had a moldy smell, although it was less strong. We both figured all the rooms had this problem so we just accepted the room change. Lucky my girlfriend brought some natural tea tree oil and lavender essential oils to spray in the room. It somewhat helped with the odor problem.Aside from the odor, there is limited space to keep your clothes. There were only 3 tiny drawers which of course could not be shared among 2 people. I used the 3 tiny drawers and hung up some clothes while my friend mostly lived out of her suitcase and hung up a few items in the closet. We had a laniai but The view in room 715 was not appealing (to say the least) as there was construction going on in the building across. Now for the good; The Aqua Oasis is one of the more affordable places in Waikiki especially if you have a package deal for air and hotel like I did from United Vacations. The staff was pleasant and friendly (as I experience with most Hawaiians) and the bed was very comfortable (and I am extremely picky about bed comfort). The hotel offers breakfast from 7-9 am which consists of bread, butter, jam, hard boiled eggs, donuts, delicious Hawaiian pineapple, pineapple juice and coffee. They also offer a shuttle service to go to the Ala Moana mall. I particularly loved the location. Lewers street is right near many other nice hotels, shops and restaurants and is a beautiful 10 minute walk to the beach (I like to stay in the beach section of the Royal Hawaiian so I could enjoy the view of Diamond Head :)

This is a chain, and this was my third of the Aqua resorts. Aqua Oasis is certainly the best of the best! It began with the great package deals that they offer online. Then the staff was wonderful, always attentive and kind. Definitely the aloha spirit!
