Richard , Colin, Mark and the assistant manager Yasu really made the place a great stay!They offered complimentary light breakfast which was awesome in Hawaii and the valet parking was out of this world! You can tell all the employees took great pride in their jobs and again, perpetuated the aloha spirit!If you needed to wash your clothes they have an easy accessible wash and dryer for minimal charge.The concierge what I noticed was very professional and did not force events on people making it comfortable always to be around.The hotel also provided beach towels and beach chairs! Always willing to provide anything you needed.If your going to stay in Hawaii, what a great place. The rooms were awesome and appeared always clean. This was a wonderful stay!Yasu, to you and your staff, much mahalo!

The location of this hotel is great - walking distance to a lot of good eating places. There were three of us (husband and wife with our 8 year old) and there were two double beds. We sleep on a queen at home so we find a double quite small. The room itself felt quite spacious. No real drawers to put your clothes in if you like to live out of drawers (as we prefer to do when staying for a week) rather than a suitcase, but it was fine. Laundry facilities good other than the usual people who never read the instructions and put the detergent in the wrong place...The swimming pool is small, compared to how it looks in the photos, and it has a deep end (6ft) which still meant our 8 year old could jump in. And in fact, we had a great afternoon with a bunch of people from the High Fives Foundation around the pool, and they were much bigger than our boy (i.e. adults) and it worked well for them jumping in. There's no restaurant on site, but that's fine when there are so many around. The breakfast (served strictly 7-9am) in the morning is pretty basic (fresh fruit, mainly pineapple, pineapple juice, bread and bagels (can toast if you want), doughnuts and pastries if you're lucky). They are happy if you come down and take it up to your room. Most of the staff are pretty friendly. We particularly enjoyed Stephen (who was always happy to take the time to talk to our boy and let him feed the turtles) on the cars and Yasu on the front desk. They were great. Parking is US$30 a night which according to the research I did is an ok price. There is cheaper parking around but for the convenience factor (you have walk), we didn't think it was worth it. We would stay here again.

From the time I checked in I was very impressed . The reps are very nice and understanding . Even with all the questions i was asking about the area they were patient and ended it with a smile . They offer a light breakfast of coffee and fruit and toast . The fruit was amazing !!!! The hotel is located in the middle of the outlets so if you have an expensive taste you are in luck , all in the mix with the designer stores . Great dinning all over . The beach was less then a mile away walking distance . Back to the hotel beds were so comfortable. Bathrooms were spotless . Their pool was small but deep enough to relax in . I enjoyed myself . Staff was great . You will truly enjoy yourself once you have landed after your long fight . I had booked this hotel through expedia . So the only fee i paid was a $90 resort fee and of course security deposit of $100

Clean modern rooms!Great breakfastFriendliest staff!Easy access to the main shopping areas and a short walk to the beach.Staff even stores our luggage while we walked around waiting on our shuttle time for the airport.Would definitely come back again!

We stayed here for 4 days and had the most relaxing time of our holiday, staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Room was roomy, fully self contained and very comfortable. Front staff Vae and Yasu were very helpful and friendly, every question we asked they were able to help us out and knew where things were that we asked about. The motel is within walking distance to shops and beach and various restaurants, great location..

Spent three nights at Aqua Oasis recently and was well pleased with the service provided and with the hotel quality.Our room was a good size with a very comfortable king size bed. Decoration was just fine.The bathroom was fine; reasonable size and fittings.The location was terrific; close to all the Waikiki attractions; easy walking distance to the beach.A continental breakfast was also provided - very simple but as a bonus it was just fine.The hotel provided a very comfortable stay at an altogether agreeable price.

We arrived late and the front desk receptionist doubles as valet at that time of night, after 9p. We parked at a lot a few blocks away because parking looked shady, at best. The hotel only offers valet parking at $30, so while the lot we parked at was a few blocks away, it was about $10 cheaper. After waiting for the valet to come, he checked us in gave us a welcome package of snacks and water. We had a corner room, which has a huge lanai and the penthouse, 11th floor, gives a nice view. The hotel is old but clean and they try. The room was huge, similar to a studio, and divided by a folding screen, that was super difficult to open. While the corner room is right next to the elevator, it was quite except for the morning with normal city noises, traffic, cleaning and delivery trucks.

If you want a hotel that is centrally located within Waikiki, this is it. We were only 2 blocks from shopping and 5-6 blocks from the beach. If you want to go to the beach every day, this might be a little inconvenient. The staff was excellent and always willing to please. While we were checking in, our bags were brought to our room for us. The room was clean, not overly fancy, but very large. The breakfast in the morning is very limited, so if you are a big breakfast eater - you'll need to go elsewhere. Overall, we were very satisfied with our experience.

A repeated customer.... A home away from home!!rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff is excellent, super friendly!Hotel is close to everything within walking distance.Looking forward to my next stay!!

Great location, close to everything, dining, shopping. Very clean, great staff. Basic breakfast is included as are beach towels, beach chairs, movies. Tour desk available.King size beds and balcony. Reasonably priced propertyHighly recommended

Its always a pleasure to stay here at Aqua Oasis, the staff are so welcoming and friendly, the hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, the location is fantastic. I love the ambiance. Look forward to returning in 2017

Well, let begin by saying that this trip was medical for me. Altho, eye surgery is fairly common, for some like me it can be uncomfortable. Now, let me start from the beginning... being from the neighbor island and traveling to oahu for a medical procedure can be trying and quite costly. Now, I want so be at a hotel where I will be comfortable, that is clean and convenient location. So, with all of these pleasantries in my wish list how on earth can I expect to travel with a budget.... I must be insane!! But, say hello to the AQUA OASIS... now we have stayed with them several times before..(.but to be honest many times we have strayed to stay within our means) You know, especially when it's not for pleasure. Anyhow, I do need to say, the staff is just absolutely wonderful, they do everything they can to bring you comfort. Mr. Yasu and his crew are spot on when it come to service. And I say this to our locals, you know, many a hotels will take a backseat approach to locals, and cater to the tourist WAY more than us locals...some hotels have this "eh, you local, you no need attention" , but here at the OASIS everyone gets the same great service. It's clean and comfortable. Their breakfast is quite generous in my opinion. Parking is only by valet.I would ask for a higher floor next time per street noise...(not the hotels fault) As i said, rooms are kept clean and comfortable.I only wish that they could work out something so those of us on a medical visits could stay there all the visits. I have recommended the AQUA OASIS to my place of work, all of my family and friends. I have an other doctor visit in December for another procedure, I hope to stay at the AQUA OASIS as it is the place to stay for comfort and peace of mind. Mahalo AQUA OASIS...

A pleasure to stay there, Always!!!!!Everything about this hotel is excellent !!!! Clean comfortable rooms...Very kind and helpful staff...It's my go to Hotel in Waikiki. No need to go to any of the big name Hotels.The Aqua Oasis Hotel is all you need. It's close to everything.

Rocky start when we arrived at 1am and supposedly given an upgrade to a king bed and a sofa bed. Not impressed when they expected us to make up sofa bed. Travelling with girlfriend and were not a couple. Air con was extremely noisy and music from nightclub unbearably loud. After complaint was moved next morning to a much nicer room with two queen beds which is what we booked. After this had lovely stay beds comfortable big balcony and clean room.Nightclub operated fri say so keep in mind Breakfast now worth it but plenty of options locally. Good location overall. Beautiful gardens Also had a laundry Make sure you visit the Koi ponds lovely

Aqua Oasis was one of the best experiences I've had in awhile when staying at a hotel... With the pool for the keiki and spa for my other half and the beach right across the way couldn't ask for more... But there was MORE with free Wi-Fi and shuttle service to Ala Moana and the customer service was extremely excellent, treated me and my family like ohana. Will be staying there again in the near future. Mahalo Aqua Oasis staff

We had a GREAT stay at the Aqua Oasis, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable and nice, the location was very convenient to all the places in waikiki loved it, Thanks again Aqua Oasis great job!!!

Our room was kept so fresh and clean by Conchita! She was fantastic, as was the service from all of the hotel staff. They're all very friendly, and incredibly helpful with making vacation plans! The amenities and free breakfast were simple, but nice, and the free towel and DVD service was a great addition.

Very clean friendly staff very central location and easy to deal with I would stay here again and again if your looking for a central base for Waikiki this is the spot for you, pool is small thou we didn't use it while the amazing beaches are available, tour desk down stairs was very helpful also

House maid service was slack, she took the money and ran.They have know idea of a buffet breakfast. Bread which you could toast, jam, butter. Boiled eggs which you had to ask for. Pineapple pieces. And some small donut flavoured bites. Old and shabby accommodation, back in the days it would have been good.. We're it is located is central to shops and beach.

If you need a cheap place to stay in Waikiki with kitchen, close to everything, and that is CLEAN, stay here. If you are looking for fancy new digs with shiny new everything, pay twice as much and look elsewhere. Our room was perfect for our family of 4. Huge bathroom, great kitchen to use with full size appliances. We couldn't ask for a more central place to start from. Parking can be steep, but the valets are wonderful and fast. You can't park on your own with the hotel, but its more costly nearby, so why would you? Staff was helpful and friendly, rooms were worn but clean, and karaoke in the first floor lounge. Simple continental breakfast, nothing fancy. Cookies for the kids at check in. Nothing thrilling, just a good dependable place to stay. We enjoyed it.

Visited with my family of five and spent 10 days. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful indeed. Rooms were clean and comfortable with good cleaning services. Can't fault it at all. The hotel location was perfect as it is right in the middle of the buzz of Waikiki. Easy access to shops, restaurants and about 7 mins walk to the beach. There's a free shuttle bus each half hour to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Only downside of the hotel was the breakfast. Nothing to get excited about, same thing each day...bread, fruit, boiled eggs and the occasional muffin. There was pineapple juice only and tea and coffee. Our room had a kitchen so we could prepare some bacon and fried eggs at least.Waikiki is expensive indeed so be prepared. Lots of places to eat but cost quite a few bucks. There's always the food courts in the shopping malls nearby. Overall, a lovely holiday and stay at this hotel.

Clean, light and bright hotel in a great location, just off the main shopping street and a short walk to the beach. Beds were comfortable and bathrooms were really nice. Rooms were nice and quiet and the air con worked well, great value for the price. Special thanks to Miko on the front desk who was so lovely and helpful :)

This is a little gem of a hotel right in the thick of it, I have been stopping here for years. The staff are amongst the nicest and helpful I have met. Most of the best restaurants are an easy walk, the ala Moana shopping mall is an easy 20 min walk. Beach about 10 min

We were upgraded to room 801. Top floor, spacious room with a kitchen and large balcony. Views? Not too much. Balcony is over Lewers Street and a view of the surrounding buildings. Kitchen window looks out at the ocean side but can only get a glimpse of the ocean through the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. A/C worked fine. Bathroom had a large tub with an adjustable shower head and a Toto toilet with all the fixings - seat warmer, front and rear washer, no slam lid. Breakfast is continental - pasteries, fruit, beverages. Morning paper is available too. Oasis is near just about everything. If continental breakfast is not enough, IHOP and Dennys are a few minutes away by foot. Resort hotels are nearby as well as all of the Waikiki shopping spots and the beach. There are a couple of bars next door - great if you're into the bar scene: Moose McGillycudy's and Kelly O'Neils are right next door. Down side to that - the music can be a little loud after midnight. Hotel staff are among the most pleasant friendly helpful people. Just remember, it's not a resort; it's an excellent place to keep your stuff and lay your head while you enjoy visiting Waikiki.

very nice hotel, staff extremely friendly, great position to go shopping or to waikiki beach.rooms are spacious and clean, with balconies and comfortable bathroomfree wifi, small pool, shuttle service to the airport make the stay really enjoyable
user_name:
sebypeluso
New York City, New York

review_body: Selected this location by random because of being late in booking my trip. Had three great nights at this place with very helpful staff. Arrived rather late after a 22 hours trip and was not able to catch all the things when checking in. Therefore missed the breakfast on the first day, but the staff provided me with some coffee, which was very pleasant. I'd suggest to put some of the key information in the room on a leaflet.Hotel is well located, walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and to the main street in Waikiki.The complimentary breakfast provided a minor selection of pastries, toast, coffee, jelly and pineapple juice. During rush hours in the morning, seating for breakfast is sometimes crowded but manageable. One drawback which is not the fault of the Hotel: constructions are going on at the opposite premises which makes it rather noisy in the morning. Not sure when this will be finished. But as I was in Honolulu, my aim was to stay outside as much as possible!If you are looking for a place to stay, where people care about you, this is your choice!

I have just spent 6 nights at the Aqua Oasis and was very impressed with the hotel. I really liked the location which was close to shops, restaurants and the beach. It was good to be at a hotel that provided a lot of the little extras .The free DVD hire, loaning of beach towels ,chairs and umbrellas, laundry facilities on site and the free breakfast made the holiday more enjoyable. Rooms were clean and well presented.The only things that could be improved on is the air conditioner, while doing the job, was noisy and the breakfast menu could be expanded a little . I have travelled to Hawaii many times and this is my first stay at Aqua Oasis. I will definitely consider staying here again on my next trip.

So we missed our flight came a day later they were so nice they accommodate us provided with extra bed and a remote for my son everybody was super friendly Mr yusa at the front desk was the highlight of our stay there doing the checkout he told us he gave us a free night. From breakfast to the room everything was awesome 5 star excellent customer service great spot and very clean!We are already missing the place

Convenient location, walking distance to beach, shops and restaurants. For the price, this place was clean, safe and friendly staff. We thought our room came with a kitchenette when we booked our reservation. Upon arriving we found out it was not the case. Yasu and Clifton at the front desk were very accommodating with the change. We were very pleased with the service.

Stayed over for one night with my wife in July. The location was good, albeit it a tad far from the beach. Surrounded by lots of shopping and eating places - so it is very convenient.However, the hotel looks a bit run down - in need of some refurbishing. That's not to say it's unlivable or anything - everything still works! The room was of adequate size and the bed was really comfortable. All beddings were clean. The bathroom was quite basic and supplied with basic toiletries. Complimentary breakfast came with the room - the spread was quite basic: hard boiled eggs (no other choice), bread, jam and butter, some pastries, fruits and coffee & tea. Loved the choices offered for coffee though!The staff were great - very helpful - especially helping us to arrange the shuttle to the airport at the last minute - they used Island Express Shuttle, which was much cheaper than getting a taxi! There is also a complimentary shuttle that picks up guest from all the Aqua Hotels to the Ala Moana shopping Centre - probably the largest around - just ask the front desk for the shuttle timings!The hotel is also very near to a Ross Dress for Less store - lots of good branded clothings and accessories there selling at low low prices! And they open till late! We shopped till almost midnight and no one appeared to be in a hurry to close the shop!Well, on the whole we enjoyed our stay, though we might look for one closer to the beach next time - but of course we won't be able to get the great price that Aqua Oasis offers.

I got in to Honolulu at 6am on a red eye from Sydney and wasn't in the greatest mood after about 3 hours of sleep. I was dreading having to wait until that afternoon to check in, but I was pleasantly surprised when they let me store my bags there, which let me do some extra exploring on my relatively short trip.The room was nice, the air conditioning thankfully worked very well and the king bed was very comfortable. The location is great with all sorts of great food and beaches really close by. The bus stop is pretty close for getting around the island.I even got some free macadamia cookies when I checked out. Thanks Masu and everyone for a great stay!

I live just outside of Waikiki but like to spend a few weekends a year in Waikiki. My last stay was at the Aqua Oasis and I will definitely be returning. Yasu handled my check-in at the front desk, when I arrived early with the intent of asking them to hold my bag while I went surfing. He not only found a room for me that was available right away but the room was an upgrade from what i had reserved. When I asked about moped parking, he directed me to the Valet, Mike, who found secure parking on the property at no extra charge. Both Yasu and Mike treated me like I was their best customer ever.Not sure if it's standard or not but the AC was already and the refrigerator cold when i entered the room. I liked that.I had selected the Aqua Oasis for this visit thinking that the deep soak tub was some kind of built in Jacuzzi and thought i'd be disappointed when i realized it was just an over-sized tub. I ended up enjoying the ability to just soak in it up to my neck. Very relaxing. I had not experienced a Bidet before but the one in my room proved to be an excellent benefit.Yasu inquired about my Wifi requirements and wasn't phased at all when I said I would be using a laptiop, ipad and the data side of mycell phone during my visit. He provided access codes for each one and said if i needed more to just let him know..I was concerned about outside noise and had read that other reviews said being close to the elevator was also a noise distraction.However, the elevator didn't affect me and there was almost zero outside noise once if i closed the lanai doors and curtains. Complimentary breakfast was also a nice feature. I'm not really a morning eater but being able to sit down and drink a couple cups of coffee and a glass of juice was exactly what i wanted. I only saw on girl maintaining the breakfast but she made sure to say hi when she passed anyone and, like Yasu and Mike, made me feel like i was a VIP.I will be going back.

Front desk staff, Lua, was very helpful, we lost luggage and he helped us locate it from shuttle service. Room was nice, very close to everything within walking distance. Great air conditioning. If I was to change anything I would add a few more breakfast items.

Fantastic location, one block from the Main Street of Waikiki. Friendly staff, complimentary continental breakfast, complimentary in-house movies, guest laundry, complimentary shuttle. Perfect location for a family holiday, everything within walking distance.

we stayed 10 nights in June, we had the junior suite, very spacious accommodations, nice kitchen area with a breakfast bar, and a huge balcony patio. Morning continental breakfast buffet, all of the on site, professional staff, and all were very friendly. We will definitely be staying at the Aqua Oasis on our next trip to Waikiki

The paradise Honolulu aims to be turned out in an anticlamax after arriving in the hotel. Despite a promised parking place we needed to look for parking space by ourselfs. After searching for more then half an hour there suddenly was one available, despite earlier claims. To be fair, we didn't need to pay anymore which was somewhat of an solution. Seeing the room was the next dissapointment. The five beds we booked were stuffed in a big twopwrson bedroom. The beds was way too small to normally lay down let alone to sleep in. The location however was relative good.This could have been a great hotel, if only the service would have been good. The staff just weren't nice people at all.

The hotel and staff were superb. Yasu at the front desk was very accommodating and knowledgeable. Cosnhita, my room attendant was very nice and cleaned my room daily. Anything I need she provided w/o a hassle. I've never met nicer people.

The valet and front desk staff were very friendly and helpful! Yasu, the main guy really took care of us. The stay was excellent! The staff is truly full of aloha spirit! They were so friendly and accommodating. Additionally, Our family really enjoyed the pool, morning breakfast, the free movie rentals as well as the access to all Waikiki has to offer. The room was cozy and clean with Plenty of seating on balcony. It was nice having a laundry area as well. My husband was scheduling the shuttle to take our family and 9 suitcases to the airport, it's $14 /person (pricey) but the staff said, no, let us call you a large cab(escalade). It's going to save us $30! They didn't have to do that. Instead of being greedy they wanted to be helpful.

We had a change of plans and stayed for two nights...it was a very decent hotel in a GREAT location near Waikiki (especially if you like shopping)...also Moose Mulligiddy's is down the street, which is a decent party bar...the entrance has a nice open layout, with a turtle pound, and a small pool. Breakfast was ok...bagels, toast, eggs, coffee, etc. There was re-painting when we went, which meant everything smelled like primer...plus we also had the A/C on all the time (as requested from the hotel) and it smelled a bit like mildew, which generally made us sick. Again, this is a fine hotel, but it's a bit more like a motel, so at a higher price I would say it's ok.
user_name:
tmalley2177
Syracuse, New York, United States

review_body: Very nice hotel, great service, and short walk to the beach and several restaurants. Our room was very clean thanks to Rowelyn, our amazing room attendant. Valet parking only but Mike and the others did a great job.

We arrived at about 1pm and our room wasn't ready...no probs it does say check in at 3pm. Unfortunately the poor chap at the front desk was by himself and it took ages for him to attend to us. After the formalities were completed, I was told that our room would be the top floor (8th floor) family room as the room type I had requested was not available. Anyway, the room was huge, with a kitchen and a small lounge room. The balcony was large but overlooked a construction site (no biggie as we didn't spend all day on the balcony and construction was over by the time we got back.Bed comfy, good amenities and friendly staff (if a bit slow with service). It's hard to say something negative because the I didn;t get the room i paid for so the upgrade was a real surprise.The rooms are dated - pretty much ALL rooms are dated in waikiki except for a few newer ones (Trump for example) so the room was a good dated.It is close to the main drag and a short walk to most places.Value wise, it's a bit on the steep side but again, Waikiki isn;t a value destination.Overall not a bad hotel and would consider staying here again in a return visit.Breakfast isn't worth getting excited about as it is just a croissant and some other small pastries, if you can book a room and save a few $$ on breakfast, go for that option as you will probably head out and get another meal in about 1/2 hour anyway.

What a great place to stay. Awesome location that is near everything in Waikiki. The wonderful staff will assist you with anything and make you feel at home. Good breakfast and a nice relaxing pool. If you want a nice layer back place. This is it. Thank you for the hospitality.

Couldn't fault the hotel room and location. However the reception staff weren't the most helpful when asked questions about how to get somewhere. Not the cheapest hotel but you'd pay another $150 per night for another hotel around the corner. Bit noisy on Friday & Saturday night as next to a couple of irish bars so lots of naval personnel.Overal we were happy and would go stay there again.

This hotel made our Hawaii trip even better! The staff was personable, especially Conchita. She did an excellent job meeting all of our requested needs. Not only was the staff great, but the rooms were clean, and the location was right at the heart of Waikiki. I would suggest this hotel to anyone staying in Oahu.

Our room needed 2 beds but the reservation showed only 1. The staff was quick to make the correction and were very friendly! I would recommend this hotel to my friends. It is conveniently located in Waikiki. The only downside is there is no parking, however Valet is available and you can leave as many times as you like for a flat fee. Rooms were very clean and comfortable!

We stayed here for 10 days, and thought it was good value for the price, room had everything we needed and the DVD ATM is great if you want a quiet night in. Breakfast was basic, but enough to give you a start to the day, the pool is small but the patio area is very pleasant to sit and read. All of the staff were very helpful

I would not recommend ANY guest to stay in this hotel. My son slept in a bed that was covered in someone's blood. The sheets were already laundered, and place on his bed as a new set of sheets. I went down to the front desk to complain and the attending staff member ask me to lower my voice and refused to call anyone from management. I am also a travel agent and will not recommend any of my clients to stay in such a careless hotel.

For the price it was PERFECT. Everybody was really nice and the location is great. Close to the beach and the good shopping. The room was very fresh and had comfortable beds. We have lived at tree hotels while here and this was by far the best one.

I visit Honolulu annually for a holiday. I absolutely love everything about it. When it comes to accommodation I choose value for money and a good location.This time I stayed at Aqua Oasis on Lewers St. There were 5 of us in total. We had two rooms. Mine had a full kitchen fully equipped, while my friends were in the room next door in a Jnr Suite. The rooms were so light and airy with the most comfortable beds and were a great size ours had 2 double beds and a sofa bed. The bathroom was well appointed it even had a "loo" with lots of bells and whistles (I kid you not). Lovely big soft fluffy towels and toiletries topped up as needed. A breakfast was served every morning in the pool area. There was also a shuttle which ran hourly with frequent stops along the way as far as the zoo then out to Ala Moana shopping centre and back. We took advantage of the complimentary Beach chairs and beach towels from reception every day too. Another plus was having a laundry area on site. Pleasant surrounds and a comfortable reception area with very accommodating staff have ensured a return visit next year. In fact 1 lady from our group is going back in November with her family and rebooked here. A big Thankyou Aqua Oasis from this Aussie see you next year Margaret Walker

I really enjoyed my two stays there, once in 2015 and another time in 2016. However, the parking was not easy until we found the private parking for a fee in the back of the hotel. Loved the simple breakfast, really pushed us out to have real fun. Shopper-aholics, beware, we are right next to the Galleria duty free and the main shopping street... the room key even gives you a 10~15% discount at Macy's near by. Be conscious how much you've spent when you are out....

Nice but small rooms. Extremely limited storage space for clothes, etc. No view but within walking distance from lots of things. Unfortunately, VERY noisy due to construction, traffic, and motorcycles screaming down the street at night so take earplugs or a white noise machine. Staff was pleasant, Conchita in Housekeeping took great care of us and maintenance responded within five minutes of our reporting a running toilet. Decent place to stay if you are on a budget.

This charming, friendly, personable hotel was our first point of hospitality on our Hawaii vacation. The warmth and efficiency of the staff made our stay a real pleasure/ The location, less than ten minutes walk from the beach, near a range of shops and restaurants and with easy access to buses and tour coaches, was near-perfect. The breakfast fare was simple but delicious; shared tables allowed us to make the acquaintance of other guests from all over the world.The only downside was a steep valet parking fee of 30 dollars per day over and above the usual resort fee. Had we known this earlier, we might have considered a different hotel.

I painstakingly worked to find a hotel within a budget for a wedding. Especially since I didn't want to break the bank with everything in Honolulu being so expensive and me just being there to fulfill an obligation. Here is the following tips when selecting this hotel: Location: While the location is about 5-7 minutes from Waikiki (depending on how fast you walk). It is a little off the beaten path. It is extremely close to GREAT restaurants and ABC stores. Be warned. As a single girl alone on vacation, I was very happy I had someone to walk me home at night. There are two bars you have to walk past and the crowd seems to get a bit sketchier the later it gets. There was never once that I felt extremely unsafe, I just had to be VERY aware of my surroundings. View: Please do not expect a view. Unless you enjoy looking at construction site and a Vietnamese restaurant. Literally that's it. I should have known better and asked for a street view room. At least that would have given me some people watching entertainment and not an unwelcome alarm clock thanks to the construction every weekday morning. Room: While they worked very hard to modernize the hotel. There are still aspects that are dated or need some love. For example the hallways are very dim at night and the bathrooms could use a little bit more updating. The closet is very small and there is only a rod on one side, which can make it difficult to hang clothing. Also, the walls are very thin so be prepared to hear your upstairs neighbors if they are nosy. There is only one housekeeper, Conchita. She is great and very sweet however, I didn’t get my room cleaned until about 3:00 almost daily which wasn’t bad but would be nice to give her some help. Pool: The pool is VERY small. Be warned. While there are lounge chairs that are by the area there are not a lot so it makes it difficult to over crowd the pool. The view isn’t the best from the pool but it is a great alternative if you are all beached out. It just wasn’t my first or second choice to catch some sun. Tips: When I checked in, my credit card was charged for the room and then charge $50 for an amenities fee. Being that I booked it on booking.com with no indication that there was an additional fee which annoyed me but the thing that really bothered me was that when checking in, it wasn’t mentioned at all. I didn’t mind paying the $50 but I felt as if it was being hidden which I didn’t appreciate. The hotel has beach chairs you can get for free. Use these beach chairs! The hotel will offer you a beach chair, all you have to do is ask at the front desk. These are 100% worth lugging them to the beach being that unless you want sand in your bag or to pay $50 at the Sheraton for 2 chairs and an umbrella. The best beach is between the Sheraton and Royal Hawaiian. It is sandy with no rocks and plenty of places to lounge around. Overall this was a convenient hotel location wise. While I might be a little too critical on my reviews I would have wished to read a little bit more about the cons before booking. I would have probably changed my mind in staying at the Aqua Oasis.

Low to mid range accomm. Very noisy - earplugs essential to block out street/footpath & aircon noise. Well situated within walking distance to beaches shopping & pubs/eateries.Across the road from Waikiki Trolley base. We prepurchased tickets in Aus - 7 day pass - which gives access to all 5 lines. Grab a brochure & plan your journeys/tours for the day. ABC stores - ( plenty) local convenience stores - offer alcohol souvenirs sandwiches/rolls groceries etc. We enjoyed lolling on the beaches but lounge/umbrella hire pricey from $45 - $65 US for all day depending on part of Waikiki. If we had our time again I think staying at beach front hotels that have their own piece of sand with umbrella/lounges supplied may have been the best option.More expensive but would have suited us. Breakfast at Aqua Oasis basic but adequate - pineapple boiled eggs toast spreads pastries. With AUD exchange at the moment plus the tipping culture we found Hawaii very expensive eating out. Smaller bars eg Cuckoo Coconut a kind of pop up set up - in the next street over very enjoyable with live music most nights & cocktails to die for. Overall a pleasant 10 days & the Aqua staff very friendly & helpful.We worked out leaving a small tip for cleaner daily was usual practice so left $2- $3 with a thank you note each day.

I don't often give hotels an overall rating of "poor", but I couldn't find much to love about the Aqua Oasis.The hotel is shabby. Our room, a junior suite, was spacious, but not very clean. The sofa appeared quite new, but other furnishings had see better days. The mattress on the bed was comfortable, but the solitary blanket was thin and we felt cold. We had to turn the air con off before we went to bed, as it was noisy.The bathroom fittings were worn, tired and a tad grimy.Street noise, noise from a nearby bar, accompanied by shrieks in the middle of the night from inconsiderate guests, resulted in us getting only a few hours sleep before a long flight the next day.Internet connection was unreliable.We were pleased to leave the next day and won't be back!

Darylynn, and her staff are AMAZING! The breakfast was awesome, pool very clean, and our room was gorgeous and huge! Mike is super helpful in making sure you have your rides worked out and you get the chance to SEE it all!This place felt like staying with a friend. They know your name, they greet you each time they see you and they are interested in how it's all going. They became friends and we will return there soon ! Looking for your own little get away.... you won't notice you're sharing with others? See Darylynn at Aqua oasis!Mahalo to all

My husband and I stayed at Aqua Oasis for 7 days. We had an overall good stay. It is in a very good location. It is walking distance to everything and also to the bus stop.The hotel overall was a bit dated but clean. The staff was great, pleasant and helpful. Our room was ok. Furniture in our room was also dated but bed was comfy and we loved the big tub, sort of like a hot tub. On the day of our anniversary, when we got in the room, there was 2 bottles of champagne and chocolates. That was really thoughtful of the staff. As for the breakfast, we thought there would have been a bit more when we saw breakfast included. If I remember correctly, it was toast, jam, butter, hard boiled egg, mini doughnuts and pineapple. So we were never really filled but it was still something. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here the first few nights of our honeymoon and it was great. Convenient location to the beach, rooms were tidy, clean and comfortable. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning was great and the front desk were incredibly helpful and friendly. Im not sure where they get their pillows but they were so comfortable I wish I found out where to buy them from!

While I would not call this a luxury hotel, it was very nice. We slept well, enjoyed the breakfast which was limited but nice. The pool is very small but I sure didn't go all the way to HI to spend time in the pool at the hotel! I don't know where they get their pineapples but I didn't find any as sweet as theirs in the 9 days we were there. The staff was helpful. There is a smoking "garden" with a koi pond that was really nice and close for the smokers in our group.

This hotel is well located; within walking distance of shopping, great restaurants, and the beach. We stayed in a Jr. Suit and honestly the kitchen was a lifesaver. We enjoy dining out but our pockets appreciated the option to stay in. Parking was valet only. I usually prefer to park my own car but honestly the staff was so great I soon forgot about that preference. As a matter of fact the staff was our favorite part. They were always so friendly and helpful that we began to look forward to oppurtunities to interact with them.

In June of 2015, my family flew in from all over the country to attend my cousin Kylie's graduation from Pearl City High. Although some of us stayed with family in Pearl City, most of us stayed at the newly remodeled, "Aqua Oasis Hotel" in Waikiki. This wonderful boutique hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, and it is the perfect location for those who are new to Oahu and want to be close to all that Waikiki has to offer, like the beach and high-end shopping. You'll be well taken care of by Michael Preddy or any of the other wonderful staff who will always provide "planny" smiles and "da kine" great hospitality! Be sure to check out the Aqua Oasis on Lewers; you won't be disappointed!!

We were very happy with this hotel, the staff went out of their way to help.The suite was very spacious & you had everything you needed to make it a home away from home.The rooms were clean, well stocked, A/C worked well & the bathroom was very spacious.The full sized fridge & fully functioning kitchen was an extra bonus.Breakfast was not very good, it consisted of eggs, bread & some pastries, oranges & pineapple.The sofa in the room was uncomfortable to sit on.

Decent place. Small pool (basically a tub). The bathroom smelled of mildew and I asked the front desk to bleach around the bathtub. I could see the mildew around the handles and in the cracks. Also the shower handle would stay up. They did fix the handle, but didn't clear the mildew smell.

This was my second stay at Aqua Oasis, and I am quite familiar with Oahu from many visits to see family and friends over the years. This hotel has a great location in Waikiki for shopping and restaurants, but very noisy at night. If you have young children I would not recommend it as it is neighbours to 2 popular bars (kelley o'neil's and moose mcgillycuddy). So if you are young and want to party, good spot! The beach is a 5 min. walk, but I recommend walking 10min either west or east of hotel as the beach directly south of hotel is not the best (not a lot of sand real estate!). Actually, I recommend heading out of the city in any direction for a beautiful beach. North shore people!!!!Do not expect a view as building not very high (only 7 floors I believe so all the beachfront hotels obstruct any chance of a view) and rooms facing west face on to construction (and a small parking lot where people like to go at 3am to blast their car stereos as loud as they can, haha!). Luckily your room comes with ear plugs... They have a concierge in place. We used her services only once, but the time we did use her services we were disappointed. We were looking for a sit down Dim Sum restaurant in Chinatown and she sent us to a hole in the wall Take Out restaurant. Definitely no seating! When we returned to the hotel and told her, she said she had just googled it and it had good reviews, but had not heard of it before... Thanks.There is a Tiny pool and a few chairs to lounge (probably less than 10). Never went in... Its in a corner on lobby floor and surrounded by walls. Not inviting like at the Hilton or Hale Koa for example...***************So now for the piece de resistance! The reasoning for my "Terrible" rating is because of the difficulty I have been having after my stay...**********************As Ive said, this is my second stay here, and this has happened both times... After I got home the first time (May 2015) I had 4 or 5 different transactions on my card statement with numbers that made no sense. Charges of $2000, $500 and then some credits etc. The final amount worked out to be about what I had signed for so I left it alone... human error happens and it wasn't enough of a difference to bother with it.This last time...we (myself and 3 colleagues/friends) were there 25 Mar - 2 Apr 2016. We had a great rate worked out once again as we had booked through a friend who works as the coordinator/revenue-sales development for the brand in Oahu. We approached the desk upon check out and had them print out the charges.. we looked over the charges and realized there were some errors. We pointed out errors such as paying for parking on days we had not and paying for resort fees when we were told they would wave them. The lady at the desk kindly removed the fees and showed us the final balance of $1547.70 (deposit already paid at time of booking). We then split the charges between the 4 girls and they took our credit cards and processed them one by one. My share was $206.58 as I had paid the deposit. The lady told us we were all good and so we left for the airport.. When I got my CC statement, my CC had 5 different transactions from Aqua Oasis. $2776.42, $452.12, $1570.54 and then credits of $2641.00 and $166.58. Total balance; $1991.5 from my share... MORE than our total costs.When I tried getting a hold of them I was told it was because the other guests had paid and said that the balance was to go on my card (untrue as I was there and we then went to the airport together..) The second time I brought it up during a separate call I was told it was because one of the credit cards had not gone through (also untrue as my colleagues have statements to prove they paid in full). The third time I was told it was because there was a balance and they just went ahead and charged the card on file. I then got an email with their transaction breakdowns which do not match the print out we were given and the numbers still don't add up. They agreed to give me a refund of $1101.97 as even by their math I was overcharged, but getting half my money is not what I call a resolution. And I have not yet seen this amount returned... If you choose to stay here definitely beware of the charges to your card. Resolution is not easy and the stress and time this has consumed is not worth it. Almost takes away whatever relaxation I got from going on vacation...

We checked in late, around 8pm so the room that we have booked with three beds and a kitchen were not available any more, instead they gave us a room with two beds only, with kitchen of course. They said that the room that we have asked for would be available on our last night but we didn't ask to change the room since we were there for only three nights. The hotel has a small swimming pool. They serve decent basic intercontinental breakfast in their main partly-openaired lobby with orange, pineapple, white and brown bread with butter and jelly, boiled eggs, doughnuts, bagels, croissants and pineapple juice. There is only valet parking. Staff are nice, friendly and helpful. Our room was decent, comfortable and clean with balcony. The AC helped a lot since it's hot in this time of the year. There was a cleaning lady that came by every day to clean our room and renewed all the towels.The only thing you need to expect is quite some noise at night but not too bad since it is in the middle of Waikiki. I would book this place again for sure, but probably will ask for a room in a quieter corner coz it was somewhat hard for our young toddler to sleep at night.

Arrived at the hotel at around 9am from an overnight flight without any expectations and during check-in was told by Darlinia that our room was not ready, which was understandable as it was so early at that time. While using wifi at lobby to connect with family back home, Darlinia called me and she said that there might be a room available. I quickly handed her our passports and she checked us in and even upgraded my room to a bigger room. I cannot tell her how happy and appreciated I felt since after long flight with a 6 hour transit in Tokyo we were dead beat. I was also celebrating my wedding anniversary and this was our long awaited anniversary trip. We had a smile on our faces when we entered the room. It was huge and it had a mini pantry area that comes with a coffee machine, fridge and a microwave! The view was unblocked but it wasn't fantastic either but it was ok. We had a very good rest before starting our day walking around Waikiki. The A/C was very cold and on some days it was a relief from the heat. We don't really use the AC at night as the weather was cooler and we like to leave the Lanai doors slightly ajar. Breakfast was ok, not much variety but ok to start your day. Wifi was very good and my phone connects to the network the moment I step into the hotel lobby. Location of Aqua Oasis was awesome. Easy access to the beach, shops and restaurants at the Royal Hawaiian and Beachwalk. Short bus ride to Ala Moana Center too. We felt safe and had no issues coming back late nights even when there's like 2 clubs on the same street. I cannot thank Aqua Oasis and Darlinia and the rest of the staff enough in making my stay a memorable and wonderful one. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends.

Cannot beat the price, or convince of how close to the beach and shopping this hotel is. Breakfast selections were limited but enough to hold us over until lunch. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay and could not fault the place. It is in a great location just minutes walk from great shopping, about 5 mins walk from the Cheesecake Factory, Outrigger, Sheraton, the beach and more.We stayed in a junior suite which was spacious with a balcony, there is no view of the beach or a luxurious pool to lounge around, but is a really great place to stay at a reasonable price within walking distance. It offers a local free shuttle running from 8.30am-9pm, WIFI, free games and movies as well as a continental breakfast included in the resort fee ($15 per day).Staff were lovely and helpful.We can't wait to come back. Mahalo for a wonderful stay.

You get what you pay for here. If you are after a resort and want to relax beside a glorious pool, this is not for you. Pool is small and seems to be closed most of the time. Rooms are basic but cleanA good long stroll to the beachClose to eateriesViews back onto construction

We stayed in a junior suite. It was a good size given we were out most of the day. The kitchen gave us freedom to stay in and breakfast was included. Kids loved the free movies and games. it was a little noisy at times due to nearby bars, but overall very good - central to everything and easy to get to.

The hotel was in a great location close to shops, restaurants and the beach. The rooms were large and clean but older. Staff were friendly and helpful. Complementary breakfast was appreciated. Complementary shuttle bus to Shopping centre and complementary beach towels available which was fantastic (we change ours everyday when we retuned from the beach) beach chairs available too but for a cost. Free wifi was excellent .We had a view of a construction site next door but overall it didn't bother us at all.. We would definitely stay here again .

Gorgeous rooms with everything you need. Great sized bath tub and bathroom. Pleasant staff and right in the middle of everything. Yes on Lewers St there are a few bars but if you honestly shut your balcony door you really can't hear anything. Will def stay again.

What a great way to spend our last 5 days. It is only a couple of streets back from the beaches so a short walk. A pleasant continental breakfast and a very happy friendly staff. Every staff member I encountered was so very pleasant and helpful. The concierge we dealt with was awesome. Thank you Sara Beth you made a final destination and Hawaiian experience a wonderful one. The hotel is very pleasant with a calming feel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Shame our view was a construction site and the noise at 5:30 am we could have done without but that is not the fault of this lovely little Oasis. Great place at a reasonable rate for families!!

It's close to shops, places to eat and the beach. Our room was a good size though there needs to be a handrail to get in and out of the high bath - there is a rail once you are in the bath, only 1 chair in the room and no table, so we had to sit on our bed to eat or watch TV.We knew we were close to clubs but the noise is extreme on Friday night till 4am and Sat night till 3am, we didn't sleep those nights and wasted our days needing a sleep, we didn't go to Hawaii to sleep our day away. I doubt sleeping tablets would help. Nobody should be subjected to that and any form of management would move their guests away as there were other available rooms further away. We knew about the $30 valet charge, but were disgusted to regularly see our car just parked on the street or in the alleyway, definitely not the secure carpark. We could have saved our money and done that, so we were ripped off there.We travel to Hawaii several times a year, and were looking for somewhere different to stay, but we wouldn't stay here again Fri, Sat or Sun and we'll probably go back to our $15 secure carpark.Breakfast was okay for us, it's just juice, toast, boiled eggs and pineapple. Female at check in desk was nice too.

Stayed here for 3 nights and was very happy with the hotel. I have stayed at alot of different hotels throughout Wakiki and found the location to be great. You may not be beachfront but its not far to walk there. This western end of wakiki is becoming alot more developed with shops and restaurants and you are located on Lewers street just off the main drag. I really enjoy these older built hotels as I find the rooms to be more generous than the newer ones. Friendly staff were more than happy to help with any enquiries. Would stay here again.

Located just steps away from the main drag in Waikiki , it was a good choice for the price if you want to be close to the action.The bright and colorful lobby had a very relaxing feel to make you just want to chill out.Tha front desk staff was also efficient in checking me in. My room was on the 6th floor, with a city view . The room was a large one, with 2 large beds and looked clean and well equipped. The bathroom was big and a huge tub too.From the reviews I read before I picked this hotel, I was aware that there was a construction site nearby, but it was right outside my balcony. Tho the view was distracting, I wasn't disturbed by any noise , as I checked in late. Overall I found my room to be satisfactory and comfortable.. I couldn't adjust the thermostat as I found it not as cool as I wanted.They do provide a basic free continental breakfast in , very light in the offerings, but it's a start to get you going.The staff was not overly friendly but helpful in booking me a shuttle to the airport.There is even a small pool to take a dip in, and the lobby does feel like an Oasis in the middle of the bustling Waikiki . So close to everything without paying the high resort rates. I found my brief stay pleasant and I would come again , but hopefully a room with a more pleasing view next time. A good deal for being close to all the shops and the famous Waikiki beach.

This was a great place to stay and centrally located in the shopping district! Also, only two blocks from the beach. My husband and I were celebrating our 25th Anniversary which started with Mardi Gras in Mobile, AL (first Mardi Gras held) then extended to Mardi Gras in Hawaii (who knew they celebrated).the room was updated, clean and functional for the price. Service was great and personable. though it was beachfront, it was only a couple of blocks from the beach and one block from the bus line and stores. The front desk and lobby had an open-air concept where they served infused water and continental breakfast. I really liked having a concierge at my disposal for touring guidance. Be sure to ask for the General Manager, Evelyn Shiroma. She had Champagne sent to our room for our Anniversary. She's the greatest!

Excellent value and service, hotel clean, friendly staff. If you don't want to drop big bucks for something closer to the beach, look here. Room had a nice balcony, and chairs to sit on. Only current issue is construction around entire building. At least they didn't start early.

The hotel staff was very FRIENDLY, THE BEST HOTEL STAFF CAME ACROSS IN A LONG TIME .the hotel room was very clean and remained that way the entire trip. the breakfast was good the hotel location is close to all the shopping centers ,boutiques and restaurants. for the price of the hotel it is a great steal and i will be returning again.
user_name:
scolbert83
New York City, New York

review_body: hotel was very nice in every way. It was very clean and had a luxurious feel to it. Ryan at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure that my stay was amazing for me and my family. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family!

Nice hotel with a central location in Honolulu close to Waikiki Beach. We got free upgrade to very nice large room with kitchenette. They've got a valet parking but cost 30 USD (O think that other hotels have it for 20) and there is also "aqua hospitality" fee for about 15 USD per room/night. Breakfast is just eggs, toast and jams...

Mike, Mark, and the girl at the front desk made our stay superb! The hotel is older but our family loved this place. Great people working here with the true Aloha spirit! We stayed for 4 nights and felt very relaxed.

I would highly recommend this hotel to those on a little bit of a budget. Hawaii is very expensive, but this is hotel is a bright spot for anyone who likes to hang onto their money. The hotel is a little dated, but it is very clean and the staff is excellent! Every interaction we had with the staff was very positive and pleasant. From our first interaction with the security guard who helped us find a good spot for our car, to the young man at the front desk who checked us in, everyone was friendly and very helpful. The parking valet attendants were always quick with getting our car (the garage is very close). $30 a night for valet parking (that is the only option here).The beach is a quick ten minute walk from the hotel. The hotel provides you with a beach towel card so you can "checkout" a towel for the day, which is very convenient. Within a block or two of the hotel you will find lots of shopping (some high-end shops on Kalakuau Ave too), many great restaurants, and bars. Overall, the area seemed very busy at night, but my wife and I did not feel unsafe at any time. The view from our room was not great. You cannot see the beach from this hotel. Directly out of our room, all we could see other hotels. However when we walked onto the balcony, you can catch a glimpse of Diamondhead crater.

How you would rate this hotel really depends on what your standards are. In my mind though it was a good deal for the price compared to other places I looked at. The Jr. suite was nice sized with a kitchen area and we had a huge balcony that ran the length of the room. You can't see the ocean or anything but it did look out over the street. The location is great if you are just want to be in Waikiki. All of the shops, restaurants and beach are all within 5-10 minute easy walk. Many of the review I read are accurate. The staff are VERY nice and friendly. We never waited more than 5 minutes for the car, never more than a minute for an elevator. The room was dated but mostly clean. We did see a couple of small bugs in the sink and bathroom but we weren't overrun with them and nothing more than I occasionally see in my own house so I didn't pay much attention to it. Definitely the best part of the room was the fancy heated toilet seat with all of the bells and whistles. Breakfast was fine if you're in a hurry or just want to save a little money but it's nothing elaborate. Pineapple, orange slices, toast and muffins and fresh coffee. The manager's reception on Friday afternoon was nice. They served complimentary fresh pineapple and champagne drinks and had a guy singing and playing guitar. The concierge was always helping someone and seemed nice but we never used the service. Our room was facing Lewers Street and it did get very loud at night. Put the ear plugs in before you go to bed and you'll be fine. That kind of noise doesn't really bother us but if you're a light sleeper you might want to be on the other side of the hotel but no guarantee it's more quite over there. I was there on business and my girlfriend came along for some R&R. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for the price.

We stayed six nights in total. The location is fantastic for such a reasonably priced hotel. One minute walk to the Main Street with restaurants and high end shopping. First two nights we stayed in room 705 which was on the seventh floor in the block nearest the sea. The room was huge. Bed very comfortable and the linens were great. Bathroom was big with a heated loo! But it was so noisy due to Moose McGilliguddys and an Irish pub being underneath so I didn't sleep too well for two nights. Full marks to Caddy Lee and Ryan for finding us a somewhat quieter room in the next block at the back facing the construction. Room 705 still on seventh floor. Yes it was quieter at least at night without the Harley's with noisy pipes and the cackling drunk women at 4am. But you are in the middle of Waikiki so it is noisy anyway. If you want quiet then I suggest you go further towards the canal. This room was a downgrade from the first room but it was almost the same size. Huge bedroom great bed good linens bathroom a bit smaller with out the heated loo! I will never understand why hotels put the air conditioner over the top of the beds. We had to keep turning it off as it was quite loud and open the sliding door to only hear the construction noise...oh well..They supply earplugs too. A ceiling fan would be a great idea. The flat screen TV was great with a selection of channels. Housekeeping was good. The staff were fantastic....full marks to them. The laundry is a great idea. Coin operated washer and dryer. Valet parking is $30 per night. Better than a parking ticket. Shuttle bus to Ala Moana is available FOC. if I was to stay again I would ask for a room on the back of the block nearest the canal. There are only two rooms that side and are much bigger than the front ones. The construction starts at 0600 so be warned. But hay get up and go for their continental brekkie and enjoy your stay.

If you are planning to stay at Waikiki and you need to do it on a budget, then the Aqua Oasis is a great place to stay. It is an older hotel, but has been updated. The rooms are a good size, and are very clean. The staff are very helpful. We would stay again.

The rooms where nice and clean and kept that way for the whole of our 9 night stay.The buffet breakfast was very good.The location IS EXCELLANT about 10 mins to beach What can I say about the staff other than being BRILLIANTalways willing to help I must not forget the ladies from Elite Conciege nothing to much trouble for them Thank you Aqua Oasis for a memorable stay

I stayed a week with my teenage children and loved the location. Very clean and fresh room, great staff and loved the free shuttle bus .There major construction going on behind the hotel which seems to be normal in Waikiki at the moment but we were out all day so by the time we got home it was quiet. I did have issues with billing at the wrong currency but it was sorted out by the lovely manager Evelyn. Loved the slightly retro vibe and it was such quick stroll to restaurants , shops and the beach ..perfect!

We were pleasantly surprised by the location of the hotel. Its proximity to the beach and the shopping center of Waikiki is an added benefit for people that are only staying in the city for a few nights. The staff we met were all friendly and accommodating - our cleaning lady Conchita was most helpful and our room was always well stocked with clean towels and toiletries. The Friday manager's reception with music was a great welcome when we arrived. The early Continental breakfast is great for those leaving for an early flight. I highly recommend this hotel.

Great location. Clisr to the beach, shopping, places to eat, including an Irish Pub & the Moose with great Mai Tai's at a reasonable price & an early happy hour. Friendly & helpful staff, comfortable beds, roomy rooms, balcony with doors & screens, a contenental breakfast, comfortable hanging bamboo chairs & reasonable rates. The only negative was the odd shaped pool, but then again the beach is a 10 minute walk away. We were tgere foe 3 nights. Woyld stay there again & highly recommend this hotel.

We spent 8 nights at the Aqua Oasis. Overall, we had a great experience. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The location is great for walking to restaurants and shopping, especially further down Lewers street. Even the beach is within walking distance. The only disadvantage to the location is the lack of ocean view, in fact our room looked at a building that looked abandoned. At least there were a couple palms next to our lanai to give it a more tropical feel. Our room was clean and comfortable with plenty of room for clothing and other stuff. There was a small table with 2 chairs, a flat screen TV, safe in the closet, and a large soaking tub with shower in the bathroom. Noise is an issue anywhere in Waikiki. We left our slider closed and the air conditioning on which was very successful in drowning out street noise. Ear plugs are also provided, but we did not need them. It would have been nice to have 2 sets of bath towels as we usually needed two showers a day between the humidity and being on the beach all day. The humidity just does not allow wet towels to try thoroughly. Our housekeeper was very friendly and did an ok job, but didn't go the extra mile like the housekeeper other family members had on another floor. A standard should be set and maintained for housekeeping services.The concierge, Sara Beth, was awesome. So friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, she was off 3 days during our stay. Mark, the valet, was another standout. He really hustled, opening and closing doors, loading bags and treating us like celebrities. At $30/day for valet parking, he made it more worth it when he was on duty.There was a complimentary continental breakfast each morning in the very comfortable clean pool area. One afternoon, at least, there was also a happy hour with snacks and complimentary mimosas.The Oasis is reasonably priced for Waikiki. We would definitely recommend it and stay there again. However, if you're in Hawaii to sit on the lanai and look at the ocean, you'll need to upgrade.

After an overnight flight from Sydney it was wonderful to arrive at the hotel and after being greeted with a lovely smile, being told our room was ready long before the official check in time. Our room was facing Lewers St but traffic noise did not worry us for the 3 nights we stayed before joining a cruise. Room was clean with adequate towels, soap and amenitiesBreakfast was basic but was enough to set us up for a few hours while we went to explore and shop, if you feel you need a bigger breakfast there are so many great places to eat within walking distance of the hotel's central location you will be spoilt for choice. The free shuttle to Ala Moana Centre is a bonus but can get very crowded at times especially the return shuttle from the centre.By and far the best part of our stay was the interaction from all of the staff, always had a smile, they were very helpful answering any questions and guiding us on the best way to travel to where we wanted to go or just having a chat.Hopefully it won't be too long before we able to return to Honolulu and this is where we will stay

this is one of our favorite place to stay, as soon as you arrive you experience the very friendly warmth and the aloha spirit from the entire staff throughout you stay, the hotel is located in the middle of the Lewer Street between Kuhio and Kalakaua Ave, if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle and prefer a quieter place to stay then this would be a perfect selection, the open lobby provide a very relaxing atmosphere (locate in the center of the hotel complex) and also a very accommodating sun deck for sun bathing instead of the beach, for those of you on the go there is a continental breakfast of fresh pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juice, Mahalo nui loa to Ryan, Miko, Michael, Mark and the entire Oasis staff for a wonderful stay and a Aloha and Ohana spirits from arrival to departure

Great staff - Mike and all of the valet parking men were cheerful and helpful. Parking although is expensive $30/day, but much cheaper than the ticket we got parking on Ala Wai blvd. Watch out, if you find a place to park, it's probably street cleaning day! The front desk attendants - really helpful and nice. Internet connection was fast. The room was clean and agreeable, but not fancy - which for the location/price is still a great deal. The bed and linens were high quality and very comfortable. Waikiki is expensive and if you want a super view, luxurious room, you will pay big bucks in the giant hotels. If you want to be close to the action in a safe, clean comfortable room in a boutique hotel and use your money for cocktails and meals on the beach, book here.

Coming off a long flight with excitement to stay in a beautiful hotel prior to our cruise, but arrived to find that they had cancelled our reservation because "a third party credit card had been denied." Overheard the same story going to other awaiting guests. We were "upgraded" by manager to get a room even though they were supposedly sold out. The room was depressing. Blood on the sheets, dirty, bland, and from the lanai we had a view of a pit. We complained and were sent to a second room on the other side of hotel. Smelled of Raid. Guess what. A view of a second pit. After much ado, we were refunded. Under no circumstances, stay here. None!

My spouse and I had a warm and welcoming stay at Aqua Oasis. The room was very clean and was equipped with everything we could need, to include a comfy bed as well. The staff was friendly and helpful, Mr. Yasu specifically stood out and went the extra mile to help us out with our stay. He was very helpful in ensuring we had a good stay and is quite knowledgeable of the local area, two thumbs up to you sir!

This a nice boutique hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. The concierge was very knowledgable. Our room was large with a kitchenette, couch, desk and a good sized bathroom. At times the shower pressure was not the best. Walking distance to the shopping areas and the beach.

After staying at the big "Disneyland" hotel down the street, it was a welcome relief to stay here for the last 2 nights of our trip. Clean rooms, nice balcony and great location! The staff was kind and attentive. Will definitely go back here!

Made a last minute reservation and didn't know much about the Oasis, but ended up having a great experience. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful. Jocelyn and Francisco got our day off to a great start every morning. Would definitely end up staying here again and recommending the place to our friends.

The staff is very attentive and friendly. Felt really welcome. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki and close to high end stores, the beach, restaurants, and popular night life. Arrived early after a long flight and the staff arranged for me to check in early. Had to switch room the following day but was upgraded to a junior suit and had a fantastic stay. Ryan and Mike keep up the good job! Breakfast could benefit from a little more variety. I really recommend staying at Aqua Oasis!

Our family spent eight days here over Christmas. When we checked in, there was another guest on the telephone to the manager explaining why he wanted to cancel his reservation. Being a little concerned, we checked in anyway and are so glad we did. We had two penthouse suites next to each other. The hallways could use some freshening up, but the rooms were great! The best things about this hotel are the staff and the location. It was only a few blocks to the beach and all of the shops and restaurants of Waikiki. A couple of nights we were able to watch the fireworks on the beach from our balcony. Since we don't like cookie cutter four star hotels, this was perfect for us. We are already making plans to go back.

Couldn't say better things about price, location and staff of this hotel!!!! I travel incessantly for work so I am pretty informed about the market. This has to be the best bargain in Honolulu. You can easily walk to every place you would want to go downtown- beach, mall, and tons of restaurants and stores. Ideal location in Honolulu. I wasnt familiar with Joy Hotels prior to coming to this one, however, based on my stay and the amazing staff, I plan on searching specifically for Joy Hotels on future trips. Rooms were comfortable and somewhat luxe for the low price. On site and free movie and game rental machine was something I have never seen in any hotel at any price. This would be especially good for a family with kids looking for ways to entertain in the evenings. Go for the kitchenette suites if possible;full kitchen and onsite laundry it will save you lots of money! Although there is some construction noise in the daytime, that is true everywhere in Honolulu given their is massive construction going on everywhere and the hotel provides u with earplugs to block it out. Best thing of all was the staff, especially Ryan at the front desk and Bellman/Valet, Mike. Ryan was cheerful and extremely helpful, never tiring of answering each and every question i had thruout my stay. Mike was kind and always attentive to the needs of every guest. This kind of service is usually impossible (in any city), to find at a hotel in this price range. I would recommend Aqua Oasis to anyone coming to Honolulu especially families!The only suggestion I would possibly make, is that they provide a soap dish in the bathroom.

The small size of the hotel creates a great feeling of hospitality that you will never find in a huge, faceless property. Everyone at the desk, the bellmen, valets and housekeepers are gracious and helpful and know you by name. Our junior suite was great: full stove, refrig., utensils, pots, microwave and dishes. Everything is spotless and new -- and just 1/2 block from the center of Waikiki & the Royal Hawaiian Center food court, 2 1/2 blocks from an excellent, not over-crowded beach. We were there for 10 days and it was great. Highly recommend it.

After checking into the hotel, I boarded the elevator to my room on the seventh floor. I exited the elevator into poorly lighted hall way, and proceeded down the hall way to my room. Upon entering my room, I was immediately overwhelmed by an odor that reeked of uncleanliness. An inspection of the room noted the following: lock on the patio door was broken, old dingy carpet, shower door was off track, stepping into the tub was most difficult and hazardous due the height of the side of the tub, refrigerator needed cleaning, HVAC was attached to the ceiling above the head of the bed (blowing air on one's head). The room as well as the rest of the hotel is old and dated, not quaint. The room needs a thorough cleaning, cosmetics, and restoration. I suspect that the hotel in general could benefit from a little TLC.The entire staff was very accommodating, friendly and kind of like tour guides. They were of tremendous assistance to our daily itinerary. The staff should be commended for their efforts in trying to make their guests stay pleasurable. However some things were not within their purview. Special kudos to Mike

Aloha reader: From the moment I step foot on the premises late evening , I felt safe! Checked in: Room to Suite upgrade, w/no additional charge: Escorted to my room, (Clean scent) w/turn down service, by an employee who Loves his job (Truly): My kitchen was well supplied w/ necessities: Continental Breakfast daily w/protein included : INCREDIBLE surroundings of Great eats/Shops/People and genuine Hospitality. I met the hotel GM (Evelyn) she gave me a tour if other rooms, again "Clean Scent", spacious equipped kitchens. Can't wait to return. Evelyn, you and your team were a pleasant surprise! I cannot thank you all enough for looking after me, in ways unexpected. LOVE seeing the Fireworks from my Balcony ~Many Mahalos~ Peace

Although this hotel is rated at 4 stars, I definitely disagree. As we walked into the room we could smell a bad odor. We assume the smell came from the carpet. Taking a tour around the room we found:-holes in the door-the walls were dirty-the patio door did not lock-we were in a junior suite, there were no additional bedding (there should be a blanket in the closet)-we could tell a child spent some time in the room because there are stickers left on the desk-broken iron

All started when we got off the elevator to a dark hallway. The room had an bad ordor when entering. The bathtub is constucted as such, "accident waiting to happen" Disappointing breakfast. Dirt marks on walls especially the bathroom door. Refrigerator had strain of hair in it. Considering the update of hotel in 2014 it is out dated. Pictures on internet misleading However the staff were very friendly, accommodating and tried to work with us. Should be rated as a 2 star hotel.

This hotel was a surprisingly good deal close to the beach and the main shopping. For a three star hotel it was a very comfortable clean and friendly hotel. Special thanks to the staff at the front desk Rosie, Harold, Jocelyn and Sherwin. We would recommend this hotel to family and friends.Erik, Auckland, New Zealand

Stayed here for a few weeks while my baby was in the hospital- I'm from Maui. Really cute hotel with great service, felt comfortable. Also a convenient location. Staff was awesome. Definitely recommend. I give it 5 stars all around. I also stayed at the aqua Waikiki pearl and that place is a 1 star next to the aqua oasis. The aqua pearl sucked. Service was HORRIBLE TO SAY THE LEAST. Rooms were ugly and out dated and smelled bad. Unlike the oasis WICH is nicely renovated and has a huge bath tub and balcony. Both hotels a little noisy... But didn't bother me that much

If you are looking for a great boutique hotel - quiet and friendly and in a great location.- this is the place for you.  The staff aim to please- a great place for couples or family!  We keep coming back - excellent location, excellent value, a great place.  Jerry and Evie

The Valet welcomed us and helped us get the luggage upstairs. He then parked the car on site. It never took more than a few minutes to retrieve it. Check in was smooth. Check out was a little more complicated with a heavy rain falling. The counter was covered with a tarp. Finding room for all the bags of those leaving was a problem. Breakfast featured fresh pineapple and juice. We loved the koi pond. My husband managed a dip in the small pool. We loved our room and did not need the ear plugs at all, but a nice touch. Prices were very reasonable. Great location for a walk on the beach, shopping or catching the tour trollies.

My family checked in 21 Nov, and check out by 26 Nov. The Manager there is very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and nice! The valet parking is good managed too, thanks Mike! It is an amazing trip to Honolulu with my family. GOOD HOTEL WITH GOOD SERVICE~!!!

We were very happy with our accommodations here. We were greeted by Cheney (sp?) And mark and always felt welcome. Room was nice, spacious and clean. Location was excellent; minutes from the beach and located close to a multitude of restaurants. Some of the lower rooms have noise during the night, presumably from a first floor karaoke, which the rest of the family slept thru. The first room we had was on the top floor and had a loud rumbling noise from the ac. They were more than happy to move us to a quieter larger room. Thanks again aqua oasis for a pleasant stay in Honolulu.

I've been a regular visitor of Honolulu and have stayed in places such as Sheraton Waikiki, Outrigger on the Beach, The Illikai and a few others which charge premium rates to be right on the beach but this hotel is now my go to accommodation.
