This place is in a fantastic spot - a 3 min stroll to the beach, shops only a minute walk away and our room was super clean and spacious.The room views are either of the street or a car park, but this was not an issue for us as we are always out and about and don't go to Hawaii to look at a view from a hotel room! As for the staff - they are all amazing and were so accommodating to our group of 11 travelers. No request was too hard to accommodate to (we had a few issues with late arrivals and 3 day delayed flights) and there were too many great experience with these guys to list - by the end we truly made some life long Hawaiian friends... It can get noisy on a weekend (earplugs are provided) but we were too exhausted by the end of the night to notice the noise but if you are a light sleeper - request for a higher floor room. If your after a home away from home / boutique style hotel with personal service then this is your place! Mahalo :)

Wow what a great little 3* hotel right in the heart of everything Waikiki has to offer. Walking distance to everything you want, beach, restaurants and bars. Staff were amazing right from check in through to check out. Channy on reception was excellent in recommending places to go. General Manager Evelyn is one of the nicest, friendliest people you will meet! Continental breakfast was great for a quick bite to eat before running out, boiled eggs, toast, muffins, juice & coffee were all available.Amenity fee included access to DVD rentals in the lobby area, excellent for families wanting to go back to the hotel for the evening after a long day and watch a movie. Stayed in Junior Suite with Kitchen, room was huge and the bathroom a great size. Will definitely be back to stay.

We had a wonderful stay at Aqua Qasis.The staff are so friendly and willing to help. The room we had was very big 801 corner. King size bed was very comfortable, and a large sofa bed. Kitchenette with hotplates and microwave and a full size fridge and coffee maker. Bathroom was also big with an oval bath with shower above. Room serviced daily. Balcony was great with small table and chairs and a lounge chair. Breakfast was very good. Elevator and a laundry. Walk to Waikiki beach and shops. Pool.
user_name:
Gail P
Australian Capital Territory, Australia

review_body: Please one night stay however watch out for the hidden maintenance fee of $15. Personally, they should advice that there is such a fee. Appears misleading and cunning. Otherwise, the hotel room was adequate. Due to noise they do provide ear plugs.

My Husband, Daughter and I had the pleasureOf staying at your property Nov.4th. We were greeted by a Wonderful Employee, by the Name Tiki. He was pleasant! His smile was warm and welcoming! He greeted us, with the old world Hospitality of the Honolulu my husband and I first visited the first time in 1978. Our stay was also very pleasant! The hotel room was large very clean, with a kitchenette! I must also mention the very pleasant bellman, who held our bags after checking out, and called us a cab

this hotel is very close to the main strip and shopping. There is also a nice walkway to the public beach close by and an airport shuttle also a mall shuttle to the outlets can be arranged here.Nothing bad to say about this place. PS3 in the room for dvd which is free to rent from downstairs if raining (yes it rains here).

We booked our room here in January for an October/November stay so I was a bit concerned to see some recent negative reviews but we were very pleasantly surprised! The room we had was clean and spacious (we went for the most basic option, no upgrades etc) and the hotel was well located for the beach/shops. They ran a free shuttle to the mall and arranged our bus to both the outlet mall and the airport with little hassle and for a good price. Staff were also helpful and friendly. They had a travel rep in the foyer who helped book tickets for a boat tour and give us some recommendations which was also useful. I do think the resort fee was a bit pricey for just beach towels and wifi, but all the hotels charge this so it was hard to avoid. There was some building work beside the hotel which is mentioned in other reviews but it was barely audible from the 7th floor so I would recommend a high room! The view also isn't great, but given how close we were to the beach then this wasn't important to us!

last minute booking for us over christmas and new year. We didn't know what to expect and we were pleasantly surprised. Its not your glam hotel but it ticked all the boxes. Very casual hotel, bordering on too casual. Maybe a tad expensive compared to other hotels. But you only live once. So thumbs up for this one.

This was a great little hotel and we would stay again on a return visit to Oahu. It was so close to everything and all who worked there were so lovely. Waikiki beach is very close and the main street for shopping is even closer. The shuttle bus to Ala Moana is very helpful also! The breakfast was exactly what we were after. We traveled with two teenagers so booked a junior suite with kitchenette. This was was a fantastic space because it had two doubles and a sofa bed so suited us really well. Absolutely recommend the Aqua Oasis!

Stayed here mid July with family- 2 adults and three older children. Family room was Ok, not great. Lot of noise from adjacent building plot. Airco hard to regulate and caused some discomfort. Complimentary breakfast is quite terrible: a few pieces of toast, some eggs, and coffee / tea. After 9:30 it is gone. Swimming pool is 2x2 meter, but waikiki at walking distance

Stayed here for 4 nights. It's good value as it is located in an excellent location. Would not recommend the breakfast however as there are limited selections and those that can be selected are not so tasty. The pool is too small to be of any use except for maybe children. The shuttle to Ala Moana is very useful as it leaves every 20 minutes on the hour and comes back every 45 minutes on the hour. It can be loud at night, especially on the weekends so please request a back room.

We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and enjoyed a spacious mini-apartment with balcony, close to everything in Waikiki. From arrival to departure, the staff were helpful and friendly. The unit was clean and bedding was good, and the bonus was a self serve light breakfast each day.The only downside was some intermittent noise from the street at night, although it did not bother us and we did not need to use the earplugs provided in the room.

We recently stayed at the Aqua Oasis, Lewers St Waikiki and were very happy! One block from Main Street & about 2 blocks to the beach. Easy walk to restaurants & ABC shops. We stayed in a Junior suite on the 7th Floor & the room was huge! Free wifi & a continental brekkie of toast, pastries, boiled eggs, juice & fruit available every morning in the lobby. Check in was easy! Laundry facilities a bonus! Small pool but refreshing enough! Great value for money. No beach views but they weren't necessary for us

It's always unfair on hotels when people write reviews of smaller, budget type hotels with a sense of disappointment based upon some grander ideal or expectation. Though the Aqua Oasis is a stones throw from Louis Vetton and other high class retail establishments in Waikiki, it does not pretend to cater for that clientele. There is a reason it was reasonably priced, especially considering it convenient location.All that said, Aqua Oasis is nothing more - or less - than you'd expect. It's simple, basic, clean and friendly.Ratings that compare it to more prestigious than this are ludicrous, and what would be considered three star average for the Hilton (and therefore disappointing) is perfectly adequate for a short stay. What's more; if you are disappointed by the room, or lack of 5-star restaurant etc. you should spend less time here and more time enjoying the reason you came to Waikiki in the first place.

The staff is very attentive and pleasant. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki and close to high end stores, the beach, restaurants, mini-stores, buses, and trolleys. The rooms were very clean.

We stayed here for 4 days after a graduation. We had never been to Honolulu. Our hotel is on a small street with no parking, Parking in our rental was $50/day. We were supposed to have 2 beds and had only one, not great for 3 people. We could see the ocean, which was a plus, however, the hotel has an alley with an adult shop near by, so we could hear the customers who were loud, we could also hear a nearby restaurant which had a live DJ and lots of noise from the crowd until the wee hours. Then the construction zone directly behind the hotel began at 7am. The water pressure was terrible, and not much warm water. Had to unplug the toilet as the seat would randomly heat up and it wasn't comfortable. Very small pool, just slightly bigger than a hot tub. The elevator broke, and they had a sign on the first floor only. So we waited and waited, and finally had to walk down the stairs. When we told them, they pointed to the sign. I said that might be helpful on the other floors and maybe telephoning the guests. They didn't seem to care.Beach is withing a 1/4 walking distance, you have to cross a busy street and walk through tourist with all your gear to get to the beach. If I go back, I would stay at a hotel on the beach it would be worth the money.

Location of this hotel is great! Within walking distance you get to all points of interest.Room & bed was comfy. Staff friendly.Sadly lanai was facing a construction side. Breakfast was poor (consists of toast, jam, butter, coffee, 2 sweet bread, hard boiled egg). WLAN week.

Arrived at 12:30pm and was promptly given a room by the friendly receptionist. Hotel had suitable ingredients for an international business traveller who would be out most of the day - around $150 per night, central location and good wifi (they assigned a unique password for each of my 4 devices). As I was travelling alone, room size was not an issue. No nocturnal decibel issues either. A discernable smell hit me upon entering the room, but it did not pose problems. Pool size is definitely not in the league of resorts. Breakfast, as many have written, is basic and in a cramped environment (thank goodness I'm not a breakfast person!). Shopping-wise, this is a great area for after office hours retail therapy, since most shops close at 11pm. ABC stores close slightly later. The luxurious DFS galleria is round the corner on the next street. A couple of farmers markets around. The complimentary shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Center was much appreciated. When I asked reception about airport taxis, I felt they could have advised me about Charley's $29 flat fee taxi rate, which I eventually discovered through my own investigation.

I booked this hotel for two nights in January for our stay in September. I was pleased to get an email from the hotel, the day before our arrival, welcoming us to Honolulu. After a long day of touring Honolulu, my family was excited to arrive at our hotel. We were looking forward to freshening up and then hitting the streets to shop and get dinner. The hotel was in a great location to make this easy for us traveling with a three year old. We were quickly disappointed to discover the hotel no longer had our room (that had already been paid for the two nights) and it was only 5:30 in the evening. The front desk gentleman said the hotel was sold out. After a small discussion the desk clerk offered to put us up in a different hotel several blocks away (dinner/shopping options no longer so easy) and asked our tour guide, who was dropping us off from our tour, if he would mind taking us to our new hotel. WHAT??? Needless to say, the hotel did pay our cab fare to our new hotel and the new hotel was an upgrade from this one. My complaint is the situation should have been handled differently. First, our paid room should never have been given away. Second, we should of been notified of the situation BEFORE we arrived at our hotel. Third, we attempted twice to reach the manager and both times were told he was not available and he has not tried to contact us. I do not recommend booking this hotel because the room isn't guaranteed.

I stayed in Hawaii for two months this summer for work. I transferred to the Aqua Oasis after a horrible experience at another discount hotel. The Aqua Oasis was everything I wanted at a bargain price. The hotel is very clean and has a very helpful and friendly staff. This hotel also has a great location. It is a half block away from high end shopping on Kalakaua Ave and only two blocks from the beach. A perfect location considering the price.

The Aqua Oasis is not an upscale hotel, but the good news is it does not come at an upscale price. It is a small boutique hotel, very compact in design. The rooms are small but adequate, nicely maintained. The rooms offer no view of anything decent. The lobby is compact but pleasant. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Less than a 5 minute walk to the Waikiki beach. Valet parking (only parking available) was efficient, and cost $30/day. Very nice and helpful concierge in the lobby. This may be the best bargain in the Waikiki area considering that the other hotels in the area seem to run at least $100 or more per day.The drawbacks start with the breakfast. It was the most meager offering I have ever seen at a hotel-included breakfast. It consisted of hard boiled eggs, bread and rolls, not-very-good pineapple, pineapple juice from a can, and coffee. That's it. No cold cereal, no hot offerings. In addition, there were not nearly enough tables to handle the breakfast crowd even though there was plenty of room to add more tables. People were standing waiting for tables to open up, or sitting in the lobby trying to eat in the lounge chairs at coffee tables. Some people did not clean their dishes from the tables as is normally done in this type of setting, and there was no staff to clean the tables, so on some tables the dishes had piled up considerably with people trying to push them aside to make room to eat. My wife used the washing machines. One of them only produced hot water no matter what it was set on. The desk staff had to come over and fill the machine from a garden hose to get cold water. The washing machine area was dirty and not kept up. The bathtub area in our room had mildew and/or mold growing which is inexcusable.Be aware that in addition to the quoted cost for the room which for us was $141.30 per day, other charges, $30 for parking, $13.07 for one tax and $6.66 for another, and a hospitality fee of $15, will make your actual bill considerably more.All things considered, the Aqua Oasis is a bargain in that area of Waikiki. I am ambivalent about whether I would stay there again. I guess I would see if I could find other hotels that would be similar bargains in that area that would be at least as good, and if I could not find ones, I would probably default back to the Aqua Oasis.

We booked this boutique hotel for a week during our visit to Hawaii in September of 2015. The lobby is open air with a tropical appeal. The hosts are courteous and observant to the needs of the guests. Our junior suite was large and very comfortable. All rooms seem to be of adequate size. There was minimal noise even though we were in the heart of town. All of the presumed amenities are provided. Continental breakfast each morning offered the opportunity to meet with other guests who appeared to be of an international crowd. We enjoyed the hospitality of our hosts and appreciated the cleanliness and size of the accommodations. We have recommended this establishment to several others traveling to the Islands.

Location was great with easy access to everything, staff were fantastic, rooms were clean and spacious (junior suite). Couple of Irish pubs on the same street so could occasionally get a bit noisy at night. Breakfast was included but was quite basic. Pool was small but only down the road from the beach so didnt need it. Wifi in the room was great. Overall we would stay there again because of the great price and central location.

Planned the day before, this hotel was affordable on price line, but oh surprise,, when you get there two more fees have to be paid, resort fee and parking,,total 45 extra dollars per night. The hotel is small and outdated, no digital TV but free movie rentals thru a machine similar to red box is given to you upon arrival, bed was nice and comfortable, the pillows not so much, small, very small and only 4. No extra Blankets or sheets in the room, has a safe, a ironing board and hair dryer, small fridge and coffee maker, room was clean, street view was not pretty at all, breakfast buffet very basic, pineapple juice, toast, hard boiled eggs and muffins, coffee and water as well, 2 blocks from the beach, nice walk, very nice shopping and restaurant choice near by, over all, an ok hotel for the money if u don't expect much. Staff is friendly and helpful, the bathroom is big and with regular amenities and sufficient towels, beach towels are also available upon request. There is a play station in the room so you can watch the movies u get for free, easy access to the freeways, no free parking anywhere near the hotel. Have fun and enjoy.

I have been to Honolulu multiple times and I always like to stay somewhere different each time.I booked the junior suite as due to the location of this hotel I could afford a larger room compared to the "view" rooms at other hotels.There is a shuttle which takes you to the Ala Moana shopping centre which is free , free dvd hire. free beachtowels for those just mentioned you receive a card and simply prsent it at reception for towels and swipe it in the machine to hire dvds.The pool area is very nice and the pool is an adequate size but is 6ft deep.The continental breakfast leaves a lot to be desired although included in my room rate I chose to pay for breakfast elsewhere.The choice was toast, orange juice and muffins/danish. There was no cold meats , cheese , fruit or cereal to choose nor was there any jams or spreads that I noticed.I would consider staying here again however the $15 per day resort fee is expensive when all that is covered is the breakfast , towels, and a shuttle bus surely you can pay for movies if you want them.There is a pub two doors down called Moose McGillycuddy's - Great food, good prices, As this hotel is in Lewers st it is central to everything

Old hotel with service of 2 stars even if it is in a good position. The rooms are small, so better to book a suite with kit che. In the normal room there is no space for the suitcases. Badroom is old in all rooms.The breakfast is included but it is served in the lobby where people pass to go outside or taking the elevator. Low choice of food and not enough space for all the people in the hotel. The parking of the hotel costs 30 dollars but They park your car on the street, not in a sicure parking. During the night it is impossible to sleep. You can hear everything on the street and the disco music in the bar close to the hotel.

Staff was very friendly and accommodating! Michael the valet guy was AWESOME! Went above and beyond to make our stay great! Great location and rooms are really nice! If you are looking for a view we didn't have much of one but this hotel rocks!!! I used to live here and so miss the Aloha! 5 min walk to beach if you really want to deal with Waikiki beach. Will definitely stay here again!! Loved it! We stayed August 20-25 after spending 6 days on the windward side. ---michelle and mom linda from Chicago

My wife and I had to fly home to take care of some estate affairs and we decided to get a hotel. Aside from the lack of parking (valet only), this was a great hotel with a great location. Less than half a block from downtown Waikiki and numerous shuttle buses to different attractions. The room was very clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We would book a room here again for sure!

We loved staying at the Aqua Oasis! The staff was awesome! The breakfast was good. Our room was cleaned daily and beds made and clean towels.... and we even had an awesome gentleman named Mike who handled our vehicle with care for Valet. Mike went above and beyond to make sure our vehicle was ready every morning so my husband was not late to work! Thanks Mike!

This is not that expensive but the room has a huge size for me to walk around. Specially when i checked in, the valet person Stephen was every polite and helpful. And the housekeeping staff are friendly.( I don't really remember their names but Everlyn, rowellyn, rossy, Michelle, conchita and then.) They treat me special and as i entered to my room i have a 2 hawaiian macadamia chocolate in my bed that makes me feel so welcomed. (That's sweet). Feels like home amd neat. Good job. I wanna come back soon.

The hotel is great, central location, close to main shopping strip - the other end of Lewers Street has a great mix of shops, only a relatively short walk to the beach. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful, highly recommended! A daily resort fee (per room) of US$15 covers breakfast, wifi and free shuttle bus.

As one traveller says, if you want a nice hotel close to the beach and not wanting to pay 5-star price, this is the one to go for. The hotel is just behind the main shopping street and 5 minutes' walk from Waikiki. Aqua Oasis is by no means luxurious, but very functional, clean and homely. The guestrooms are well-appointed, large in size with nice balcony and bathroom, and so airy that there is not even the need to put the aircon on at night with the balcony doors open. The breakfast is simple but adequate, and well servied to be enjoyed at the open patio on the ground floor next to the pool. Reception staff are friendly, helpful and always carrying a nice smile characteristic of the Hawaiin hospitality.The price? Awesome. With a large party, we negotiated a very bargain price of $140 per room (all inclusive). You can't get anything better than anywhere else close to Waikiki!

This hotel is great.It is so close to everything very unassuming hotel. But don't be fool it is great.The staff friendly and willing to help out.The check in uncomplicated and quick.The rooms clean. The bathroom also clean and works well.Hotel breakfast good start to the morning. The variety okay don't expect too much and you will like it.The location its a block from the main street. Easy walk to everything.There is a small pool. But it isn't the pool one goes there for.There is a free paper, free movies if you want to get one. Can't see why.We are in Hawaii.An ice machine. And continues cold lemon water as you walk in. Very refreshing. There is a hotel restaurant they offer discounts on in house guests. We loved the food and service.If you want to be so close to everything and want to don't pay 5 star prices. Go there. With a down size. I would stay there again.

The hotel's location is great. It is not at the beach but in a small side street where it is quiet at night, and you reach restaurants and shopping centers and the beaches within a few minutes by foot. The staff (at the reception and the room maids in particular) is super friendly and helpful - a big thank you to Big Mike at the entrance who assisted us when ever needed! Rooms are spacious and clean, beds are super comfortable!Great WLAN connectivity

The hotel is well located and very convenient for shopping. Staff are friendly and helpful. Free breakfast. Room size is OK, facilities are not new but acceptable.The only thing I don't like is the valet parking. However considering parking space is so expensive and precious in this area, they are not overcharging at all.

We had a great time. Very courteous staff and awesome service. Valet parking is very quick. Morning breakfast is good. Very central location with walking distance to beach. Junior suite is very spacious and we liked free DVD program. Location is in populated area but not too far from any point of interest.

I stayed here with my Mum and brother in July. I was impressed with the central location of this hotel to the beach, food, shops and nightlife. I had an unfortunate incident where I lost my engagement ring while on holiday and without the amazing and endless help of the staff, I wouldn't of had a successful search and have it returned home! The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. Highly recommend staying here.

The Aqua Oasis hotel is all about value. Although it may not have all the perks of the big name places like Trump and Hilton, you cannot beat the value you get at this hotel. The service is quality, the rooms are solid, and the price is unbeatable. I stayed here for almost 6 weeks on a work trip and they were the only hotel to work with me on a price that was within my per diem. I was willing to stay just about anywhere in Waikiki, but I would argue that they have one of the better locations in the entire area. It is just two blocks from the beach, right across the street from a giant mall with a large food court, and within walking distance of just about everything in Waikiki. My room was always kept in great condition by Angelita, and the front desk staff were always greeting me every time I walked by. My only two (minor) complaints about the hotel would be: 1- there is no gym, so you if want to workout you have to go to an actual gym in the city. This was OK for me since I had a car, but it would have been much more difficult if I had to walk. 2- The breakfast selection is very minimal and gets boring after a couple days. The choices are toast, boiled eggs, pineapple and a pastry. If they charged a few extra dollars for a greater variety I would have been happy to pay the cost. Other than that, this hotel was great and met all of my business needs. The wifi worked perfectly the entire time (something that would be a dealbreaker for me) and the A/C was more than sufficient for long days on the phone. I would highly recommend this hotel for people that want to be in a great location in Waikiki, but do not want to pay the exorbitant prices of the big name hotels. What they lack in amenities, they make up for in service and value.

Hotel staff from beginning to end were great. Room we stood in was clean with modern decor. We were able to see the fireworks from our balcony. Very close to all; just steps to shopping and the beach. Price was reasonable.

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Oasis for a few days. We had an okay experience.Pros: The location was great. We could walk to the major shopping centers and to the beach within 5-10 minutes. If you want to go anywhere further, the bus line is really close. The people at the front desk are very nice and helpful.Cons: It's in the heart of Waikiki so expect lots of tourists and tourist prices. The room itself was average. We had to request a microwave. The view from our balcony was of construction which was a major bummer. We had to call maintenance to our room because the towel racks and toilet paper holder kept falling down. The continental breakfast was a joke. They offered canned pineapple juice, toast, and prepackaged muffins. Also, it's offered outside so birds often go into the food. And there's no one around to keep them away.Overall, the hotel was just ok. The location is far better than the rooms. If you are looking for a great hotel experience, look elsewhere.

The Aqua Oasis is conveniently located within comfortable walking distance to the numerous high-end boutiques at Waikiki, and also the beach itself. The hotel staff were generally helpful and friendly.Although the rooms are quite spacious and clean, the facilities are fairly basic and probably a bit over-priced. Our 5th floor room overlooked a large building site, with concrete trucks and a drilling rig operating - possibly a temporary situation, but worth checking. We noted the ear-plugs provided, but thankfully did not have to make use of those. The pool is very small, but probably OK for young children.

Conveniently located! Easy access to restaurants, shopping and the beach!Hotel room was very nice and clean, thanks to our wonderful housekeeper Rebbeca! The amenities, specially the continental breakfast offered was excellent!Wonderful staff, everyone was very helpful and always pleasant. Will definitely stay here again! Thank you Aqua Oasis for taking great care of us!

When we arrived no one from the hotel was there to greet us or help with the suitcases, that was disappointing.The hotel itself is located in a very convenient and central area. Everything you need is within walking distance. Especially the beach. There are buses to use which only cost $2.50. The hotel rooms are nice and clean. Not enough closet space for us since we stayed for nine nights. The people at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was a nice added bonus. Ther is a very small pool and not enough sitting space for anyone who needs to wait in the lobby. At the time of our stay there was construction going on so the noise level was disturbing at times. Recommend this hotel

Good location, an easy walk to Waikiki's shopping strip the Aqua Oasis provided us with a great home away from home for nine nights. Clean and recently renovated our family was pleased with our rooms; a standard room for the kids and a one bedroom suite for the parents which gave us plenty of room. The bathroom in the suite was extra large, king size bed very comfortable. There was a lack of wardrobe space, after unpacking we had to drape our clothing over our luggage. Breakfast was basic but adequate. A couple of bars on the same block made for some noisy late nights and the 5am garbage pick up was a little annoying however hardly the fault of the hotel. I made use of the complimentary earplugs on the night stand. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly especially Mike, Harold and the lovely Rosie & Rowelyn. A big plus was the shuttle bus to Ala Moana mall which we made good use of! A good place to stay.

Really enjoyed our stay at Aqua Oasis. Good location with walking distance to Waikiki beach, variety of restaurants and bus stops around the area. I would like to give 2 thumbs up for the hospitality, friendliness and service by their staff. The Front Desk team (Mike, Jasmine and one Filipino staff) even gave us suggestions/tips on how to better explore the island and experience the best Luau show during our stay. We find them really helpful and indeed enjoyed our vacation. The room was also nice, clean and comfortable. Angelita from housekeeping always keeps it clean and she even left us complimentary cookies for snacks. Overall, great service and good value for money. Will definitely stay here again if we get the chance to visit Hawaii.

Just perfect. Hospitality,friendliness and courtesy. Nice place to stay.Channy at the reception is very friendly,nice and makes your stay pleasant with all her advice. Dexter is also very friendly.As regards the structure there are no particular negative to mention.As many have written of possible external noise due to nightlife.Honestly we did not bother us at all. I was also a room on the back side of the road where the evening felt well and I could catch sight the Hard Rock Cafe. At the beginning it is assumed that the parking of $ 30 a night is expensive, but absolutely worth it and after all is well, if not cheaper, than others in the area.Unfortunately at Waikiki find a parking spot is a fortune. This Hotel offers different services and things available. We recommend it fully. If I was to return to Oahu, definitely I stay there again. The small negative thing is breakfast: the choice is limited, but the problem is that unless you arrive early in the morning, then it runs the risk of not finding nothing or very little available.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Oasis. The location and service are excellent. The room and bathroom were large, clean, and comfortable. Truly a great value. We would definitely stay here again. We also enjoyed the little Korean restaurant around the corner.

We stayed here on the first leg of a 14 day trip to Hawaii for our 20th Anniversary. It is a very nice hotel in the center of everything in Honolulu. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but were busy going to Waikiki Beach, Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, etc.Con's-- We arrived on a Thursday and traffic was CRAZY! We couldn't find out where to park and driving around the block took almost 30 min! Finally I parked in front of the hotel and went to the front desk to ask where the valet guy was! They only had one!We found ants in our kitchen and they stayed with us the entire 3 days we stayed despite telling the front desk on 2 separate occasions.WiFi was terrible- I complained repeatedly about the poor WiFi in our room and they finally refunded the resort fees.Pro's- Reasonable rates, clean rooms, well decorated. They gave earplugs in the rooms but we never heard any sounds at night.Staff very friendly and willing to help. Plenty of places to eat and shop nearby within walking distance. 2 General stores nearby for groceries.The breakfast was free which is why I gave it a "Pro" however most Americans would find it lacking. Basically some fruits and bread.Overall a great hotel if you are looking to save some money on a nice hotel that isn't on the beach but is within walking distance to everything!

When we first arrived at The Aqua Oasis (6/17/15 at around 3:00pm) we were greeted by the nicest guy! He made us feel welcomed right away. Once he found out we were in Hawaii to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary he sent chocolates, champagne, and cookies to our room! He even sent extra water bottles since I'm pregnant and can't drink. It was so thoughtful. The rooms were nice enough. Clean, well-kept, and comfortable beds. They also have a play station 3 in the rooms and a DVD box (similar to red box) in the lobby where you can rent movies. These services are included in the hospitality fee. So take advantage of it! There is also a small pool. The breakfast was small. It consisted of toast, muffins, fruit, some pastry choices, and beverages. But it was still tasty. You can tell that the employees are making a strong effort to make the Aqua Oasis the place to stay. Throughout our stay every time we ran into an employee, they were friendly and always struck up a conversation with us. And it is a great location! Everything is just a short walk away. We never once had to take a taxi. Overall, this was an awesome place to stay. I would recommend it to anyone! If we ever go back to Hawaii, this is where we will stay! Thank you to everyone at Aqua Oasis!!

The best location ever! One block from excellent shopping, two blocks from Waikiki beach. The rooms and facilities were outstanding. The staff were wonderful, Channy-Lynn, Mike and Jasmine just to name a few. No trouble for them to assist with your transport arrangements/tours either. i Would absolutely recommend Aqua Oasis 100%

We stayed at the Aqua Oasis 6-11 to 6-15. As we did not rent a car we caught a shuttle from the airport, we rode on the Speedieshuttle and the cost roundtrip was $59.00 for two, arrangements for return pick up were taken care of at the time of our original pick up. Trip advisor needs a stand alone category for public transportation, shuttle service and cabs as we had a difficult time getting reviews of local services. Our driver was an incredibly nice guy and made the trip to the hotel very enjoyable and informative. It is not a direct trip to the hotel but made stops at four different hotels in Waikiki, all the hotels are fairly close so it did not take long for us to get to the hotel. We were a little early for check in so the front desk secured our bags and we went out for a bite to eat. There are numerous places to eat nearby, priced for all budgets. What we found is that is that we could expect to pay at least $25.00 for the two of us plus the tip for burgers and fries, or a simple breakfast of eggs bacon and toast and coffee. It did not seem to matter how simple the meal was, it was $25.00 average. We were checked in ahead of schedule and retired to Room 415 it was a street side room and indeed did have earplugs on the night stand for our convenience, we had no issues during our stay with street noise, club noise or noise in general. The room itself was a decent size and the bed was very comfortable (firm) and had a variety of pillows (4). The room had a more than adequate air conditioner, it was mounted over the bed which seemed different but it kept the room more than cool enough. The room had a small table with two chairs and a large closet with plenty of hangers, the only thing that may have been lacking was drawer space. We had a small balcony that had two chairs and a small table on it. We spent little to no time out there but it was nice to have. Regarding the bathroom it had more than enough towels and was well supplied with soap, shampoo and conditioner, it was very well lit. I never broached the subject of the shortcomings of the bathroom with the manager during our stay I covered them in a survey that I completed when we returned home, had I pointed these things out as I discovered them I would have expected that they be remedied but as it was we could live with it as it was. The towel rack was about to come down and the toilet paper holder was less than secure. The bath tub was huge but the finish was chipped, It just was not too attractive, some of the caulked joints around the tub were suffering from some mildew not a huge amount but noticeable. The ring around the recessed light that was in the area of the tub was only partially secured and the ceiling was in need of a good coat of paint. Now if I was paying the rate I paid for this room in Des Moines, Iowa I would have expected a lot more for my money but in all honesty considering the location of the Aqua Oasis which was within 1/2 mile of Waikiki Beach I think this hotel at the rate we paid was a very good bargain. Price what other hotels are charging, our room was worth what they were charging. In addition the hotel had a modest breakfast available, and good coffee! Beach towels and lounge chairs were also available. We found the staff to be polite and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

I recently stayed at the newly revamped Aqua Oasis during my mini vacation. My stay was nothing short of amazing! I was impressed right from the begining - from the warm greeting during arrival, to the the short distance walk to the beach ( less than 10 minutes walk!) to how clean and well equiped the hotel is. The staff is genuinely friendly and helpful. The room was well kept and spacious. There is definitely no doubt that I will be staying there again during my future visits.

Stayed for 8 nights in a Junior Suite with kitchenette. 4 adults. Room was spacious, 2 queen sized beds which were very comfy, living area, kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker and fridge. Bathroom was large with a shower over a small oval bath. Also had a balcony overlooking the street, no ocean views.Free breakfast was served downstairs in the lobby every day consisting of toast, cereal, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, tea, coffee juice and pastries.Staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. Free wifi and the location of the hotel was perfect, close to all of the shops and only a block away from Waikiki beach. They also have a free shuttle to Ala Mona shopping centre.I would highly recommend this small hotel, for the price paid it was fantastic.

This is a smaller hotel with lots to offer. Beds are very comfy, decent view, located near 2 popular bars, across the street from trolley station, free cont. brkfst,pool, amazing staff, I would stay again. They also offer free shuttle!

Free breakfast was a plus! The room was clean had a cool view. The staff was friendly and helpful free wifi. They also had messages at the hotel! It was a great way to relax on our vacation. Surfing is only 2 blocks away and so is the duke statue.

Aloha! Just to inform everyone that our stay in Oasis, a Joy Hotel is really an awesome place. The location is very perfect to all amenities and the hotel has to offer especially the 6-9 yummy continental breakfast, free shuttle bus going to Ala Moana and also the free rental DVD for new movies, etc. We are really grateful to have staff that assisted and accommodated us during our stay. These beautiful people are Evelyn S, Flora, Chris, Michael, Evelyn P and Rebecca.Mahalo for everything and we will go back again for next year 2015. P. S. Could you please add papaya on the continental breakfast?

Our stay at this hotel was fabulous!! We came in from Atlanta and our flight was long. Our check-in was smooth and quick and our room was clean and cozy. Michael Preddy was "greatest" help anyone could ever ask for! EVERYTHING was absolutely marvelous!!! Great shopping area too!!

After a long flight we arrive at the hotel and check in expecting somebody to be there to assist my Family and I with our several heavy bags but to our surprise nothing.. The receptionist see's us and doesn't seem to care that we are struggling and tired. So we manage to drag all our bags on our own to this tiny elevator which we require to do two trips in because its so small. We finally arrive in our room tired and exhausted instantly noticing cockroaches on the kitchen wall then to top it all off we unfold the fold out couch to discover the mattress is merely a double instead of a queen as posted in the description! Being so tired my girlfriend and I just try to put up with and get through the night on the very uncomfortable tiny bed(im 5'6" on a good day and my feet were over hanging!). To add to our already terrible sleep we are woken at around 3 in the morning to the sound of the elevator which was so loud it sounded as though it was in the room.First thing in the morning we head to reception in attempt to sort out the bed situation as the bed was unbearably uncomfortable and small. We speak to the lady and ask if she can assist us with changing the bed or possibly changing rooms but she was unable to do anything besides offering us pay for an extra room almost $500 extra on top of the already $1200 we paid for 4 nights. We kindly refused the offer and asked to speak to a manager in hope to organize something more suitable. Almost 4 hours later we finally get a call from the manager to come discuss the situation and we head down to see the manager to explain the situation. He sends maintenance to have a look at the bed and returns saying there's nothing wrong with it. We say this isn't good enough and ask if an alternate arrangement and he instantly began to be arrogant and rude towards my dad and I. Then he began to say there was no other rooms available and nothing he can do even though the receptionist told us earlier there were. We explain the bed isn't what we paid for and very uncomfortable instead of being sympathetic he is arguing with us and saying there isn't anything wrong it with an arrogant smile on his face even asking the maintenance guy in front of us what size the bed to belittle us.In the end we asked for a refund which he was happy to do because he'd rather put us on the street then help us with our issue. Almost ruined our family holiday in Hawaii luckily we found something alternate on such short notice. This management needs to be run by someone who understands the customer service industry and has respect for its guests its giving both Aqua Hotels and Hawaiians a bad name.
user_name:
Josh M
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: We booked the Penthouse Apartment in this hotel. It was clean, not as big as what I was hoping but comfortable.Housekeeping were great and came to clean and replace towels every day. The lobby was nice but the breakfast was not! Luckily we had a kitchen so made our we were able to make our own.

We originally were booked at the Hokele Suites but when we checked in the rooms were a mess and falling apart. I had simply asked for some cleaning supplies- and he upgraded us to the Aqua Oasis. This place is truly an oasis! They made sure our stay went smoothly! Always willing to help- clean rooms, and a free shuttle! I will only stay here from now on! An added bonus is it's only a block and a half away from the beach!

We have just finished a six night stay at the Aqua Oasus. The location can't be beaten, and the service from staff on the frint desk is excellent. Jasmine in particular was very helpful every time we asked a question, but evetyone on reception couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast is limited but adequate and you have convenience stores all around you. We would definitely choose to stsy here agsin. Oh but you do need to make use of the free earplugs.

Had a good experience staying at this hotel. Services wash great, at check in I felt comfortable, valet services was very good. Convinced location in central waikikik, room is very comfortable, bathroom is nice and spacious, very quiet and relaxing

This is a small hotel for me but very clean and nice staff. Pool is small though but the lounge is nice just like sitting in your own garden. Spacious room and clean, love their deep tub. Location is perfect. Affordable rooms.

Sleep: our room was well equipped with a king sized bed, table and chairs for two, adequate storage, and quite a spacious bathroom. We also had a balcony but the views of construction sights were not tempting. As others have said, the surroundings are extremely noisy, but with doors shut, our air conditioner created sufficient white noise to cancel this out.Location: apart from the construction in the immediate vicinity, the location is excellent. Its a brisk 5 minute walk to the beach and maybe 15 minutes to waikiki beach. Tourist shops, ABC convenience stores, and places to eat abound. Public transport is close by to take you almost anywhere on the island. Hotel guests can use the aqua hospitality van to ala Moana for free. Breakfast is very simple and unvaried, but hey, it's free. We appreciated the apples a available at reception.Accommodation is expensive in Hawaii and this hotel is reasonable value given the location, the bonus breakfast, free wifi. BTW take into account you pay an additional $15 per day for these services whether you use them or not.

This is a charming boutique hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Stayed three nights with my 11 year old daughter. Room was larger than expected with kitchenette. Desk staff top notch. They're friendly, knowledgable of the area, and very willing to help. Pool is small, but being close to the beach makes that less important. Continental breakfast rather modest. Perfect hotel for budget traveler seeking charm and a change from big, corporate hotel scene. Not for those looking for a grand hotel experience.

I had read reviews on this hotel that said it was noisy. We did not find it noisy at all!! lovely big room with a nice size patio. close to the main road with all the shopping. About 1 -1/2 blocks from beach. Staff couldn't be nicer! Very friendly and helpful. Had internet problems when first checked in, and they were up to fix it within 5 min.Never had any other problems. Great value for the price too. I would highly recommend this place.

We grabbed this hotel after our flight was canceled. The location is SUPERB and the price is awesome. If you want beachfront and are willing to pay outrageous prices, stay elsewhere. If you want a clean, modern room, with friendly staff, free continental breakfast and a location in walking distance to everything, this is the spot!

We ended up getting a suite with a living area plus kitchenette and a nice lanai. The bathroom is large and the soaker tub was a plus. I liked the open layout of the lobby, and the lounging chairs in the breakfast area were charming.Expect to pay $20-30/night for parking no matter where you stay, and at this hotel you do valet parking. I'd never done that before and was nervous about it, but considering Waikiki traffic, I was glad to hand over the parking to a local.Part of the charge they (meaning any hotel in the area) don't tell you about is another $20 fee for amenities like Wifi and DVD rentals. We didn't have to pay that because we got a government discount, but we didn't get those amenities, either. Another thing about Waikiki is that it's loud late into the night. Everything stays open until 10pm or later.

it was a pretty good stay, i was there for 4 days and was surprised to see that there was a balcony over looking the street, not much of a view, but still a pleasant surprise. the breakfast is pretty wimpy, basically just some pineapple and bread.. but there is an ihop right around the corner from here! there are a few bars on this street, its near most of the shopping and tons of choices for food near here. i read some reviews that said it was noisy, due to the construction across the street...it didnt bother us, but they do supply earplugs just in case. they also dont have microwaves in the room, but a coffeemaker and refrigerator. also, the pool is really small, good for cooling off, but if you have children who want to swim around, this isnt for that. overall i had a good stay.

After reading the reviews we were expecting a bit more that we received. It was nice but I don't know if we would stay there again. We had a kitchenette and were a bit disappointed that we didn't even have a kettle but that is apparently the usual in USA. The kitchen was covered in little bugs so we had to made sure everything was covered up. As we had a kitchen I didn't think our room was all that cheap. The bed was comfortable and as being on the 3rd floor it was noisy but it didn't worry us too much. Breakfast was none existent for me as I am Gluten Free and all I could have was a piece of pineapple and orange. There was no Gluten Free Bread even though I had requested some when booking. Wifi as previously mentioned was on and off. The hotel was OK but after coming of a beautiful cruise ship it seemed dated.

Simple but great, I stayed in a 1 bedroom kitchenette which was massive. The location was perfect, only 1 block to Beachwalk, and 2 blocks to the beach. The breakfast included in the nightly rate is simple but starts the day off right. Staff were supper friendly and helpful. One down side was some rooms in our group found the noise from the local bar down the street carried on a little late into the night, the hotel does give out ear plugs, otherwise request a room not facing the street. I would happily stay again.

We picked this hotel because it was less expensive than so many others in Waikiki, and the reviews were good. We found it to be a good value. Not the most luxurious or new, but perfectly adequate for our three days there. Room was clean, bed comfortable, air conditioning fan drowned out the noise we may have had from the street, but wasn't so loud as to be annoying. Breakfast was meager but adequate, staff very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

After reviewing many hotels we decided to book this hotel . The location , room and staff are 5star . The only thing that isn't is the price . Continental breakfast included . We would like to compliment the staff from the friendly arrival to our departure 3 days later . Especially Jasmin and Dexter , thanks guys we sure had a taste of Hawaiian Hospitality . Will recommend to friends in Australia .

This is an older hotel that has been updated. On the cab ride from the airport, the driver said the hotel had recently changed names. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had pre-paid for our room on Hotels.com and when we checked in the exact room type we had paid for was available. They provided a roll away bed at no extra charge to make up for the discrepancy in room type and suggested I contact Hotels.com for credit for the price difference. The hotel was reasonable clean but the wifi in our room was down intermittently and we called maintenance and eventually ended up connecting to other room's wifi (which worked). We stayed on the 3rd floor and the noise from the bars on the street below and construction on near by buildings made the room noisy day and night.

It was just a 10 min. walk to Waikiki, very centrally located near malls, beach and everything you need. Though a bit cramped, for a short stay it's ideal and staff are mostly efficient and helpful. It can be rather noisy but that's the usual for "downtown" locations. The hotel kindly provides ear plugs.

So I recently came home and decided to play tourist for a few days..booked over the phone directly with the hotel...they gave me an awesome rate...then I got delayed in San Francisco so I called the hotel to let them k ow that I may not make it til the next day they told me right off the bat not to worry about it...I got in to the hotel that same day pulled up didn't have to do a thing ...I was in a walking boot cuz I broke leg and the staff was awesome helped with my bags literally only had to break out an I'd to check I got to my room in 5 mins of pulling up...my while stay after that was like I was family I'd call my car would be there by the time I got off the elevator pool was clean and cool breakfast was prompt dude I recommend to anyone ..me Andy family will all be using the oasis regularly...thank you from my Ohana to yours

I did not originally plan to stay at this hotel but after messing up the dates that I would be in Hawaii, I booked a room here last minute. The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

The staff are friendly and helpful however and the complimentary breakfast was okay too. However it is ridiculously noisy at night. You can still hear music blaring and people yelling at 4am in the morning. I don't think the double beds are actually a double size either, much smaller.

They really try, and they get a lot of it right. The location is perfect: doesn't get much more central than this. You can walk to everything in central Honolulu, including Waikiki beach. They even provide towels and beach chairs to borrow. The downside, of course, is that it's noisy and busy. Our first night on the 4th floor was cut short by the racket of a 6AM garbage pickup, and I can't imagine what the weekend party crowd would do to someone on the lower floors. Let's just say they provide complimentary ear plugs for good reasons. The hotel has recently been renovated, and while the décor is nice enough, the attention to detail is pretty sad – it isn't going to look fresh for long. The complimentary breakfast is also kinda sad – the fresh cut pineapple and decent coffee the two redeeming features. But, hey, it's complimentary. The pool is tiny and could be swapped out for a hot tub to everyone's advantage. Nice relaxing hangout zone, but the public spaces are tiny and cramped. None of the rooms have much of a view, and even though they all have balconies it's not particularly inviting to sit outside overlooking construction sites and back alleys. The staff are friendly and provide decent service. Above all else, however, this is by far the best deal in Honolulu – a “real” hotel at a competitive rate. Make sure to check out their “lowest rate guarantee” and prepare to be the squeaky wheel to get the rate you should be given. Valet parking at $30 a night is not cheap, but it's extremely convenient in a city where parking is a pain in the neck.

This hotel does NOT have a shuttle service. They direct you to the same shuttle service 90% of tourists use to get to Waikiki. It will cost you about $30 from the airport. Room doors have a huge gap at the bottom. Room was very dated with tacky tile, rusty metal panels in the bathroom, and very dates fixtures in the bathroom. It felt like an older Motel in fact. "Breakfast" may as well have been from a vending machine. Room was very humid and required A/C all night, but there were not adequate blankets to stay warm while asleep.

We had a 9 night stay in room 407 and it was great. The full size kitchen was a great as was having a large fridge to store drinks and food. Free movies were great as was the large furnished deck to relax on after busy days out in this lively city. The rooms are serviced daily to a very high standard and the bedding was changed during our stay twice. Breakfast was lovely and the coffee great with a paper to read each day, the breakfast area was also very very clean. The down side?There was outside traffic noise yes but the ear plugs are for your use if you need them. Our friends stayed at another hotel and were envious of our room. This is a very well located hotel in the hub of the city and we would recommend it and stay again.

I was staying different hotel four nights with small room and double the price before.so I changed the hotel was best idea I've made.Huge room plus continental breakfast, bus to the shopping center for free,friendly staff with smiles,I would definitely coming back this place.

We had the greatest stay at Aqua Oasis the past couple weeks. Our plane was 4 hours late, but we were greeted by the very cheerful Chelsea, who made everything alright! The staff are the real treasure at this hotel- Chelsea, Vae, Dexter, Tiki and Martin were the main staff we talked to almost daily, but there were more. The staff truly were exceptionally nice, helpful, and knowledgeable. Their manager, Evelyn, should really be thanked for such a good group. The hotel is very centrally located on Lewers street, between Kalakaua, the main beach and shopping street and Kuhio, which we used for restaurants. The lobby is cutely Hawaiian, with a small pool, but very open. Our room was large, and had a balcony that looked out over the city- the room was very quiet even with the bars and restaurants on Kalakaua. The room was perfect size for all of us, and included wifi, and had a tv. The housekeeping staff kept the room immaculate. There is a continental breakfast, that has Hawaiian rolls and pineapple juice, as well as toast, coffee and hard boiled eggs. But try the different rolls- all with a Hawaiian twist. This is the second time we have stayed here, and will definitely stay when we return.

Our three night stay was very pleasant, no issues checking or out. The room was spaceous, comfortable and clean. Our room faced the car park and not a fabulous view, however, we didn't pick the place for the view. The location is within easy walk of the beach, restaurants and shopping and prices are roughly half that of hotels nearer the beach. Staff were very helpful, beach towels provided, reasonably fast and free WiFi, light breakfast provided. We enjoyed our stay here.

Clean, decent continental breakfast, close to shopping. Staff was friendly and accommodating. No problems encountered with checkout or check in. Room was not fancy but was was comfortable. View of the ocean in the distance.

We had a confirmed reservation, and had prepaid the first night to ensure our room would be ready when we checked in, but when we got there, we were told we did not have a room and would have to pay an additional fee to get an upgraded room. We ended up in a King bed for three adults. Not what we had wanted and not ideal. Definitely marred the only two days of rest we had to enjoy the island. I did not sleep the first night as I was so upset.Location is great, just a couple of blocks from the beach.

Stayed at this hotel during the hapalua half marathon. The location is good. its just a short walk to the beach and they provide towels. It says that is is recently renovated, everything was clean, but not necessarily brand new. The hotel room we had was a junior suite, It was very spacious, and even had a full kitchen which I was not expecting. there was a king size bed and a couch that pulled out as a sleeper. The hotel staff was also very gracious and accommodating. The downside- I should have been concerned when there were earplugs in the room as one of the "free amenities". The room was right next door to a bar which is very very loud until about 3AM. This was the worst part of the whole stay. If I stayed again I would demand to not be on the side of the hotel next to this bar. The free breakfast was continental, and reasonable. The pool lobby area is quiet and nice.parking is really expensive and there are no other options nearby, so this is a significant added expense to the hotel stay

This place was awesome. We went for my parents 50th anniversary and the staff were more than accommodating. They gave my parents a special gift. Everyone was so friendly. The hotel was clean. The continental breakfast was delicious, the fruit was so fresh and juicy. The rooms were spacious and clean. Robert, Vae, and Tiki were so nice. We were two blocks from the beach. The hotel gave us vouchers for the shuttles. They had laundry services. When we go back, this is where we are staying. Thank you so much for being attentive and friendly to me and my family.

This hotel is a good hotel option in Waikiki considering the location and the price.The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff people was very kind. Maria, the receptionist, is the kindest person I've ever met working in Hotel.

We stayed at the Aqua Oasis the night after we got engaged and the customer service we received was top notch. The room was clean, updated and very nice looking. We very much enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

I was supposed to stay here on 2 separate occasions. The first stay was for 1 night, while the second was going to be for 2 nights. After my first stay, I cancelled my 2nd stay for a variety of reasons.I was traveling with a group When we all checked in at the same time (well after check in time), some of our rooms were ready while others were not. My room was one of those that was not ready. After waiting nearly an hour for a "clean" room, I was finally checked in.I found my room to be dirty and old. The bed was so uncomfortable, that if I tried to sleep in the middle of it, I would just roll to one side or the other. I never could get comfortable. The bathroom was dirty and had hair all over it (a big pet peeve for me). Another issue I had with the bathroom is getting into the tub. I had to climb over a large span of tub wall (if you want to call it that). If you have any mobility issues at all, if you can't get a accessible room, don't book here!.Another thing with this property, if you are parking your car here, it ends up in the alley. It's out in the open and no protection at all from anyone. And you have to pay for this.The breakfast is ho hum and you can do a lot better with the nearby restaurants. Speaking of restaurants, there are a variety of different restaurants within walking distance (the only plus to this property).Would I stay here again? NO. Can I recommend this property? NO.

We booked 4 nights stay at penthouse suite with kitchen. Check-in was fast with no hassle. Staffs are friendly. Parking is $30 which is pretty standard and valet takes time to get you car because they have to loop around the block. Lobby has no air conditioning which can be hot during day time. Property is next to a construction site and trucks start rolling in before 6:00 waking up the whole family. There were ants on our bed and they are all over bedside table as well. We talked to the front desk to shorten our stay. Staff Jasmine was very understand and helpful. She helped us get the refund for the rest of the 3 nights. We however needs to pay a fortune for booking another hotel (Disney resort) because of the last minute booking arrangement.This property offer free movie and xbox rental which is a bonus. It is a shame we did not stay long enough to take advantage of the service.Walking distance to Waikiki beach (10 minutes with children).

Can not fault the location if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki and just a block and a half back from the beach! Easy walk to everything - all the shops at the Royal Hawaiian Centre, luxury row, Hard Rock Cafe and Bills restaurant.Great value for money by Waikiki standards, the $15 per night resort fee includes continental breakfast, daily newspaper and fast wifi. Valet parking $30 a night ( always quick and super-helpful when our hire car got a flat battery twice!! ). Great friendly staff BUT the street noise was pretty awful...woken every morning of our two week stay by either the daily garbage trucks or drunken revellers screaming in the street ( worse on Friday and Saturday nights of course! ).We were on the 10th floor in 1015 on the corner, with our lanai right on Lewers St, so we knew it was going to be noisy ( and they provide earplugs )... We are early risers anyway, and with breakfast starting at 7am, the garbage trucks acted like our alarm clock.Comfortable king sized bed, great water pressure in the shower, the lanai ( balcony ) not really usable due to the noise outside and the exposure to the busy street and surrounding shops and hotels.TV reception was poor, with only a few channels, but you don't come to Hawaii to watch TV!Breakfast selection was good, toast, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, coffee and pineapple juice and also a choice of cereals every 2-3 days. Easy half hour stroll to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre in one direction and the Zoo the other. We never utilised the complimentary shuttle or even caught the trolley or bus, as everything was an easy stroll away.

I needed a disabled accessible room. The hotel has a very well equipped large spacious disabled room. Excellent service. Fast in-room wifi Internet. Simple continental breakfast included.Fruit (oranges and pinapple), muffins, bread, juice, no hot food but hard boiled eggs.The hotel has full kitchen units. Mine wasn't, so the hotel kindly provided a toaster and microwave oven along with dishes and silverware.

Stayed here 2 weeks during an aunt's burial at sea off Waikiki. Comfortable. Slept well. Cooperative service. Nice location on Lewers between Kuhio and Kalakaua. Easy cheap busses on Kuhio to downtown Honolulu, Iolani Palace, Chinatown and Ala Moana Shopping Cntr. (Tip if you use busses and are over 65 just show Medicare card and fare is $1.) Closeby to Waikiki Beach and Kalakaua shopping. Lots of restaurants nearby (Duke's, Hula Grill for b'fast; dinner: Ocean House, LuLu's, Hy's Steak House, Keoni by Keo (for Thai food). Very nearby pretty good chains: PF Chang, Cheesecake Factory, and Cheeseburger in Paradise. We enjoyed Kauai more because it was pure vacation. And who doesn't like Kauai, but Aqua Oasis made our Waikiki stay with our cousin closeby enjoyable as well.By the way, saw the Pacific Rim Festival Parade in Waikiki on Kalakaua. WOW. Truly an interesting parade with representative dancers, bands etc from all over the Pacific Rim. Ck it out if you are in Waikiki in early March.

we were "upgraded"...a nice room...but why were there earplugs by the bed? because at11pm the club nearby kicked off...and was deafening till 4.30am..they knew about the noise...so is that why they "upgraded" us? they moved us to the "quiet" side of the hotel.We had to demand a refund for the night...I complained in writing to the manager andto Aqua corporate...I have yet to receive a reply. Oh yes...and they double charged us oncheck in...lucky my wife spotted that!

Stayed here for one night and was very pleased. Had a hard time finding a place to accommodate is. Aqua Oasis was clean and had plenty of room for a family of 5. Within walking distance of the beach and shops. The staff was very warm and welcoming.

Booked the penthouse' suite ' for 3 people. Failed to meet our expectations, the living area with sofa bed divided from bedroom by folding louvre doors, the runners were difficult t use and there was no privacy. The bathroom had a sliding room which kept jammin on its runners and getting stuck. Very poor complimentary breakfast, go out.

Hotel was in a great location but needs double glazing as our room was on 4th floor at the end of bars that run until 4am every night. After the first night of no sleep they did move us to 5th floor opposite end which wasn't as bad but still could hear noise of music & people leaving the bars.As stated location was great a block away from the beach & close to shopping but would recommend to ask for a room not near bars

The location of this hotel is central to everything in Waikiki and the rooms are equipped with a small kitchen which is a huge bonus. Parking is hard to come by in this area so if possible book their snooze-n-crooze package which includes valet parking - it is worth it. Of course the continental breakfast is another added bonus as you can go out with a full tummy.The reason I gave this hotel a 4 and not a 5 is due to the fact that we were first placed in a room right next to the elevator in the Hibiscus tower and there was a certain clanging sound that came from the elevator shaft every time it hit the bottom. That noise went on the whole night and It was further coupled with more noise from the arrival of the garbage truck at 5:30am. Needless to say, we did not get too much sleep that night. However, Asyu (the manager) helped us with a change in room the next morning to the furthest room from the elevator and even moved our luggage while we were out exploring the island.

A great trip staying here. This hotel provides everything a traveller would expect. A fairly large room with a kitchen along with a small swimming pool. Though the breakfast and pool aren't great, 5/5

Stayed at this hotel twice for a total of 21 days between January and February of 2015. From the moment I stepped on to the property, the service and attentiveness of the staff was nothing but excellent and they did a great job sharing the spirit of "Aloha". Nothing like I have ever seen in any of the hotels in the Waikiki Area. Jasmine, especially was fantastic, I was greeted every morning with a great smile and she had excellent recommendations on places to eat and activities to do not only within Waikiki but all over the island. Both of my visits, I stayed in a junior suite. The room was very large and clean and comfortable, but there were only several small drawers. The room does have a large closet but only a few hangers, so if you plan on bringing a lot of clothes, expect to live a little bit out of your suit case. The bathroom was very clean and spacious, my only complaint is that the water pressure would sometimes drop in the middle of a shower. But this would only last a few seconds. Breakfast was decent, although after a week or so, it did get a little boring. A little more variety wouldn't hurt and easier to peel boiled eggs as well. With all that being said, I would definitely stay here again whether for business or for a family vacation. The hotel is nice and clean, but the hotel staff is what separates it from the other hotels in the area.

Stayed here for 2 nights post cruise. We were in a junior suite room 401 (Hibiscus Tower). Room was large, clean and recently renovated with nice decor and a large balcony with furniture. Large bathroom with bath tub. Kitchen was well equipped although we didn't use it. Free wifi.Staff friendly and very helpful with directions etc. Staff got us into our room early as we disembarked the ship at 9.00am. Breakfast was included (Continental) which was good and there was always lemon infused water in the reception area.The hotel was close to shopping, restaurants, beach 2 blocks away and the trolley bus stop was across the road. The hotel also had a shuttle bus. They also arranged for an early morning taxi (6am) to the airport on our departure.The down side: Our suite was located facing Lewers Street, across the road was a night club that was open until 4am. As we were there Sat/Sun night this was not very good. Loud music and loud voices was all we could hear. Also the air-con was very noisy, so sleep quality was bad. Spoke to reception who offered to move us but we couldn't have a suite, so we stay in our existing room.I would probably not stay here again because of the noise only. The friendliness of the staff and the hotel itself was excellent. Maybe a room in the other tower or away from the street noise might be a better choice

First off, I felt safe with the single entrance and an employee at the gate to greet me. Then the check-in desk was right inside the gate, with ice cold lemon water to remind me to stay hydrated. For being so central to the beaches in Waikiki, I was impressed with the private pool area, and the shaded eating areas. But here's what really impressed - the size of the rooms. This was bigger than my studio apartment! And a large lanai to boot with a skyline view. I could live there!Lastly, and most important, the front desk was so kind and personable. They helped me find my way to morning mass and to the stores. The young woman at the front desk who had moved here from Fairfield in Northern California was sharp and polite - and always had a smile on her face. You definitely earned my return business, and made my vacation memorable. John, Davis, CA

We were only in Honolulu for one night and this hotel fit the bill. It is not terribly fancy but it was clean, quiet and the staff was very very friendly. The only downside was that my daughter had called them to ask if she could buy a bottle of champagne for our room as it was our 30th wedding anniversary and the staff said that they would do it for free as a gift. Well, there must have been some kind of misunderstanding as they acknowleged our anniversary by giving us a free bus token to the mall! no thanks!!!

Aqua Oasis - great value. Staff was friendly, efficient and very helpful. The Junior Suite with kitchenette rooms were newly renovated and modern, good amenities and very useful and free WiFi. The location was great, very close to Kalakaua Ave and the main shopping areas and only 1 block from the beach. The staff were fantastic and made us all felt as we were staying with family. Definitely would stay again and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Honolulu.

This hotel was one of the better I have visited in Waikiki. I struggle to find up to date hotels in the areai, but I must say I was pleasantly surprised buy this one. They even had a Playstation for a rainy day :) We had some problems with what seemed like a huge family of ants on the nightstands, but they where so small that we ignored the issue. Be aware of the resort fee of 15$ per day, in addition to valley parking (30$). The nightly rate is therefor 45$ more than advertised.

This is the first time that we have stayed in the Oasis since they took over from the Old Joy Hotel.We usually stay at other Aqua hotels. We were very happy with the service and the rooms.We had a full kitchen with a nice large living room section and a big king size bed. The extra large soaking tub was great to relax after a long day shopping. Very spacious and comfortable.The location of the hotel is close to everything, the outside pool area is decorated beautifully and the hanging chairs are a nice touch. They offer free dvd rentals in the lobby for your stay.Will be back to this hotel in the future.

This hotel has a very good location, close to Kalakaua Avenue, where you can find a lot of shopping, markets and movement. You are also at a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. We stayed at the Junior Suite with a full furnished kitchen and enough space for a family of up to 6 people (the room has two queen beds and one sofa bed. One good thing about the hotel is that they serve a breakfast at no costs. The food is very simple, no much variety, but enough for not being so hungry in the morning.

We had a great stay at the Aqua Oasis and would definitely recommend. My friend and I had a double bed each, and the room was large and neat. It isn't flashy but its everything you need and its clean. The hotel itself is great. They have shuttles and information handy for all of the key activities you may want to do and its located just off the main strip so is super convenient whilst keeping an eye on your wallet.

I booked this for a night or two whilst I was in Transit in Honolulu. It is a Gem! It was affordable and surprisingly nicer than expected. The Staff kindly upgraded me upon arrival, the location was very close to the Shops and the Beach.It is the staff that really make the impact though. They refer to you as friends as soon as you walk in, and they are always happy to talk or provide advice on where to go and what to eat. Complimentary breakfast and WiFi is also a huge plus in my books (especially for the low cost in the first place)

My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night between flights on our way to study abroad overseas, but I wish we could have stayed longer! We are on a bit of a tight budget, but Aqua Oasis seemed pretty affordable and was very close to the airport. Our flight got in very late, so when I called the staff to let them know they directed us to the best airport transportation. When we arrived we found we had been upgraded for free to a penthouse suite! It was beautiful and very comfortable. The desk gave us a wakeup call in the morning for our flight out and arranged for airport transportation for us. Overall a great experience and I would love to stay here again!

Yes, this hotel has been renovated, has excellent location, and it is not very expensive, as many other hotels in the area. But it is Jasmine, Mike, and Andrea, among others, that make the difference. I understand that this hotel is part of a chain now, but many of the previous employees are still working there. It tells a lot about the current management.Recommendation: Keep those hard boiled eggs for breakfast, but add some salt when boiling them to make peeling easy.

We had a great time at this hotel. The location is very convenient to restaurants and the beach. The staff was friendly and efficient. The pool is a bit small but still lots of fun for small children to play in. I would describe the rooms as large, comfortable and well decorated. The hotel felt very modern. The in room TV was huge. Breakfast buffet was convenient, delicious and included in the price of the room. We will definitely stay here again.

I am so glad i went on previous trip advisor reviews! Loved our stay at Aqua Oasis. Just a block away from the beach, the shops and restaurants are within walking distance, rooms are clean & spacious. The swimming pool is small, but when you are minutes from waikiki, why bother! The lobby is very calming and breakfast is simple. The staff are friendly, helpful and genuinely interested in any concerns. Yasu, Mike & the rest of the staff, thank you for such an enjoyable stay, we look forward to see you all later this year!

Aqua Oasis is a smaller hotel which is centred in the heart of Waikiki just round the corner from the main shopping road and one block from Waikiki Beach. The staff were extremely efficient and accommodating and user friendly with younger children. There is a small pool to cool off in and a lovely buffet breakfast is set up in the open air foyer each morning. There was a free Happy hour is on a Thursday which was marvellous with a musician to top off the ambience.You are close to bus transport and the hotel runs a free shuttle service to and from Alamoana.We were family of 10 from New Zealand and would high recommend this hotel.
