Agua Oasis was a great choice: we really hadn't known what to expect! Location, cleanliness, condition of room, bed, amenities, etc. were very good. Price is a bargain. Breakfast is a easy and convenient way to start a day in Waikiki. We had made subsequent lodging plans, but wish we had choosen to stay longer here.

We stayed here for two nights ; kaamaiana rates are a great value if you are local, and it was awesome! first of all, if you are touring and don't mind being off the beach, it is a perfect location and a smaller hotel. My biggest compliment is to the staff. The service they provided was excellent! Every employee (especially Ryan and Jasmine) but every single person was exceptional! Friendly, nice, polite and professional. You don't see that very often these days. The free continental breakfast was awesome and the lemon water in the lobby was always nice after a morning of walking to the beach which is about 3 blocks away. It is easy to get on and off the highway when visiting local attractions (Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head and other parts of the island) Extreme awesome shopping is just a block out the door; it's like 5th Avenue in New York City- Max Mara, Prada, etc. with the ABC store also handy for Hawaiian treats. Just two things to know if these are important to you; - the pool is very small, just for a dip it's fine, city /parking lot view on your lanai. For the money, service and a quick trip; I felt it was a superior stay in Waikiki.

The Aqua Oasis is a very nice hotel with a bit of an unfortunate location. It is located in the luxury shopping area of Weikiki, which in its self is not so bad. But there is also a lot of night time activity from bars and night clubs that overflows into the streets after all, meaning a whole lot of noise starting at 3 am.We have the Junior suite, which is very roomy. Here are the things that are not so nice...the oversize lanai (one of the reasons I selected the room) over looks the back of Galleria...not quite. Tropical view! Due to traffic, the furniture on the lanai is covered in a film of black dust, which it appears, the hotel does not clean.The living area has a nice HD TV, but not HD service. That's not so bad, as I didn't come here to watch TV! The. Kitchenette is very usable (I just need to let them know they have sugar ants). Bathroom is spacious, but dated and the beds are very comfortable.The most unforgiving factor about this room is that there are no drawers to put you clothes in. There is a large closet (with a good sized lock box), but something need drawers.So ther you have it...the good and the bad!

We stayed here for five nights and really enjoyed ourselves. I love the way they have incorporated the older aspects of the building with the 'retro' styling! Our bed was comfortable and neither of us felt the need to use the ear plugs provided. The staff were always accommodating - I was impressed with the number of languages some can speak! The hotel is close to a few ABC stores, so you can stock your fridge with snacks and drinks. The Hotel has beach towels and chairs you can borrow, for your short walk to the beach. We also took advantage of the valet parking and the free shuttle bus, both of which were great. The guest laundry was the cheapest we found throughout our trip! We like to stay a bit away from the crowds, and this hotel was perfect - far enough away that the crowds weren't an issue, but still close enough that when you want to get amongst it, it's right there!

The Aqua Oasis was a warm and comfortable place to stay! The valet (Mark, I think his name is) was particularly helpful, energetic and fast! We never waited more than a couple of minutes for our car. Everyone there was cheerful and friendly. The walk down Lewers street to the beach was short and pleasant. The hotel provided earplugs but we found our room to be very quiet. We would definitely come back!

The Aqua Oasis is a very centrally located Hotel near Waikiki Beach. Ms. Jasmiz, Mr. Peffer, Mr. Mike, Mr. Steven all do a great job to make sure your stay at the Aqua Oasis Hotel and Resort is above pleasant. The security team are vigilant and always ready to give you insight on the coolest running path to your fun entertainment for the night. Price was great and for those families wanting to save some money, their kitchen comes in handy to prepare some home cooked meals. Very nice pool and continental breakfast for those early birds that would like to get going out of their room... Mahalo...

The Aqua Oasis is comprised of two towers with a small lobby, tiny swimming pool, but with a very friendly and helpful staff. Everyone had a smile and would help in any way they could to take care of ou needs. We stayed at the hotel this month and found it to have a very international clientele. Most of the guests were Asian and the staff that we encountered also spoke Japanese. From my observations and interactions with other guests, few guests seemed to be from the U.S., but were from Japan, Australia, Canada, etc. The Aqua Oasis offers a continental breakfast--not much of a selection. If you want cereal and milk you will have to purchase it at the store on the corner. Coffee, juice, tea, toast, muffins, hard boiled eggs, pineapple and orange slices. We asked for a king-bed and we learned that all of the king rooms are located on the Lewers side of the hotel. You will want to avoid that side because of the street noise. Interestingly, the hotel anticipated that problem and provides ear plugs on the bedside table. We changed rooms the next day and found the two-double bed room to be more spacious and on the opposite side of the building. It was still too noisy to leave the sliding doors that open to a small balcony open, but, if you turn the AC on, it drowns out the other sounds. There is much construction going on in Honolulu and some of it is near the hotel. The beach at Waikiki is only a block and a half away--small blocks--so your walk there is a quick one. The hotel provides free towels and free beach chairs! Valet parking is available for a fee and we found that service to be quite expeditious. We used the coin-operated laundry on the first floor before we left. Using it during the dinner hour assures you an uninterrupted period where the machines are all yours! There are ample eating establishments on Kuhio. Eating out in Waikiki can be expensive, so look around for values. I recommend Marukame Udon on Kuhio for a delicious and relatively inexpensive meal. Wi-Fi is also available at the hotel. This hotel provided a good value, but I will probably look for another location next time I am in Waikiki.

I think the location and value of this hotel is really good. That's the main draw for this hotel. Service was good, but I don't think it was special. The room itself is okay, but not what I was expecting out of a hotel ranked this high in Hawaii. The bathtub design was weird and we had trouble operating the AC unit. Their restaurant downstairs is pretty nice too.

I stayed here for 6 nights during the second half of my trip to Oahu. Staff service in all areas was great! Ever helpful with anything I needed assistance with...In particular ...Jasmine you are an asset to Oasis. The rooms are a good size and very comfortable. The location is perfect, having everything from restaurants, shopping to Waikiki beach right on the doorstep. I will easily return here. Mahalo.

Stayed November/December 2014We stayed here for 10 days and were very impressed with this hotel and especially the staff. Arrived about 1130 and was told our room was ready. Unfortunately we asked for 2 doubles and the room was a king. Dexter immediately upgraded us to a Junior Suite on the 6th floor with the proper beds. The room was large and overlooked Lewers Street. No view and a little noisy with the garbage trucks at 6am (not the hotel's fault). Views are everywhere in Waikiki so not having one from the room was OK. My wife and son slept through the noise but I seem to be a little bit more sensitive. Had a little problem with ants so had to make sure we rinsed everything before throwing it out. This is the tropics so something like this is not a big problem.Location is great. Everything is less than 10 minutes away. Short walk to shopping, The Cheesecake Factory (highly recommended), Royal Hawaiian Centre (try Champions Steak & Seafood and Mahaloha Burgers - all freshly cooked and reasonably priced) and Macy's (only a small store but good value especially at sales times) Waikiki Trolley main terminus is 2 minutes walk away in DFS Galleria basement. Waikele Outlets $10 bus in 3 minutes away - through Trolley terminus and turn right. If you don't want the long route to Ala Moana using the trolley just turn left into Lewers and right into Kuhio and wait less than 10 minutes.The staff were great, the continental breakfast ok and the laundry facilities are pretty cheap. $1.50 a load for washer and dryer with washing powder at $1.50 from the front desk. Sit down, read a book or free paper and drink a bottle of Coke for $1.25 while you do your washing.Newspapers are free in the lobby and are worth checking out for coupons during sales.We will definitely stay here again but will try to get a room at the back of the hotel this time.

Stayed here for a week on business and am happy I did. From the street it doesn't look like much, and quite frankly, it is not a upscale hotel. What it is, is a great place to stay to lay your head while enjoying the island.Located in the heart of Waikiki, the valet parking is great, because, let them worry about the stalls. Very close to the shopping, including DFS Galleria and Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Easy to get to, and easy to get out of Waikiki from. iHop is around the corner, as well as some 24 hour mini stores.The room is perfect. Awesome AC, nice big screen tv and a huge tub/shower. The Cal King bed is very, very comfortable, and includes a mini fridge, coffee and maker, iron and board.They offer continental breakfast starting at 7am and have convenient washers and dryers on premises.The staff, from the parking valet, private security, and hotel staff is more then extremely friendly. Probably one of the friendliest I ever met. Convenience fee includes wifi in room, daily newspaper and movie rental. Kamaaina's pay attention, another great place to stay.

Stayed here for 3 nights and our stay was lovely. We were on the 8th floor of the Gardenia Tower.The room was very quiet with 2 double beds,small table with 2 chairs,small fridge,safe and coffee making machine.The beds were comfortable as were the pillows and bed linen was of good quality.The bathroom was very roomy with shower over bath and towels were also good quality.The lobby area has very nice plants and is open air. All the staff were very friendly and helpful.The hotel has guest laundry as well as free shuttle bus to Alo Moana shopping centre.Wifi strong in our room and we were given a free DVD voucher when checking in.The hotel is in good location for shopping and reasonably close to beach around 10 minute walk.Overall I would recommend this hotel as an affordable option in Waikiki.
user_name:
Karen H
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I booked this hotel early 2014. At time of booking, n mention of a resort fee. I arrived with my printed confirmation and was told I had to pay a resort fee. Fee was instituted 8/2015. The room is small. I was given a room directly opposite the elevator and the quality of the bed linen is very last century. The hotel is old! My room overlooks a construction site. The staff is personable. I travel a lot and have friends planning to visit Hawaii in the next few months. I will not recommend this hotel. Buyer beware , if you do decide to stay here, you do not want room 609!
user_name:
NewJazzhead
New York City, New York

review_body: First time to waikiki, 4 of us (3 adults and one child)stayed at the Aqua oasis in a one bedroom, large room divided by bi fold doors. The room was ready when we arrived after the flight and upgraded promptly at our request, thanks to the gorgeous staff(Dexter) at the front desk.our room was cleaned well daily and the hotel offered a nice light breakfast for guests each morning.Nice friendly helpful staff, great free wifi, laundry facilities and located in a great part of town. Not on the beach, but near to a few local great Irish pubs which suited us.We would definitely stay again we could not fault anything. Great value for money.Mahalo to the amazing staff at the oasis.:)

I stayed here for one night at the end of my trip to Hawaii. I had just gotten off a cruise ship and arrived quite early at the hotel, but Dexter at the front desk was able to give me a room right away and even upgraded me to a junior suite at no extra charge. The room was large, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and responded promptly to my request for a corkscrew for the room. I would stay here again if I come back to Waikiki.

Was visiting Honolulu for business. Fortunately for me, the rooms at the meeting venue were booked so I had to seek alternative lodging. I looked through available hotel options and came upon the Aqua Oasis. This hotel was very clean and comfortable. I was very, very pleased as it exceeded all my expectations.

I found the hotel to be a very nice. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room and common areas were clean and well kept. They have a Koi pond and a turtle pond that are delightful to watch. The hotel is close to shopping,the beach and restaurants. There is an onsite laundry for those who are staying longer than a couple of days. The pool is tucked into a corner but when you are this close to the beach it really isn't an issue. I would visit there again.

We reserved two rooms for a 2-night weekend stay. The request was for one King bedded room and one Double/Double. Upon check in, no Doubles were available, so my party was forced to squeeze a roll-away into one of the rooms. This was the only disappointment. It is by no means a deluxe or 5-star hotel, but the Aqua Oasis offers solid value and a terrific location - it's a bit away from the chaos of Kalakaua Avenue, but only a short 10 minute stroll to the beach and the western end of that main thoroughfare. Don't expect any luxury resort amenities (the pool is pretty unappealing, for example) and you shouldn't be disappointed. The Continental Breakfast is fine and the service is courteous and professional. Rooms are comfortable, nothing lavish. A nice private balcony offered comfy seating but no views to speak of from the 3rd floor.

I stayed here every night, other than the first night of my honeymoon. My step mom actually upgraded us to this hotel as the other one was horid. The AC is good, the pillows and bed are decent enough to sleep. You do have to pay an additional $15 per day mandatory for wifi and movies, even if you dont use them. I complained and got that waived.The continental breakfast was a little sad. Muffins, rolss, fruit, and boiled eggs, but it was better than nothing. The valet are great, you do have to pay a bit for parking. But the ammenities and quailty of the hotel are better than what we had so I was willing to pay it. I would say sure, if its in your budget.

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Oasis for several weeks and we really enjoyed our stay. The location of the hotel is great, close to shopping, the beach and great restaurants. It is also in a place that is quiet which can be a challenge to find in Waikiki. The staff was excellent, very friendly and always helpful. The rooms are good sized, very clean and the beds are very comfortable. I have stayed at several hotels in Waikiki and I will definitely be back to stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting.

We stayed twice, once on the way to the mainland and on the way back. Both times we found the location, staff, and rooms very good. The first time we booked via this site and were not aware of the $15 pr day resort fee. The room we had was a normal sized hotel room, rather dated but comfortable. I booked with the hotel for our return stay and landed the suite for the same price. Large room with sofa, microwave, large fridge. kitchen. I have lived in smaller flats. For the price this is great hotel.

We chose the Aqua Oasis based on previous reviews, the price and the location. Check in was quick and easy. We were greeted at the open air front desk by the friendly staff and were in our room within 5 minutes. Our bags arrived a few minuted later and we were shown everything about the room. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, the A/C worked great and kept the room very cool. The bathroom was large with a large oval tub. My only complaint about the bathroom is the water pressure for the shower head was very weak. I'm all about water conservation but a little more water pressure would have been nice. We had a large balcony overlooking Lewers Street. Noise was never an issue at night unless you were had the sliding glass doors open. They provide free beach towels and folding beach seats at no charge. The location is excellent, close to shopping, restaurants, bars and close to the beach. There is a continental breakfast every morning which I disagree with others and thought it was nice. Most Waikiki hotels don't offer anything other than a $15 to $20 breakfast. It consisted of hard boiled eggs, a variety of pastries, hot coffee and fresh fruit. The wifi was fairly good but had its moments. There is an area to wash the sand off you at the entrance as well as a shower at the pool. Valet parking is $30 but it is Waikiki after all. They retrieved our car quickly. Overall a nice 8 day stay at the Oasis.

Compared to other hotels we've been to end of October 2014 (Ramada Plaza, Ilima), the Aqua Oasis was clearly the best deal: $148, incl. taxes & additional resort fee of $15. Beach is close. Continental breakfast was not overwhelming, but okay. Internet connection was either slow or super-fast, depending on the time. Staff was very friendly.

Family of five stayed at this hotel and it was good. The hotel is in a great location, close to the action, beach and everything you need. The staff are extremely friendly and cannot do enough for you. Nothing is a problem and they are always smiling. Breakfast is ample and has a small variety of pastries, fruits etc and is plenty good to get your day started. The location is walking distance to everything and conveniently located just behind the main hub of Lewers street so that is a plus.The hotel has had a lick of paint and a small face lift, but still shows signs of age and a little haggard. In saying that the rooms are very clean and the bedding is new and extremely comfortable. We had a PH suite with ocean views and of the fireworks on the Friday night, so that was awesome. The room is probably a bit squishy for a family of five (teens) but considering we were only there for 3 nights and hardly ever in the room it did the job. Overall for a short stay this place is great and value for money, staff friendliness, cleanliness and location you cant ask for better.

I stayed here for the first time and had a mixed experience. I got a room that had a nice kitchen, a 2 burner stove, a newer frig, coffee pot, toaster, microwave and everything you would need to cook. All the silverware, pots, pans & dishes, cups and glasses. Nice. The room was nice and had a couch also along with a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was large also. The cleaning service did a very good job. It also had a very large balcony. It was about 8' x 20' and had a couple of lounge chairs and tables along with a lounger. And the closet was very large also. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Those are the positives, now the negatives:The don't tell you that parking is $30 a day. That seemed on the high side and you are not able to park yourself. You must use their valet service since they share a parking lot so there's another fee (tip) for the valet.I mentioned that the closet was very large with lots of hangers but they only had 3 very small drawers. Like sock drawers. So you must leave your shorts, t-shirts etc. in your suitcase.I pointed out that the balcony was very nice but the view sucked! Besides viewing other hotels, condo's and office buildings right across the street was some kind of a bus transfer station. Apparently it had been recently renovated and the yard out front had turned into a junk yard. Lots of junk out there that had been replaced with new items. The pedestrians couldn't see it as a 8' tall plywood wall had been put up along the sidewalk, but all of us who were up high had a very disturbing view. I'm really surprised that this hotel and the other high rise owners who have to look at this haven't complained to the city to get it cleaned up. I was here for a week and I never saw a single person inside of it so obviously it has been put out of the owners minds.There is a $15 per day "resort fee" here. It is supposed to include internet and a "continental" breakfast. I was never able to connect to their internet and their definition of a breakfast is different than mine. They had coffee & juice, bread for toast, muffins and fruit. No cold cereal and nothing hot. This might hold you over until you could go elsewhere to get a real breakfast. On my next trip here I'll be looking around for another place to stay.

After more than 30 days of some of the finest hotels traveling across Europe, East Asia and Japan we decided to make an overnight stop in Hawaii to have dinner with family and friends before heading home to Florida. Avoiding the carnival atmosphere of Waikiki and the Disney-like resorts of the north coast we decided to stay at this little hotel. What a refreshing change.Laid back and not overly attentive, the staff is friendly, helpful, and genuine. Breakfast is casual to say the least, free wifi, free DVDs, and a free shuttle were available (none of which we used). Close to the bars, beaches, and souvenir shops, which we did not visit, but our room was large, with comfortable beds, and though the balcony faced the street, the combination of AC hum and good windows made for a quiet nights sleep. If you want to be sealed in the plastic of a Sheraton or Marriott, this place is not for you. But if you want the feel of what Hawaii used to be, it's still barely possible at the Aqua Oasis, "da-kind-a" place Oahu families recommend to family when they visit.

Moving to Hawaii was probably one of the most stressful events in my life. The housing we thought was lined up for us before we arrived, wasn't and we spent the first three weeks hotel hopping. After some almost comedic BAD experiences (see other reviews) I finally was able to reserve us for 30 days at the Aqua Oasis...which, due to more housing issues, had to be extended another week. Initially, I wasn't that impressed with the hotel. It's right in the heart of Waikiki, but if you blink, you'd miss it. I drove around the block twice before finally seeing where it was. The room was clean and we had a nice large balcony....again, initially, I wasn't that impressed because our balcony overlooked dumpsters, a Korean food joint and a parking lot - BUT on Friday nights, we had an excellent view of the fireworks that go off at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Another negative is the noise level at this hotel. It's next to a Karaoke bar, plus Moose McGillycuddy's is two doors down and Kelly O'Neill's is across the street. If the AC was off, you could hear music until pretty late at night...especially for some reason, in the bathroom. However, the longer we stayed at the hotel, the more we liked it. We were centrally located in Waikiki - basically across the street from PF Changs, Hard Rock Cafe, great shopping and just a short stroll to the beach, the zoo, or a longer jaunt to the Ala Moana (they do offer shuttle service, but I preferred to walk). As a runner, I LOVED the proximity of the hotel to the running circuit around the Ala Wai canal. They have beach towels that you can check out and beach chairs, and there's always wonderfully refreshing lemon infused ice water in the lobby awaiting guests at the end of a hot, Hawaiian day of sightseeing. The staff were all friendly and helpful and endeared us to them by telling us, after we had been there for about three weeks, that we were "like family". At the end of it all, though we are SO happy to finally have a home, we were a little sad to leave. Our overall experience there was very positive and given the chance, I would stay there again.

Well located in downtown Honolulu and a block from Waikiki beach, this hotel has friendly helpful staff but the rooms are smallish and the balcony tiny. The wall mounted air conditioner above the bed is also noisy and can't be turned down to a quiet low level for sleep. Breakfast is provided but consists of juice, spongy bread that can be toasted, appalling pastries and coffee. Despite the gripes, we'd stay here again as it's a friendly personable hotel.

We stayed in Honolulu for 3 nights before we got on our Hawaiian cruise. So happy I picked this hotel. Location was great. It's within a 5 - 10 minute walk to the beach. Why spend $$$ more to be on the beach when you can use that money towards other things, like in our case, we rented a car. Used the car to literally travel ALL over Oahu. The money saved using Aqua Oasis was best spent on a car so we can experience this pretty island. We did so many excursions on our own with the car. Got to go to Pearl Harbor (meanwhile if you pay for an excursion from Honolulu, it's easy $40 something a person). We went to Hanauma Bay. Went to hike Diamond Head. Went to Pipeline beach at the north shore. Aqua Oasis lets you borrow their beach towels and beach chairs. We took them to Waikiki beach with us and packed them in the car when we went to Hanauma Bay. The towels are small as are the beach chairs (they are the just sitting kind) but they are good enough and it's awesome to have that option. It's honestly the little touches like this that make your stay pleasant. The room was newly renovated, very clean. HUGE bathroom. Comfy bed. AC blasted. The view off the balcony was blahhh but can't complain. Love having the balcony to air dry our bathing suits and gym/hiking clothes. The service at the front desk was pleasant, polite. Only downsides are the price of their valet parking. Very pricey but there is a parking lot located off to the side and behind the hotel, where you pay this machine. Different pay structures based on time of day. Still somewhat pricey but worth it.Also odd is that when you bring in the beach towels back to get your "towel card", they make you go back to the entrance where you have to stick it in their hamper. That was kind of odd, but it's fine. Also - I sort of liked the lobby. It was basically outside and they built this "covered" area with plants. Pretty cool.Lots of souvenir shops nearby and restaurants. Very close to Waikiki beach.For the price, feel comfortable knowing you'll be pleased with this hotel in Honolulu.

When I stayed at the Aqua Oasis in downtown Honolulu for 5 nights in early September 2014, I found things to be very pleasant and quite adequate, without having to spend over $200/night. It had a superb location, and was quiet, with a nice patio for the continental breakfast, and for meeting others. When I had an emergency plumbing situation in my room, it was promptly taken care of, although I did have to switch rooms. I was upgraded to a better room -- and given basically a one-night's credit for my trouble. How nice of the staff to be so accommodating. I would definitely stay there again - on my next visit. It would be nice if they had a computer(s) for email or printing boarding passes - my only issue really.

On this business trip, I arrived late from New Zealand & had miscalculated the time zone change & booked my room for the following day. Unfortunately, no rooms were available for an extra night....but no worries, Kevin was on midnight shift, and he kindly called other hotel. I got one of the last affordable rooms at a nearby hotel. I can't say enough about how helpful Kevin was to this tired, baggage-weary traveller. The next day I returned to AO to a clean, roomy, and comfortable room on the 9th floor for 3 work days. Service was flawless, and front desk staff always pleasant and accommodating. I plan to return to AO in a couple of months!

This hotel is given rave reviews on this site. If cheap is what you need in Hawaii, then this place isn't bad. This is NOT a full service hotel. The pictures belie the actual condition of the place, which can best be described as "hagard with a face lift." The room was not bad, old with some attempts to fix it up. Once outside the room in the open air hallways, you can see wallpaper peeling off the walls and the '50's feel of the place. The location is good, parking so-so, amentities nearly nill ("free" breakfast is bread and a toaster and cut up fruit). No bar, no restaurant.

I was in search of a hotel that was clean, safe, convenient, and affordable for our mother-daughter trip. I've used TripAdvisor for many years with much success and this time was no different. This ended up being a perfect match for us. This was my mom's first trip to Hawaii, and she said on more than one occasion how much she loved the hotel. The staff is very friendly, and we truly felt the Aloha Spirit. We were able to walk to the beach, shops, and restaurants with no problem. We enjoyed breakfast each morning (especially the fresh pineapple). It's not extensive by any means, but it had all that we needed to get our day started. Our room was very spacious, the beds were comfortable, and having the balcony to dry our clothes was helpful. There wasn't much of a view, but we drove around for that. Last year my husband and I stayed at a chain hotel on Kalakaua Ave., and while we did have a view of the ocean, it was louder, much more expensive and not as personable. This was a charming little hotel, and I would definitely stay here again.

My partner and I were travelling to Hawaii last minute and decided to take a risk with Aqua Oasis. Best decision ever!We had the ultimate experience with staff at Aqua Oasis. Hotel is affordable, conveniently located off the main street in Waikiki. There are nearby restaurants, bars and shopping. The room was clean and service was fabulous. Highly recommend staying here and no doubts we will be back. If only they had a bigger pool!! Nevertheless the beach is less than a 5 minute walk. Better than any pool!There is a courtesy shuttle to Ala Moana center every 30 minutes. You also get a free breakfast each morning.Thanks for the experience Aqua Oasis.- Vanessa & Adam (Australia)

A wonderful clean, super friendly place to stay in Waikiki ! Loved the open air lobby, the turtle pond, and koi pond , the easy going light breakfast available in the lobby and the location in the heart of all the action! Walk to everything!
user_name:
Adele A
Renton, Washington, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights and found the staff helpful and very friendly, nothing was beyond them, The room was clean and the bathroom very large. We stayed on the Lewers St side and had no view but didn't go there for the view from the hotel. Only 5 minutes from the beach, restaurants and transport. Nice boutique style hotel and would definitely recommend them and stay there again.

I read a lot of reviews of this place before booking and it was very mixed but my wife and I decided to try the place out and form our own opinion. This place is a gem in my opinion. The staff is so friendly and helpful. It's clean (a very important thing for us). The location is perfect, far enough from the high volume of tourist but still centrally located to be walking distance to pretty well everything.I won't lie, view is lacking mostly because it's an older hotel and pretty well everything around it has grown much higher, but seriously, how many times do you spent in the hotel and look at the view. You go out of the hotel to enjoy the view, at least we do. We spent a total of 7 nights and in 3 different rooms. 1 night prior to our cruise and then 6 nights after the cruise. We were in a suite with a kitchen on the 8th floor the first night facing south east (801). 2 nights facing opposite side on the 3rd (302) and then on the 8th again (802), none were bad.Free internet, free continental breakfast (loved the daily fresh pineapple) and on Thursdays they have live entertainment from 3:30 pm to 4:30 pm with snack and drinks.We will definitely stay there again.

The hotel is in a good location and has been recently renovated.The rooms were clean but small and the decor was nice. We had a "King suite", not sure if i would pay the extra for the suite (I didn't see the size of the other rooms so I cannot compare).The continental breakfast that was included is very basic and there is no restaurant / dedicated eating area, it is set up in the lobby area each morning.

We had book a cruise from Vancouver to Hawaii and our last stop was in Honolulu on Sept 16. I have been to the Aqua Oasis last March but it was called Aqua Joy at that time. Was not disappointed. This time around i brought me husband and he was this was the best location ever, which was easy access to the bus stops and his all time favourite place to dine (freshly made udon place). Dexter had upgraded my room and then later gave me my cookies and chocolates and water. BONUS!! One day at 3:30-4:30 i guess you could call it cocktail hour and Dexter was serving up drinks and snacks and there was a guy playing his guitar and singing, just wonderful was to relax. I was sad to see the jacuzzi tubs all gone but it was still fine and the heated toilet seats were something to get use too. The upgrades on the decor was fine also and this time around the garage trucks weren't as noisy,free WIFI worked in the rooms but before only in the lobby.Was disappointed to see that the international market was demolished but it said it would rebuilt. We had friends stay at the Aqua Wave and they said that this hotel was much quieter ( construction at the international market) and was so much faster to get to the main street. Save your money for shopping/sightseeing and stay at Aqua Oasis you will not be disappointed and as for the people that complain about the breakfast, its FREE and you wont see other hotels offering you breakfast. There are many restaurants to serve you breakfast, id rather have their breakfast and then go out for a nice lunch.

I actually booked another hotel and was then informed that they were full, so was given this one instead. We weren't disappointed. It's a great location for the shops, restaurants and beach - all a 5 minute walk away. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was great, really spacious, with a kitchen and all the amenities you'd need. If I was going to find fault, I'd say the breakfast choice should be extended as there's really not much in it.... But the stuff that is there is good and does the job, the coffee is great. I don't think any of the rooms had a good view unless I'm mistaken, ours faced Lewers St where there was building work going on on the street and started early, but the glass is well sound proofed so we weren't disturbed. The valet parking is $30 per night, but on the side road you can park for 24 hours for $20

We moved to this hotel after staying 3 nights at Aqua's Hokele Suites, about one block away. The previous hotel was a disaster. Aqua Oasis made up for it. Nice rooms, good service, very clean, free in-room wifi, and continental breakfast as a bonus. We spent our last 8 nights at the Oasis and it was the best move we could have made. The room was large and clean with a really big bathroom that was all newly renovated. Couldn't have asked for more in a room. Only problem was that they were not amenable to a late check-out, which I believe they probably could have accommodated, but we made do.

I stayed at aqua oasis for my honeymoon from sep 9 checked out on sep 11 2014. On sep 8 I went there to to check out the rooms and met a fine young man name Dexter, I immediately nicknamed him "mr aloha" he made me feel at home right away. He showed me a room and offered a upgrade because I informed him its my honeymoon. The suite i had was 601 it had a king size bed, fully stocked kitchen with full size fridge, a sofa and it was just great. The location although far from the beach (10 min walk) was great very central near all the shopping and eating places. On sep 9 they delivered chocolates and Korbel champage to the room what a nice touch. I also worked with a young man named Kevin he was great also made me feel at home as well. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel and plan to comeback with my kids we can save lots of money using to kitchen for our meals instead of eating out. thanks Dex and Kev aloha see u guys soon!!!

I have just returned from Hawaii and I feel compelled to share my experience. Having stayed at numerous hotels in Waikiki over the years, never quite making it to the 5 star ones, I was pleasantly surprised to find this little gem. It is more of a boutique style, being 2 buildings, 8 levels only. It has the most beautiful outdoor 'lobby' area, that has lush planting and a wonderful seating area, including a modest sized pool. It has a real tropical/island feel to it.The staff were very accommodating, Dexter the guests services manager was wonderful to deal with, as were the rest of the team.The room was an impressive size, having 2 queen beds and ample room to move about, better than most hotel rooms that's for sure. It has been recently refurbished so it still looks pretty good and has a nice contemporary style to it.I would highly recommend this hotel and will be sure to stay there again.Steve

Spent 2 nights at this hotel in August 2014. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was large and so was the bathroom. The location was great--close to beach, restaurants, and shopping. Bedding and linens were good quality and it was nice to have a balcony. The lobby area was nicely furnished and was a great place for meeting the other travelers in our party. We were very happy with this hotel!

Only a ten Minute walk to beach,the friendly, helpful staff made for a most relaxing stay.Breakfast was muffins, fruit,eggs and toast.While the view over Lewers St was nothing exciting,it didn't matter.Across the road from Trolley departures and around corner from The Bus stops.Five minute walk to major shopping and eating precincts.

Took my family (4 total) to this clean, modern boutique hotel as an alternative to the expensive beachfront hotels in Waikiki. Friendly, attentive, and accommodating staff. The rooms were recently remodeled with modern furniture, bathroom fixtures. Just a short block to the Royal Hawaiian Mall and beautiful Waikiki beaches. We were completely satisfied and would consider staying here again!

My Wife and I stayed here for 6 nights late May and I have to say " why didn,t I find this place sooner. We booked the executive suite, top Floor and was very pleasantly surprised, Bdroom, Loungeroom, kitchen/dining room and Bathroom. Any problems with the room were quickly fixed with no fuss. Continental Breakfast was very adequate for us, Juices, Coffee or Tea, Toast,Jams,pastries and fresh cut Fruit. Location of Hotel was fantastic, just across from the DFS and Trolley station, short walk along Lewers to some of the best restuarants on that street.Great Location, great Staff. We will be back and have recommended to our family and friends as the place to stay.

Great , smaller hotel , in a very convenient location with some of the best customer service I have ever experienced at any hotel , period.Give them a try , you will not be disappointed !!!Dexter at front desk was awesome

The hotel was hard to find, but once we found it, it served us well. I like the idea that this hotel only had 8 floors - makes it more cozy. Rooms were very nice. Staff gave us excellent service. Continental breakfast was really nice as well. We were at this hotel only overnight as we were on Oahu for funeral services, but i would have like to have stayed longer. i would definately stay at this hotel on the next trip.

The rooms were nice and cozy. Very large for the price we paid. The bath is HUGE and beautiful. As soon as you walk into the lobby, it's not like the big name hotels with bell-hoppers in suits. You're welcomed with aloha shirts and relaxed service. The lobby is stone tiled with a nice fountain that just adds to the cozy ambiance. Everything from the lobby to the elevators to the hallways are very quaint and unique. It is a combination of both modern and traditional. The floors are tiled and well maintained, while the hallways have dimmed colorful lights that remind you of a professional Bed and Breakfast hotel. Once in the room, it has all the hotel room necessities with two beds, a desk with a radio/alarm clock, a dresser and a sofa. It's the bathroom that exceeded our expectations. It has high class bathtub, with those kinds of toilets that can clean your butt. Overall, for a bunch of teens, it was a stay to remember. Amazing.
user_name:
Skyler S
Waipahu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Very friendly and professional staff. Very knowledgable of military related PCS moves. Rooms are clean and nicely renovated. We had a beautiful city view facing away from Lewers St. A bit noisy especially once the bars close but it is the heart of Waikiki. Breakfast consists of Danish pastries, toast and, if you're up early enough, eggs. I would definitely recommend this hotel due to its exceptional staff members and it's location.

We stayed there for a night after a wedding in Waikiki. The staff was very friendly, in a genuine hawaiian style. We were upgraded to a spacious and nicely decorated suite. The hotel offered complimentary breakfast, which was rather spartan, offering a limited options of fruit, bread, juice and coffee. Not a problem. There are plenty of options just a few steps away. The hotel is so centrally located that we had went for walk on Waikiki both after the wedding and in the morning. We recommended it for couples or for solo and business travelers. There is not much space for children to run around, which is fine if you plan to stay most of the day enjoying the beach, shopping of sight seeing.

One of the first things you notice right away is the staff, they are TOP notch!! Everyone is so helpful & wonderful!! Rooms are modern and clean. Great balcony, to sit & people watch. Pool, nice & quiet. Breakfast is not iHop, which is just across the street, but Great. Everything I need to start my day, Coffee, eggs toast, fresh fruit, and juice. Also, the unlimited water in the lobby all day long is great!! Keep doing what your doing guys, because it great!! Love the Aqua Oasis!!

Excellent staff. We moved from Aqua Wave to Aqua Oasis and were blown away by how courteous the staff was. The Jr Suite is plenty big for me, my wife and our two children. (5,3). Real pleased with the Oasis

This Hotel had the kindest, respectful and most helpful workers ever. I have never met such an EXCELLENT STAFF in any hotel that I have ever been to. Excellent, Clean, Fancy and Spacious rooms. The Beds are really, really comfortable. Also, I needed some help getting some papers printed from online for a business matter and in less than 2 minutes the Staff had the papers ready for me with no charge at all. The Hotel is also within walking distance to Waikiki beach and many fine stores and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel if anyone is visiting Hawaii for vacation and/or on business. Thank you for your services.

The Aqua Oasis is the 'Must Stay' place in Honolulu. Not only was my hotel room clean and recently remodeled they also provided a danish and juice breakfast every morning. Most of all the service was the best I have experienced. Special thanks to Dexter the manager, Steve, Yasu, and Mike all of whom made our stay one to remember!

We stayed here for two nights and was very happy with the hotel. We liked the open-air environment in the lobby area. There are free apples for guests to enjoy on the check-in counter. Dexter was very helpful in checking us in. The room was very spacious for the four of us. The bathroom was also very spacious too. There is a safe in the room to keep your valuables. The WiFi connection was pretty good. The location is very close to everything. iHop is right at the corner. Breakfast was included and we enjoyed the sweet pineapples and oranges every morning. Ice water is always available in the lobby area. We had a great time here. We wish we can stay longer!

Clean, tidy hotel. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Comfortable beds, great rooms with everything you need including microwave and sink for cooking facilities. I couldn't recommend this hotel any better. Came from a 5 star to this hotel and felt far more comfortable and appreciative to all staff!

We stayed here for 9 nights.Initial impression was that the building was very old. Upon check in, we found the room to be sufficient. It looks recently renovated though still showing its age. We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was a good size. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean and tidy.The breakfast was almost the same everyday but no complaints. I think the best part of the hotel was the staff. Dexter and Michael were very friendly and did their best to ensure that our stay was a comfortable one.

We stayed here for a total of 8 nights and were very happy with this hotel. Staff, especially Dexter, were very helpful. It is in walking distance of all major attractions in Waikiki. Rooms were clean and serviced daily. We were a group of four adults and found our room a good size. Would stay here again. The breakfast could be improved a little, but it is still sufficient to get your day off to a good start. Would highly recommend this hotel, we had a great stay.

We thought we would stay in this hotel since they had a great price and the hotel seemed to be in a good location. Property: The rooms were small but upgraded. Enjoyed the decor and it was cute. There were one small cleanliness issue in the bathroom on the door. There was a balcony in the room which was nice but it overlooks a construction site so not much to see here. They didn't really do much renovation to the lobby area and it looked more like a converted pool deck. The bed in the room was very comfortable and the air conditioning was working well which is really what you need in Hawaii. Internet was fairly good.Breakfast: There was a breakfast that we didn't take advantage of. It stops serving at 9 AM and since we were on holiday, we didn't have plans to get up and go down for breakfast in a hurry. For a resort, one would assume that this amenity would be more suited to visitors and not business folks.I stayed here due to the rave reviews regarding service, but I found that the service was absolutely mediocre at best. We checked in with Kevin who didn't smile once during the whole experience. We called down to ask another agent about activities that didn't involve much walking and was told about hiking trails nearby. I found the service to be uncaring or that they didn't listen/read their guests. The staff constantly shout interactions with each other across the lobby area which is quite alarming.Overall, the hotel is okay and not sure if I would stay again. Maybe give it one more shot to see if the service standards would be at the level everyone else described.

Excellent hotel and location. The staff was very helpful and goes above and beyond to make your stay excellent. Mike and Kevin went above and beyond to find me a shuttle to the airport. The room was very nice and clean and the beds are very comfortable. Great location and hotel! Checked in on July 6 and stayed a week and the Aqua Oasis couldn't have been better. I live on Oahu and stayed here before a move to Big Island and this place will be a top recommendation to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Waikiki.

This was the first hotel I ever been to with the friendliest and most helpful staff.....that is a big plus for me. That's why I will come back. They welcomed me with open arms and aloha even though I am kamaaina. They were so helpful, nice, and polite. The staff here is what make people like me not minding spending the extra buck for an adequate room. The staff make u wanna come back. Maika'i no.

My two kids and I checked in to the Aqua Oasis on June 29 for a two nights stay. Upon our arrival, Dexter and Mike took great care of us with a warm welcome and a fabulous room. Our room was a junior suite, very comfortable for for the three of us with a king bed, pull out sofa, nice bathroom, and large lanai and kitchen. The hotel is perfectly located, a couple blocks from Waikiki Beach and in the thick of amazing shopping and great restaurants. The included breakfast was simple, but got the day started just right. The hotel and staff were great; a super value for the money...I definitely recommend the Aqua Oasis.

Moderately priced hotel. When you walk in you feel like you are on a tropical island instead of a big city. Yet right out your door is Shopping, restaurants are all within a block or two, and most important beaches, which is hopefully why you came to Hawaii, right? They provide a towel and beach chair for you to check out and take to the beach. About an 8 min walk including the traffic lights. The staff is super friendly, helpful, and joyful. The breakfast is pretty basic, including of course hot Kona coffee and fresh pineapple ( I saw them unloading them from the truck one day) You can sit in the hanging basket swings and sip your coffee. The downside is maybe the abandoned construction site on Lewers St. If that is an issue for you ask for a room not facing Lewers.

We spent our honeymoon here for 6 days. This hotel was great. It was really close to everything. staff was really helpful with everything. Dexter at the front desk was da man! we got hooked up with some champagne and chocolates and room upgrade. We saved so much money staying here and didnt have to deal with crowds or waiting for everything. Breakfast was limited but would hold me over till lunch. The koi pond in the back was really chill spot to relax. I don't think you will be disappointed here. Ho bra tanks Dexter c u next time ya cuz

Wakiki action just down the street easy access all over Alamoana Shopping Center maybe 20 minutes walk or 5 minutes drive! Rooms were comfy, AC was nice n cold, workers were friendly n cool MAHALO Dexter n da gang for taking care of me n my family! ALOHAS!!!

Very friendly and helpful staff made you feel at home. Newly renovated rooms were clean and up to date. I loved the modern style of the whole room. The location was within perfect walking distance for any activity - night or day - without having to deal with the major crowd. It was so nice, I didn't want to leave! I will definitely come back to this hotel in the future.

The location is superb for a non-beach location. The service is very well managed as the housekeepers, valets and front desk personnel were genuinely nice. The continental breakfast was better than expected with hardboiled eggs in addition to fruit and various rolls including crescent rolls. The ambiance of the lobby was very comfortable with a pond with turtles and another with koi. All of this contributed to our stay of 5 nights being very enjoyable and an excellent value.

Spent 10 days at Aqua Oasis and couldn't be happier. The rooms are updated and chic. The staff was beyond helpful. Mike was my bell-hop & valet and was friendly and professional. He knew me by name after the first day. The housekeeping was wonderful as well and even left me cookies on my last night. I had a king-size bed on the 5th floor. The room was equipped with a 40" flat screen and PS3 along with your standard telephone, alarm, blow dryer, iron, mini-fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. The location is right off the Waikiki Beachwalk and less than a block from shopping, restaurants, and ABC stores (convenience stores). Also if you are PCSing to anywhere west of Waikiki you will be traveling west each morning which makes traffic not bad as most traffic is coming east to Honolulu/Waikiki in the mornings. Mahalo Aqua Oasis staff for making my stay pleasurable!

The rooms are very spacious due to recent renovations and the professional photos are accurate, rooms were very quiet, clean and comfortable, the hotel is located in the middle of the Lewer Street between Kuhio and Kalakaua Ave, if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle and prefer a quieter place to stay then this would be a perfect selection, the open lobby provide a very relaxing atmosphere (locate in the center of the hotel complex) and also a very acommodating sun deck for sun bathing instead of the beach, for those of you on the go there is a continental breakfast of fresh pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juice with a big pitcher of refreshing lemon water to quench your thirst, my family and I felt like Kama'aina instead of vacationer during our stay, would not hesitate to stay here again, highly recommend to tripadvisor travelersMahalo nui loa to Ryan, Dexter, Michael, Steven and the entire Oasis staff for a wonderful stay and a Aloha and Ohana spirits from arrival to departure

Newly renovated rooms are chic and comfortable. The front desk staff was so incredibly nice and accommodating. I spoke with them several times before and during my stay, and each time I was highly impressed. The location, while not offering the best view, is very conveniently located to pretty much everything in Waikiki. And last but not least ... just an overall great value.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Oasis. The front desk hospitality was awesome and very accommodating. Was convenient to have valet parking and Steve right there waiting in front of the hotel for you. There was a big pitcher of refreshing lemon water sitting in the open lobby area ready to quench your thirst in the warm afternoon as you make your way up to the rooms. Rooms were very comfortable, quiet, clean with comfy beds, a huge bathtub and toilet with bidet and seat warmer, ooooh! Loved the kitchenette, sitting area and the big lanai to catch some fresh air and just people watch below you. Most definitely will return to the Oasis and highly recommend it as it is close to the excitement and activities around Waikiki Beachwalk. Mahalo Dexter, your aloha is the greatest to make our stay so enjoyable, and from one kama'aina to another I will only say, "a hui hou!"

Thanks to Travel Zoo we snagged a great deal at the Honolulu Aqua Oasis Hotel. My hubby and I arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon of May 15, 2014. The first thing we noticed was how friendly the staff was. Check in was a breeze. When we got to our room, there were several yummy surprises waiting on the dresser as well as two cold bottles of water. That's what I call hospitality. Even at the chain hotels we normally stay at, you rarely get water waiting in the fridge for you that is free. The king-size room was an adequate size, was clean, and the bed comfortable. Space in the regular king size bedroom would have been tight if you were staying long-term. The bathroom amenities were very nice and the quality of the towels was nice too. Besides the lack of storage, which wasn't a problem for us staying two nights at a time, the only other thing was there was only one elevator. However, having said that, we never had to wait long. The hotel also offers a continental breakfast. We are big breakfast eaters so we normally went elsewhere. The hotel is very close to restaurants, shopping, the beach, and bus lines. We did not rent a car, but used the bus when we wanted to go further away. Dexter was particularly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. My sister had flight problems and was delayed in arriving a whole day. When I explained the situation to the hotel management, they treated her and her hubby extra special. We departed the hotel on May 17th to go on a cruise of the islands. We returned to the hotel for two additional nights after the cruise. Again, we had yummy surprises and cold water in the room. The only thing that we didn't particularly like was when we left. My hubby wanted to use the luggage cart to bring down our luggage and the bellman would not let him take it. We did use the bellman's service each time we arrived, and the first time we departed. Once we brought the luggage down by ourselves, Dexter and the bellman were nice enough to help us get it to the taxi. All in all a good stay with friendly staff. You can't go wrong for the value at this hotel.

I really wasn't expecting much because of the rate, but when we checked in, the level of customer service we felt was that of a five star resort. The pool and lounge area were very modern feeling. The location is convenient to food, bars and shopping. The room that we had was very large and the tub was perfect for a soak. I will stay there every time that I visit Waikiki.

I stayed at the Aqua Oasis during May 9th through May 16th this year. This was my first time and had no exceptions. When I arrived the staff at the front desk where very welcoming with that Aloha spirit! My sister and I were checked in right away no hassles and Dexter that works at the front desk was nice enough to upgrade us to a bigger room. The room was spacious as well as the bathroom. The room and the bed were very comfortable. Every morning downstairs there was complementary continental breakfast which was very nice. The hotel was 2 blocks from the beach, very close and nice walk. This hotel is located next to many restaurants and the main strip of Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a good hotel for a good price. I will be coming back to Oahu soon and I will stay here again!

Despite the parking situation and fee, our stay was very pleasant. The location was great; couple bars on the same street, main waikiki attractions were minutes away (walking distance). There is a karaoke bar located in the hotel. They have a rather small poll but you do have the option of going to anot her hotel for a bigger pool. However, when in hawaii, why go to the pool. The beach is just minutes away.

Stayed at Aqua Oasis for two days after my company training in Honolulu. Check in was a breeze but did not get to see my room until the evening since I am bringing my associate to the airport for her flight back. Room is spacious, clean and quiet, There are two wings in the hotel and all rooms have balcony. This is a block away from the beach so don't expect a beach view balcony. Location is terrific, right next door to DFS. Walking distance to everywhere within the Waikiki area and street is very safe no matter what time you get home. The only hassle is it is valet only parking. Pool is small but you don't come here for the pool since the beach is just a block away. Staff is amazing. I am already in my car after checking out when I realized I forgot my tablet in the bathroom. I quickly ran to the front desk and staff handed me back my room key. Found my tablet. As soon as the elevator opens up, my valet driver was on his way to see me because I left my phone while checking out. That was going over and beyond the his responsibility. I am definitely going to stay again in this hotel on my next visit.

My family of four stayed in one of the junior suites at the Aqua Oasis for 45 days during our move to Oahu. We had a great experience across the board. The hotel is in an ideal location that is within walking distance of the beach and most major restaurants. All of the rooms had recently been renovated. The upgrades to the lounge area contributed to the relaxed atmosphere.The entire staff was friendly and helpful...they treated us like family throughout our stay. The valet drivers not only took care of our vehicles, but they also provided a wealth of knowledge of the area. In one instance the battery in our car died and the valet driver used his own vehicle to jump start our car...then he gave us directions to the nearest shop that could service our vehicle. The maid service was very good and the their staff members were extremely friendly. They knew knew that we had four people staying in the room and provided additional pillows and blankets without us having to ask. The guys who put out the breakfast every morning were very thoughtful. Breakfast was typically not served until 7am. When they saw that I had to leave by 645am to take my son to school, they started serving the food 15 minutes early so that we could grab a quick bite to eat.The front desk staff was awesome. Not only did they ensure that we had a pleasant stay every day, but they absolutely looked out for our safety. There was a tsunami watch during our stay. As soon as the watch was issued, the hotel manager worked with the front desk to move my family to a higher floor just in case something did happen. We were not overly concerned about the tsunami watch, but it was nice to know that the hotel staff was looking out for us. My children had a blast hanging out at the hotel. The front desk staff would always talk to my children and routinely give them high fives. They even let my children feed the fish and turtles on most days. We absolutely recommend this hotel and will stay there again when it comes time to move.Ask for Dexter, he will take care of you!

We stayed here for a week (May 9-16), it was in a great location not far from the beach or restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Dexter was great he helped us out on our last day with a late check out due to our flight time. The rooms were newly renovated just a few weeks before we arrived. They are spacious, clean and pretty. The different colored lights above the doors into the rooms in the hall ways were a very nice touch to the hotel. Made me feel like I was in a Miami resort. They have a nice continental breakfast every morning, the front lobby had these neat oval hanging chairs that were fun to swing around in and they have a beautiful and relaxing koi pond to sit next to if you're a smoker. Over all this hotel was great I would definitely recommend this place to others. I am already planning to stay here again in August.

Not recommended for honeymooners, resort lovers or luxury hotel fans. But great for those on a budget who want the best room for the price. If you want to browse some of the best "high end" shopping in Honolulu and eat at some great restaurants this is really an ideal location, We stayed here for part of our trip to Oahu and really enjoyed it. Also, it's a very easy walk to the beach. There are some exceptional places to eat and relax nearby - like the restaurants at the Halekulani. There are no private beaches on Oahu so all of the resorts have to allow public access. From this hotel to the beach is, in our opinion, one of the best beach areas around for relaxing. This hotel is small - a "boutique" hotel. But the rooms are very comfortable and quiet. It's an older facility; but it's been well taken care of and kept up. The beds are extremely comfortable, the towels are good quality and you get really nice soaps and lotions. The pool area is very small and it's outdoors by the front desk. The breakfast is pretty basic (sweet rollls, juice and fresh fruit). The staff was wonderful! They wanted to make our stay pleasant and comfortable - and it was and we'd stay here again for sure.

We ended up staying at this property on recommendation from their sister property just down the road which hadn't been fully renovated yet and still definitely needs some love. the manager sent us over to talk to Dexter the manager at the Aqua Oasis, he took us to view a room before we decided we would stay to make sure we felt comfortable. We walked into the room and it still smelled of freshly cut wood! Everything was so beautiful and modern and new, we instantly felt comfortable and at ease. The staff were so welcoming and accommodating which made our stay that much better. We were a young couple so we liked that the location was right on the strip with a few local bars we could hop to and being one street back from the main drag it was quiet and not as busy for the nights we didn't feel like going out!Continental breakfast was always fresh, and the property includes free towels and beach chairs everyday! BONUS! only downside is if you have a car it's about $25 USD a day to park on their property When we left the hotel, we were left with some macadamia nut cookies and a hand written note from our housekeeper AndreaCheers Aqua! We loved it!

From the moment we stepped into the Aqua Oasis we were treated like royality. The staff are so friendly. After a day of "travel nightmare" the owner gave us a complimentary upgrade to the Presidential suite. What a wonderful surprise. The room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable. Complimentary Macadamia Nuts & cookies were a nice touch.

Iam really satisfied with this hotel . Every things is pretty good and its located is really in the mid of pretty Waikiki,so you do not want to ride bus or even rent car because u r in the center of everything. The room is excellent and quite. Finally I want to mention about the greatest guest service that name Maria . She is really honest and welcome to the gusts and she is helpful. I strongly suggest you guys to stay there .

I will say that the aloha spirit really shines in the staff.They go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable.The woman that took care of my room was named Conchita and she was so helpful.Two of the valets,Mike and Mark are a couple of super nice guys.I watched them not only with me but with all the guests and they are so helpful and super nice.I couldn't remember the names at the front desk but they were so helpful with everything I needed.For the price and the location you can't beat the hospitality and the aloha spirit.I go back to Hawaii every year and will always stay at the oasis and will recommend it to anyone.The Oasis used to be called the Waikiki joy hotel.

For what we paid, we got so much in return. Great staff, felt very welcomed and excellent amenties-a full kitchen (minus a dishwasher), spacious living area and a very clean bathroom. I would recommend this for familes, as the kitchen really helped as I have a 18 month old daughter who is fussy with food! We would definately consider staying here again. The thank you note for staying and the cookies were a really nice touch on our last day at the hotel.

Excellent for families as good room size with full kitchenette. Very efficient and friendly staff who go out of there way to assist clientele and accommodate their needs. Clean with good amenities. In a very central position close to all Waikiki attractions. Would stay at this facility again in a heart beat.
